I also own the pros and like the sound quality better on those and are more comfortable, also the pros transparency mode sound more clear over the galaxy buds plus ambient mode.  the galaxy earbuds make my ears hurt. Overall, I'll recommend getting the pros if you are an ios user but if you are not looking to spend that kind of money go with these they are a great alternative.

So I mainly bought these for work to use on my walkie( I'm an undercover security guard and I don't like the wire hanging from my ear) My goal was to purchase a wireless transmitter, hook it up to the walkie and connect the Buds+ to the transmitter. So I did that, I bought a $20 transmitter and while at work within the first 5-10 minutes when people would talk on their walkies the Buds+ would distort their voices almost robotic/"bit-crushed" like. The only way to stop it was to disconnect the buds and reconnect them. I ended up buying an Airfly transmitter which is like $45 and It still distorted the sound within minutes of being used. My coworker has the same transmitter but the only difference is that he uses the first gen Apple Airpods and he doesn't get that distortion as I do. I've reset the Buds+ and it still happened, I used my girlfriend's Buds+ which I bought with mine and it does it as well. I ended up trying my Bose Soundsports and the noise was gone, only issue is that these earbuds are too bulky and have a wire attached to each bud. I contacted Samsung and all they told me was to contact the company and let them know about the issue. I'm hoping it can be fixed when the next update kicks in.

Ok ok... So I initially wrote up a review on these earbuds when I first got them.... and when I first received these I didn't do a couple things that I should have.When you get these you have to first and foremost update the firmware, and choose the proper sized ear tip for your ear. I just put them in immediately like I did my Jabra 75 t's, and expected magic. Well I will say, even after firmware update and ear tip adjustment, these certainly do compete with the Jabra 75t sound quality. You have to go into settings and choose your preferred EQ as well, but on e you find a top that inserts these correctly, the sound is clearer than 75t's and the bass is more impactful in the galaxy +'s. I believe the Jabra 75 t's have a more compressive output on the speaker and that's what lens to it being a powerhouse earbud in regards to booming bass and thump of music. But I will say, I had frustration with my Jabra 75 t's losing connection every so often even after multiple firmware updates. When I put the Galaxy pluses on they immediately sync to my phone or whatever I'm connecting to, which turns out to be a huge improvement in my experience with bluetooth earbuds in general. The touch controls are actually growing on me after doing lawn work and not having a clean hand and having to use my forearm to tap the sensor which is very responsive and pretty stable. Overall I was one of these jump to the gun not on board Jabra 75t people that didn't want to sacrifice any loss of audio magnitude, but as I've been using these Google Galaxy plus has I've come to appreciate the ease-of-use in regards to connecting to anything seamlessly, and not having to worry loss of connection, or having to resync.

These headphones sound great but they have so many other issues. When you go to adjust them in your ears there's buttons on the outside and it usually shuts it off or skip said or does something funky. I'm so happy they were having problem and I sent back.  I had them for almost one month. I've researched all the wireless headphones and this is my choice and it was such a flop really. Soon as I put him into my soon as I put my phone into my pocket it made the headphone so static I when I was talking with someone on the phone. Anyway I went back I research and I went with Sony wireless headphones for only a $100 on Amazon and they have been amazing they don't have all the features but I don't run in all the problems with the buttons on the outside always canceling the sound stopping it.

These are great buds.  It's great that they come with extra wing tips and ear pieces.  For some reason my right ear is much different than my left ear when it comes to fitting of the buds.  I had to mix and match different pieces to get the right fit.At my job I need to have one ear free so I only wear one at a time. So I really can't give 5nstarsbfornnoise cancellation bc I don't use that feature.

I got a call from someone who mentioned that she had just gotten these. I asked her how they worked for phone calls, as I had never had luck with ANY brand. She said, clear as you please, what do you think? She was talking into them and it was perfect. I ordered some the same day, for my Galaxy 10, and so far nobody knows I'm using them or reports any problems hearing or understanding me. They also sound perfect on my side, and fit beautifully.LOVE THEM!!! WORTH THE MONEY. Oh, and music sounds great on them also üòÅ

Excellent buds for the price. While they don't have true active noise cancellation, I prefer the passive cancellation I get from the gel buds. The selection of different gels is very useful to ensure the perfect fit. I accidentally fell asleep with them one night because they were so comfortable and I woke up with them still in my ears, and at 12%. Not bad. If they had fallen out, the find my earbuds feature would have been very helpful to utilize. Battery life of the case isn't as good as some other brands, but you could always charge it while you listen so it's worth it for a smaller case. Battery life of the buds themselves is excellent, and to me that is what matters most. These paired seamlessly to my Galaxy Note 9, Galaxy Watch Active 2, and my Surface Pro 7 with no hassle. While my phone can't take advantage of their wireless charging case, it is convenient to leave them on my phone's charging pad, putting little effort into charging them. If you get them, I recommend getting a carrying case with a clip to protect them and to keep the case secure on a bag or your pants, although they fit very comfotably into a pocket so maybe you won't need one. So far, I haven't had any complaints so buy them for yourself if you're interested! Amazon has a great return policy if you change your mind!

Fantastic earbuds! I could rant on & on about how pleased I am with this purchase, but I'll stick to a few main points.First and foremost, battery life. These buds seriously last forever. I use these at work everyday for at least 3-4hours at a time, and go multiple days without charging. Unlike my last pair of off-brand bluetooth earbuds, I've never experienced the frustration of getting to work only to realize I forgot to charge them. Nor have I had them die in the middle of a several hour long podcast. The reliability is unparalleled.

I watched many good reviews on these and really wanted to try these out.  But they must be really suited for Android and not IOS.  I was able to pair them with my iPhone7 and could see them on the Galaxy app, but could not get the phone to go into headphone mode to get music out of the buds.  I tried many of the fixes I found online and couldn't get music to play in headphone mode.  The ambient feature works well and the find my ear buds feature was nice.  But the primary function of playing sounds through the ear buds didn't ever materialize.  I'm going to return them and spend the extra money on Airpods for the iPhone.

I bought these to replace the Apple buds I lost. I wear them to exercise. Unlike the Apple buds, I cannot keep these Galaxy Buds Plus from falling out. I‚Äôve changed the silicone inserts and followed the insertion directions I got from Samsung customer service. I switched brands because these were recommended by Consumer Reports. The sound may be a little better, but if they won‚Äôt stay in for me, I can‚Äôt use them.

So I tried several similar products borrowing from my friends to test and never found anything I really liked. I heard about the newest version of these being out and thought that given my past experience with the older versions this would be a good choice and so far these are by far the best buds I've ever used. Not exceptional quality like my Bose Noise Cancelling Wireless Bluetooth Headphones 700, which would be unfair since they are $400, but still a very good sound quality, very easy connection to all my devices and their app is reliable and easy to use.

If you spend a lot of time talking on the phone then these are a nice upgrade from the wired earbuds that come with a Samsung phone.  BUT . . . . . and it‚Äôs a big BUT . . . . . If you‚Äôre expecting to listen to music with them, forget it!  The audio quality is no better than the wired ear buds and unless you have them really jammed inside your ears, the sound quality is tinny at best.  I like the app, the battery life is really great, they‚Äôre comfortable (even for me and I struggle with earbuds, my ears usually start hurting after a while) and very convenient.  I‚Äôm just disappointed with the audio quality.  But then I have Bose QC35‚Äôs for listening to music!!  Still trying to decide if I should keep them or send them back.  It‚Äôs a lot of money to spend to be underwhelmed!

To preface, I've had these for only about a week now and these are my initial thoughts. I'll update this review as time goes on.First off, the sound quality is really great. They're comparable to my sony wh-1000xm3 which is double the price of these earbuds. Samsung's wearable app works extremely well with the earbuds and the features that come along with it are extraordinary. I especially like the future where you can use the app to find your earbuds by having them emit a chirping sound that I can use to track them down. This is especially important to me because I often fall asleep with them on and find that I've lost them the next morning. Speaking of that, I left them in all night to see how much battery life would be drained. The earbuds went from 95 percent charge to 75 percent. This might be different if I was listening to music all night, but as for just leaving them out, they discharge pretty slowly. They also fit very well in my ear and they're very customizable with size.

There's a lot to like about these headphones: the red looks great, the battery life is fantastic, the case is small and slim, and the fit is comfortable, even for my somewhat tiny ear canals that demands a more sensitive fit than most. On the other hand they're expensive, which is forgivable if not for one major flaw--the sound is dull and lifeless especially the bass. Perhaps in an effort to improve battery life, the earbuds do not get very loud. A pair of skullcandy sesh evo's that I bought for less than half the price of these has louder sound and more discernible bass, although I'll probably return those because of battery life and a charging case that's more like a brick. I downloaded the samsung app on my iphone and updated the buds with the latest firmware in addition to playing with the eq settings. The bass boost does nothing to the bass and only lowers the treble. I am utterly dumbfounded as to all the positive reviews on the verge, rtings, etc., extolling the sound quality with particular emphasis on the bass. Perhaps I bought some duds, perhaps there's something else I'm missing. I've played around with the fit of the various wings and tips to see if that makes a difference and it does not. If you're listening to mostly podcasts and classical music they're fine but if you're interested at all in electronica or reggae then you'll be straining to hear the bass. For half the price I would have kept them, but for this price I'll just return them in a couple of days if I don't see a marked improvement in sound quality. One pet peeve that I think is possible to get used to is the touch sensitive controls can get on your nerves as they are so sensitive the slightest attempt to adjust your buds will lead to tracks stopping and starting. Out of the box, there is no way to adjust the volume on the buds bud this is very easily reconfigured with the app. In short, I really want to keep them given the form factor, battery life and comfort, but the price is not justified by the sound quality. I foresee moving on pretty soon to another brand.
PROS:-Good Sound

These aren't my first ear buds. But they're by far the best. The previous buds would do stupid things like connect to my phone from inside their case. Battery life of not very much. And getting the earbuds paired with my phone and each other was an experience all by itself.Enter the Samsung Galaxy Buds. I shuddered as I resigned myself to pairing hell when I received them. I opened the case, looked over to the instructions, saw something on my phone and turned back to a message that the buds had been paired. I didn't have to do anything. The more I use these buds, the more I like them. They are completely unobtrusive in operation. I don't have to base my use around the buds. They're just there to provide an interface between me and my phone.

I just got them in today and so far I am pleased with the purchase. Great sound and listened to them for a little while with music, gaming, podcasts, etc. Tye range of sounds is dynamic though I will say some of the bass is left a little flat compared to other buds I have tried though could be overall settings I used. I have a Samsung galaxy s20+ phone and tend match my product makers for best ecosystem experience and they connected and paired seamlessly. They are also not as heavy as I am used too and the fit was great for me out of the box. With them playing, they blocked out alot of the sound, to give an idea I had a 2 and 3 year old toddlers running around screaming and it didn't really phase me. That being said, the ambient sound option in the wearable app did pull through the sounds of shrieking children rather well. I'll give a new update a couple weeks in to use just so I can give a better review.Update:21/09/2020

First off, these are my first pair of wireless earbuds. They look great, sound great, and while the wing tips aren't very comfortable in my small ears, they are removable and are way more comfortable. The Buds came in undamaged packaging and were well protected in the box it came in. The only downside to these is if you drop the case with the earbuds inside (no matter what height they drop from,) the case will open and the earbuds will come out as well. At first, the magnet for the case seemed pretty strong, and to be fair, it still does feel strong when opening or closing. Obviously, not strong enough to keep the case closed when dropped. Other than that, these are a great pair of earbuds and I'm glad that they were my first pair.

They're great headphones and last a long time. However, just after two days (using them just a few times) my right headphone stopped making as much volume as the other and my enhanced hearing option was on, but the changing volume right to left was not. I'm a huge Samsung fan, but this was a disappointment that swayed me a bit.

They sound good when they work. Poor bluetooth connection, lots of interruptions (while riding a bicycle, the purpose for which they were purchased). Right side died after using only a few times a week after receiving 31 days ago (amazon is exchanging for another pair). Will update if this was just a bad pair.UPDATE:
PROS:*Great features if you have a Samsung device like I do (i paired these earbuds with my galaxy note 8)

I was quite disappointed at how little sound insulation I got from these earbuds!  Even with a good, snug fit, that little piece of rubber just isn't anywhere near the ability of over-the-ear headphones.  I cannot tell any difference whether adaptive cancellation is on, or not.  For any scenario dealing with the traffic noise of passing cars, the feature MIGHT AS WELL NOT BE THERE AT ALL.The sound quality is passable, in particular if you have diminished hearing in the upper ranges.  However, making room for the tweeters inside the unit takes away any sort of powerful bass.  I believe I should have gone with a different product, now -- one that employs a larger driver.  Such products are available for a lot less than I paid for this one.

I might be a little bias. Im a Samsung guy, love my galaxy stuff. They are better than original buds. Not a big difference in sound. The sound is always good.  The improvement is in the battery life, ambient is stronger and can be used wearing only 1 bud now. I have heard from people I talk to on the phone that the sound on there end is better. I think that's due to the extra mic on the buds+. So improvements basically extra mic for sound on your caller's end and ambient. As well as 1 bud ambient. Last, battery life on buds and case.

I'm obviously in the minority when it comes to these ear buds, when I say that the sound quality of the buds for listening to music is not really that great. There are others who are really liking the sound quality, which pushed me to second guess myself. My first response was "why does the drummer sound like he's banging on cardboard boxes?".  I googled the different ways of getting these buds to sound better than when I first put them in my ears. And, they did start to sound better. Tweaking the  Equalizer, putting the Samsung Wearables on "Dynamic", and what really helped was going with the larger earpiece. But, none of these came close to the Anker blue tooth earbuds that I was trying to replace. One thing I got from this experience, is that spending a bunch of money does not guarantee better quality.

make sure to buy a warranty. i thought after buying two pairs of the old galaxy buds that all went bad on the right side that perhaps they had fixed the issue. not quite. this is my third pair of galaxy buds that has gone completely bad on the right side and doesnt play any sound any more. thankfully, i wised up and bought a warranty so i will let you guys know if my fourth pair is a dud.

The knocks that I have for these aren't major but they keep them from being 5 stars. The push button controls on the buds are super annoying as not only do I have no use for them but they are hypersensitive to every time that I adjust them in my ear. The app demands every single permission that my phone has to offer. I'm surprised that I didn't have to give away my bank account numbers too. The max volume is the lowest that I've ever dealt with on higher end buds but at least for me it's probably a good thing. Sound quality is good especially when the buds are in the sweet spot if my ear. Tons of battery plus the case has it's own battery. Don't fall out of my ears like every other bud and headphones I've used for working out.

Let me get it out the way, I like these. Now that's out our way, let's dig in.... My experience with the earbuds has been mixed. I have a non 5G Galaxy Note 10+ directly from Sammy and continue to observe Bluetooth stack freezing. So earbuds, they randomly disconnect only one, mostly the right side to the tune of 3 disconnects per day. Reboot on Note didn't help/factory reset or firmware update, nada. I did re-pair the buds to no avail. Hopefully there will be a firmware update in the future That can fix these expensive devices. On the interim, I love the sound, the low latency, the battery is awesome, they also charge fast, fits snug and don't cause irritation while sweating.

I was excited about finding these for many reasons: features, price point, number of 4&5star vs 1-3 star reviews.Let's be honest, at this point it is nearly impossible to find ANY wireless buds without 6-10% 1 star reviews AND it doesn't matter if they are $30 or $300!!!

im pro samsung bet i'm really pissed. i had until today to return the earbuds but everything was fine. just when the deadline is past, the left ear stopped working. i tried reseting and all the other options. nothing works. and no,  i didnt dropped them or put them in water. i dont even use them to exercise, just to watch series and listen to some music! i just lost 139$ i guess

This is the first set of Bluetooth I've owned so I can't say how these stack up compared to other brands.These were pretty easy to configure out of the box as they were immediately recognized by my Samsung S10+.  They integrate using the galaxy wearable app with mixed results.  The app works well for customizing sound presets, but not so much in other aspects.  Sound and voice quality is good, and I've been using these primarily for video conferencing for work.

I'd prefer old school wired Apple ear buds any day over the bluetooth stuff, unfortunately, that's not an option on many modern devices.  I got the Galaxy buds when they first came out,  they fit amazingly, very comfortable, and also worked as an ear plug when not listening to audio.  I recently "upgraded" to the Buds Live, and although they sound amazing, the ergonomics are terrible, if they are even slightly out of position, sound quality plummets, and they can easily shift just by moving your jaw.  After a week or so i found out that Samsung also had the Buds + model that actually produced better sound quality than the new Live buds and had the same old fit that i loved, so i got them and i have not been disappointed! i compared all 3 models, buds, buds +, and buds live.  the Buds + and Buds live were similar in sound quality and much better than the standard buds.  I am hoping that sometime soon, Samsung is able to update these buds so that they can pair to multiple devices.

I was in shock as this has never happened to me before.  I received everything in the box but the earbudsüò≥.  I called Amazon immediately, they send me another one and just got it today.Sound quality is very good.  However, I want to concentrate on the fit for the earbuds.  I thought I am the only human being on earth who can't find any wireless earbuds that fits me.  I have tried so many and it was never a perfect fit.  I saw this deal with open box like new condition from Amazon warehouse, at 40% off free shipping and return, why not.

I love these so much....but its not loud enough for me I like to cancel out all noise especially when I'm playing c.o.d on my phone and their are kids around and these just don't do that or maybe don't know how to set it that way but I feel like I shouldn'thave to investigate if it does it should already be set up that way...i like that I can charge it with my phone s20 ultra and its very easy to connect if u lose it the phone can help u if its out of the case only and it will not track like give u a location but it will make a faint bird noise ur room would have to be very quiet for that... for battery it does last for hours, when someone is calling i can easily just open the case and use one bud..

Im getting some crackling distortion on the high tones, is this a defective pair or is this something I can fix changing the codecs or something?? Can someone give me some tips, please... sending them back would be a expensive and slow, I'm outside of the US now... It's a very big shame because I love everything else about these earphones. Lows are good and midtones are warm and sharp... But There is a bit of crackling on the higher frequently even though sounds on the lows and the middles are good but it's driving me crazy, once you hear it just messes up the whole experience... I hope that it's something software related that can be corrected... But it just sounds like old stereo tweeters that are exploded... I don't hear this with other Bluetooth earphones or my wired Sony earphones. They are paired with A Note 9.

(Product was returned within a couple days)Very comfortable and stays in place. Sound quality is very balanced with good bass. Passive noise cancelling is good enough. Latency is low or non-existent even without the game mode feature that is only available in  Samsung devices.

at first sounds great but after awhile I had a hard time hearing other people talking while driving a semi truck. So yes not recommend for any truck driver. To much back ground noise for the other parties and they had a hard time hearing me. If they had noise canceling on them it might have be better ear buds.If I'm talking to someone outside or inside they a can still hear everything they say while trying to talk to the person that your on the phone with.

Update: as many others have experienced my left bud has stopped working.  Obviously this is a known issue and I'm outside the return window.  I would not recommend these at all.  I don't believe I should have to give the app permission to my calendar just to be able to listen to music with these ear buds.  If you try and deny any permission they ask for, the app will not work.  It's disappointing as I like the sound produced but I am not comfortable with the required permissions.  Samsung should give us a choice on permissions, but instead I have to choose to return them.

I use to use a pair of AirPods to listen to something when I went to sleep at night so not to keep my wife awake. But after 2 years the batteries in them died. Was looking for a pair of ear buds that had better support for a Android phone and tried these out. Got way more then what I was expecting. Sound quality and cancellation was a stop up from my AirPods. In fact the noise cancellation is to good and I can't hear my wife which causes other problems. And when I lay on my side there is not discomfort to my ears. I have to be honest that I bought them because they were on sale, but I am very happy and satisfied with them. I'd recommend them to everyone.

Let me start off with saying I have owned many different headphones and earbuds. These are great wireless earbuds really, but everyone knows the good: long battery life, decent sound, fast charge times etc. Heres the bad; the batteries while lasting long dont really last 11 hours per charge. Its more of like 8-9 whether it's music or sleeping on calls. There is a slight lag between screen and audio even with the gaming mode feature in labs so that kind of disappointing. I use these mainly for discord calls on my phone. Discord acts weird with these. It will treat the call as a phone call at first and the sound quality goes down alot. Sometimes even sound fading out. If you double tap the earbud (which would end a normal phone call) the sound becomes perfect again however the mic changes to your phone rather than your earbud which is quite strange. For the most part they work fine though. Not great but fine. The mic on the buds sound like pretty much every other wireless earbuds out there. The ambient mode sounds tinny but works well. The connection is stable most of the time but there were a couple times the connection was glitching out so the earbud would sound like its losing connection (even the my phone is like less than 2ft away) whenever i switch to snapchats camera it changes the phones audio output to the phone speaker for some reason and I find myself repairing these alot. Bottom line they're great for listening to music and stuff but not so great at other stuff. Sync problems, call quality loss and connectivity issues. I would do some research and see what earbuds would best fit you.
Long story short...Goods....
So i have a a big expectation seeing that this is the second gen Samsung buds but compared to the amazon echo buds. theses are just not that great.Noise)

I have been trying to find an ear-bud that can be used while sleeping and otherwise. I have tried a number of them, get - try - return multiple times. I was trying a mid-range price point no luck. I decided that it was time to bump up my price for the fact that I will be using them every night.I have a pair of 1More (which I love but falls out of my ears all night). I have also found that they maybe can be used continuously for at the most 7 hours. I have used the Samsung buds+ once and love them they did not fall out, and still have a good amount of juice to last for a good 3 or 4 hours more (total 11 hours).

These have excellent full range sound quality with good detail. Unfortunately the tips supplied don't go deep enough into my ear canal to get a tight sound leak proof fit. I have to fight with them every time to get them in a good enough position accidentally triggering the touch controls in the process. The  depth of the earpiece is part of the problem. I have used wired buds in the past and due to their slim nature, there is no impediment to get a good sound seal with a similar tip size. I am looking for replacement tips that offer a bit more flexibility in getting a good tight fit. Disappointed for 150 buds that there were not more ear tip options included. The wing tips don't offer anything useful for my situation.

Ive Had 3 galaxy buds version 1's and im very disappointed in Samsung these things aren't any louder to me they dont sound better yall saying the buds will stay in the case now are straight uo lying these things will slip out of your pocket way to fast and the buds will fly out the max volume is sad my 40 dollar wirless earphones are louder but the sound reduction is amazing and the buds are still very very comfortable but id return them if i had the 1's galaxy buds i sold all of them.... yes im happy with them but i barely see a difference the apo looks better now but this is sad I really expected Samsung to throw another amazing product but they throw the galaxy buds 2 with literally no good improvements trust me your really not gonna get the full time out ofo yohr battery......Update! Everything is still the same to me except the buds fall out of the case as fast as the galaxy buds v1 but the case is a lot better then i thought and will save you more then the older version but still nothing really changed...

I bought these 3 months ago, 2.5 months in the left bud stopped working. Apparently its an issue across the board with a ton of these devices from the thousands of people with the same issue on a ton of different forums online. So I called Samsung, they verified they've seen the issue a lot recently but assured me NOT TO WORRY because im still well within my warranty. I sent in the buds next day to get fixed, 2 weeks later they call me and tell me that I bought internationally and that they can't honor the warranty and ill have to take it up with Amazon. It clearly states that this purchase was made from Samsung official on Amazon and it clearly states in the description that it is the US VERSION. Complete bs, total runaround and they will not accept my receipt showing that amazon official is blatantly advertising that the buds i spent $140 on were supposed to be the US Version.

I am a serious audiophile and quite critical of reviews that rate sound quality.  Also play classical guitar, so my demands are high when audio is supposed to superior.  Same with my audio equipment that costs $1000's.I own Bose, Apple, and Samsung  wireless earphones.  Bose wireless  and Bose wireless eyeglasses are the best for sound vs. Samsung and Apple.

I have continuously bought off-brand in a shallow and fruitless attempt to find better earbuds for lower prices, while not supporting big name brands. It's been fruitless and wasted more money than I care to admit. Why did I? Who knows.Point is, these are the BEST bang for your buck and aren't even that much more expensive than lesser-known brands in the grand scheme of things. In every aspect you can think of: sound quality, versatility, battery life, comfort and feel, ease of access---everything!

I was recommended these by 2 friends who really like them, and I was so excited to get them. Unfortunately, my experience is vastly different from theirs.It seems like my ear canals are just too small, because even switching the silicone tips to the smallest size as I usually do, I still get a ton of discomfort from having them in my ears.
I've only had these for a day, but have been using them pretty extensively since I got them.  Here are my pros and cons....PRO

Look pretty, Terrible sound quality, no noise cancelation, ambient voice passthrough is echoey and tinny (terrible), tech functions are excellent, you will experience physical ear damage due to poor anatomical design. They fit in/on your ear, but with great discomfort that you'll start to notice within 10 minutes. Alternative size parts do not help. They were so bad I didn't even take pictures. Got the Bose after much research. Go with the less techy Bose SoundSport wireless earbuds, you won't be disappointed... If you care about sound quality.

After thinking there was a problem with the buds I originally ordered, I had a replacement set mailed to me hoping things would be better, but they weren't. Mac users beware. Go with the airpods instead. When they were connected, they were great, but they had a consistent problem with just randomly disconnecting. Maybe its the Mac, you think? No. I tried these on 3 different macs, and it was the same. All 3 Macs showed the same problem. Random disconnects. Maybe it was the range? Again, no. My work laptop site 2 feet away from me, and in a given day, I would have at least, at LEAST, a dozen times this would happen. Have of those would have troubles reconnecting where it would connect, then a few seconds later disconnect. These are awful for mac users. Buy them if you plan on just using them for your phone, as they worked fine for that. Can't say much for how they work with an iPhone, but a Galaxy phone, they work fine

Get them! So comfortable, I can wear them for hours at work with no pain at all. I tried the airpods version, they hurt my ears so bad after just a short time. No so with these. They fit so snugly that I can change my shirt without budging them. Again not so with the pods. Sound is crystal clear, and customizable, with nice bass. I love the ambient sound feature, I use it all the time when I'm with friends or at work where I have to hear, I don't have to keep taking them out to hear people, plus it's awesome when I'm on Zoom, or a phone call, because I can hear my own voice clearly which helps a lot. I love how the touch responses are also customizable, especially the volume control on the edge of the buds, while leaving the touchpad for other things. The only thing I wish is that the Galaxy wear app showed the battery percentage for each bud (like it used to) instead of being combined. Maybe a future update will bring it back if enough people complain... Otherwise, the best earbuds/pods/phones I have ever owned.

I work in a REALLY small office where I can occasionally overhear my co-workers, and when it is frequently eerily quite. In order to deal with both of those issues, I was using a pair of cheap wireless earbuds from Amazon. They did the job, but the battery life was about 3 hours, which worked, because I'm only allowed to wear 1 at a time, but it wasn't ideal when I wanted to use both buds on the weekends, etc. Additionally, the call quality was non existent.I chose these because I use a Samsung phone and they had good reviews. I could not be happier with my purchase. The longest I've used a bud so far is 8.5 hours, and it still had more than 50% batter remaining when I returned it to the case at the end of my work day. The call quality is just as good. I can make/receive calls with just one bud and have no trouble hearing, nor do the people on the other end.

They don't always charge when in the case. They also won't tell you that one ear bud is nearly dead while the other is doing fine. It's just one will stop working and then it will say its dead. YouTube and not samsung is how i figured out how to deal with that.  Sound is fine but not amazing. You get options for sound depending on what you're listening to. I like that it's fairly easy to switch from my phone to my tablet (both Samsung), but I could not get my tablet initially set up without assistance and found samsung help pages frankly useless in diagnosing why. I like them better than my last pair that simply refused to charge in case without knowing the magic words. I also like that they always disconnect when in case even if they won't charge.
These are my first pair of galaxy buds ever after trying a million different Bluetooth buds from Amazon.I have to say, these are it.

I got these to use while working out and they are working quite well for me for that!I just wish they were louder. The sound is clear and nice, but not as robust as I would prefer, again, seems like maybe if they were louder, it would sound more full as well.
First time buyer of truly wireless Buds.Paired with a Samsung Galaxy S9+ and galaxy watch active 2.

Before buying these, I had Zolo Liberty wireless earbuds for several years that I used heavily at work. I got these because those old ones couldn't hold a charge for longer than an hour anymore.My first impression was how small and light the case was. I was even more surprised by how light the earbuds themselves were. My Zolo Liberty case felt easily 5 times the weight of this one.

I purchased these specifically to use at the gym. Before I used them at the gym, they worked great. Happy with sound quality and comfort. Then I tried to use them at the gym, and they constantly cut in and out. I tried disconnecting, then reconnecting. Deleting device from Bluetooth completely, but nothing works. I‚Äôve used them 5 different times at the gym, and simply can‚Äôt deal with it any more, especially for the cost. I‚Äôm going to send them back and try another pair and see if it‚Äôs just that pair. I‚Äôll update my review if the new ones work.Update on replacement buds- I have use the replacement buds several times now at the gym. They are substantially better than the first pair that I received at staying connected and not cutting in and out as much when at the gym. I changed my one star to a four-star because I still don‚Äôt feel like I can give them a five star rating. While these are not the most expensive buds you can purchase, they still cost a fair amount of money, and I still noticed minor issues with connectivity but not enough to try and get another replacement pair. Overall I do think these are good wireless buds for the money.  But still not 100% satisfied.

Apple device user, and I am so pleased with these.-Pairing is strong and only sometimes unpairs when I call over skype or something VOIP. Has never unpaired on the phone or with music/podcasts. Can jump between pairing with my phone and macbook easily.

Purchased Buds Plus 4/29/2020. A month after purchasing the right ear but started beeping at one minute intervals whenever I was in the sun, I'd have to put them in the case for a few minutes then the bud would stop beeping - happened all the time. Called Samsung, opened repair ticket, called Samsung this morning, 7/6/2020, was told warranty invalid because I purchased the international Buds Plus - had no idea at time of purchase whether international or domestic! I would have to pay for repair. Called Asurion (purchase Asurion warranty at time of buds purchase) they also told me same thing. Bottom line- I have $150.00 Samsung Buds Plus and additional $21.99 Asurion extended warrant for a product neither one of these companies will cover and the Buds Plus are useless. I've been a loyal Samsung customer for many many year but I will think twice next time I think about purchasing a Samsung device...............VERY DISAPPOINTED !!

I have had a few buds and these by far are the Best. Admittedly the others were much cheaper.. The Tao buds were great, but horrible when on a call for others to hear me. I am a 911 Paramedic and communication is a big part of my life. When trying to speak with others I don't have time for the "whats and whens"; these are as clear as if on the phone itself. Leaves my hands free. The adjustable ambient sound feature is Awesome!!! Making them very safe amplifying the noise around me when needed. They stay in better than any I have ever had, even riding my Harley with or without a helmet. The noise cancelation feature has been a lifesaver when I need that quite time to myself. These are as advertised and so much more to me. They came in quick and took no time to use them. You won't go wrong with these.

I have these in almost every day and they keep a great charge life! I love that I can have only one in my ear at a time which makes it more convenient for phone calls and hearing the outside world still. I use them when I do Woodwork/lawn work and they seem to protect my ears from the loudness.  The only downfall is when you're on a phone call the person on the receiving end hear some of the random noises. For example, if I'm walking on a gravel ground, the person on the other end says it sounds like I'm chewing celery. Likewise if you're eating, the person on the other end of the phone call can hear you're chewing crunchy things, obviously.If buds are lost, You can find your earbuds with the app, however if your buds are in their case and closed, it does not work . It only works when the earbuds are out of the case... wish it worked both ways. I haven't had them in water but I have gotten sweaty with them in and haven't had any issues. Bass is awesome for music too.
Pro:great sounds quantity

Surprisingly good sound quality, with bass and treble response good.  The battery seems to last a long time I have yet to run it down to below 50% before putting them back into the case and the case charging them back to full is convenient.  Comfortable in the ear during use,  using default attachments, this can vary so make sure you try the different sizes.I have a galaxy S8+ phone and I did have to change the advanced bluetooth setting "Media Volume Sync" to ON in order to get good volume, with this setting off it was half of what it should have been.  Once done it sounded great.

So these have a lot going for them. They look nice, they're comfortable, the build quality seems high, the batteries last more than long enough for me, and they sound really good in the ideal conditions. So why the one star review?That ideal condition for good sound is basically sitting perfectly still with you phone close to the buds because the Bluetooth connectivity with these is really terrible. I've had 15 dollar off-brand ear buds with better Bluetooth connectivity. This renders all the positives I listed before pointless. Literally the second you put your phone in your pocket or start moving around you start hearing distortions in the sound from the Bluetooth signal. I've tried with multiple phones (my own phone, Pixel 3A+ and a family member's Galaxy S10 Plus) and it makes no difference. The problem is the buds. You can't work out with these, you can't run with these, you can't even walk around the house with these. They're useless.

I use these ear buds a lot, not only for music, but to take conference calls all day long for work.  I really hoped that these would be more comfortable than they are, but using the medium sized covers, my ear gets sore really fast, but using the small sized covers, while feeling more comfortable, they fall out of my ear after a few minutes.  I'm not sure what to do.  Naturally, shortly after I purchased these, the brand new Samsung ear buds were announced.  While those look even more comfortable, I'm not thrilled at the idea of shelling up more cash to replace these already.

These are my first earbuds.  I think they will be fine for me since I mostly listen to podcasts and very little music.  But, when it comes to music they lack deep base and the depth you would expect from a quality sound system.  I have tried to adjust the sound using the "wearable" settings but base boost is just not enough and the equalizer of music apps just cannot add the desired base...  If you are looking for quality sound these may not be the earbuds for you, but the best are more expensive.

I keep these on me daily, even at work. The battery life is phenomenal, lasting all through the day outside of the charging case. The buds also charge fairly quickly. Being able to use one bud while the other is in the case is a nice touch. These buds are very comfortable, and the wing tips help keep them secure in your ear. I appreciate the low profile of the buds, I don't really want something obnoxious and large.There is NO active noise cancellation, only passive (the seal created by the rubber tips). This isn't a problem for me, I don't want active noise cancellation and at this price point it probably shouldn't be expected. The passive noise cancellation does just fine anyway, although I usually have the ambient sound feature on anyway so I can interact with people at work.  The ambient sound feature works fairly well. It seems to favor higher pitched sounds, as that's what comes out more clearly (even going so far as to being able to hear female voices more clearer than a deep male's voice). Still, it allows me to be more aware of my surroundings when I need to while enjoying music.

Things were working fine for the first 3 months after charging one day I noticed that the right earbud had become very quiet almost inaudible with the left ear bud in.  I followed all of Samsung's debugging steps to fix the problem and when nothing worked I decided to call their customer support. At first the support team was very helpful and assured me that the product was under warranty and sent me a shipping label for me to use to send in for repairs.  A few days after I shipping them out claiming that they had received my galaxy buds at the repair center but the warranty was void and I actually OWED them $109 for the repairs. After getting screwed around and bouncing from call to call by the Samsung support people for over 2 hours I finally found out that the warranty was void because it was bought from AMAZON and apparently was an international version of the product.  Had I known this I never would have sent them in for repairs but would have contacted amazon.  Now not only am I out the 1 bud that worked I have to pay Samsung to receive them back!!! While I do like the product itself when it worked I would strongly advise not purchasing this product from Amazon but rather through Samsung directly

I must say, the plus buds are considerably better that their predecessor. I don't really think they are that much louder, but they sound so much better. The ambience setting on these things are amazing. Today was my first full day and I kept both in all day at work and had no problems. The battery is a huge happy factor. When I got home, some 11-12 hours later, I had recharged the buds and I had 44 percent on the case. Worthy upgrade.

I planned to listen to music. Maybe a podcast or 2. But I opened the shipping box to a beautiful white sparkly Buds+ box. Get all excited! Mind you the factory tape was already cut open. Didn't think to much of it besides im pretty sure I ordered new not used ones. Well it dont matter. The buds, case, charging cord was non existence. Only thing the savages left was the instructions. Luckily Amazon is amazing and is sending a new pair that will arrive tomorrow!Got new pair the very next day and they are amazing headphones! From sound to fit all around best Bluetooth headphones anyone could ask for. 11hr battery life with 2 extra charges stored in the case. They fit so good im the ear im able to go for a ride on my harley with no windshield doing 80mph without them budging at all! Highly recommend buying Samsung over the Airpods!

With passive noise cancellation, the vacuum created from the earbuds gives a sense of security during workouts and exercise.  Sweat resistance is good enough.  I took these with me running, playing basketball at the court or on the playground, and had no problems having them stay in my ear.  Great sound for the price.  They pair flawlessly with the Samsung Gear app on my Samsung S20 plus, S10 plus, and/or Note 10 plus.  The app offers enough control and features to feel good about being in total control.  The different sound EQ settings on the Samsung Gear app gives nice noise signature variations.  For my taste, I'm good with DYNAMIC.Overall, especially now, the price is irresistible particularly in the Samsung ecosystem.

These buds work great when paired with my galaxy phone. They also fit pretty well. Sweating during workouts has not been an issue. The sound blocks out the bad pop music blasting in the gym. I gave 4 stars for the following reasons.1. When doing Bluetooth pairing with my lapto, the audio drivers become corrupted. This has never happened with any other Bluetooth headset/speaker. This was vetted and tested several times by my IT department at the headphones were deemed to be the root cause. Not useful in this new age of constant Zoom meetings.

I bought these to replace my Blitzwolf FE-7s.  It's not even a very good comparison given the price difference (I ordered direct from China), but none-the-less, I've always been a sucker for trying to find the best ChiFi challenger to whatever the mainstream audio is doing.I have never had a single problem with my Galaxy Buds Plus.  Not one, no dropping, no connection problems, nothing.  I love them so much, that after getting my son some highly rated TRANYA T10s, which we both agreed were complete trash compared to the Blitzwolf's as far as SQ (the Blitz were starting to glitch though), I opted to see if I could get a bargain on the GBP.  Amazon Warehouse had a stellar deal on an Open Box for $62...which puts them in slightly higher, albeit direct competition with the best of ChiFi.

Love: sound quality, connectivity, commands, reading messages, that my family dont have to say what? I cant hear you well! on phone calls. Ambient sound, it works terrific, it can be abit loud at the beginning, but you get used to it. The greatest thing about it it's that I dont have to take them off when I go to my customer, and this has made the experience with these Samsung buds plus even more amazing.I wish: eventhough the speakers are way better than the last year model, more improvements on them will make them perfect. But I love this buds plus the technology on these little bluetooth is amazing and obviously 100 cheaper than the new airpods pro, I like the design better than the airpod pro's. They stay on my ears well eventhough I'm up and down and moving for 9 hrs at work, plus battery life amazing. I'm considering a pair for my wife, but they need to come down at least 30 dollars.

These are my first earbuds, so I cannot compare them with others.  However, I can compare them with my wired earphones.The multiple ear shape plugs and sizes are great.  Enough variety, they should fit everyone comfortably.

Good True Wireless Earbuds All In All. Only issue I have had is tryin to find the right size earbud plugs and wings that work for me but so far I have only tried the smallest and medium ones. Think I may have to try to use the medium earbud plugs with the small wings havent tried yet but will give an update afterwards. (Update) so I personally had to use the smallest ear wings and the medium earbud plugs and have had little to no discomfort... But I am having trouble with the left earbud loosing charge faster the the right and it also keeps cutting the sound in and out to were I can barely hear anything out of it? I am returning or getting an exchange or getting a replacement because I absolutely love these earbuds but sadly I think there maybe a manufacturer malfunction with these ones and just to be safe I asked for the replacement or exchange

Let me start by saying that I have been a consumer of Samsung products for a long time. I purchase their televisions, their cell phones, and household appliances. However, with the purchase of these headphones, my faith in them is beginning to diminish. These are without a doubt, the most useless, shoddy headphones on the market right now. They have advertising that makes them seem like the bee's knees, but they perform more like complete and utter garbage. The sound quality dips in and out, they lose connection to any device I attempt to connect them to, and you cannot even place your phone in your front pocket without it disrupting the signal to the headphones. These things should not be sold to consumers at this price. Save your money, since you're better off buying a $15 Chinese knockoff.

Update:  I finally had enough and contacted Samsung support (a week after using the on-line support to trouble shoot).  They sent me a shipping label to to return them and will be sending me a new pair.  Original Post: I have had these for about a month now and was initially satisfied with them (even recommended them to a coworker).  However, over the last week every time I take a call they will disconnect from the phone (as if I had taken them out).  I have to remove them and then put them back in for them to connect.  Depending on the length of the call, they will disconnect several times.  I have tried resetting them and clearing cache from my phone, but it still occurs.  Sometimes I have to go back to wired headphones depending on the importance of the call.

First impression.. five stars.. ambient mode is insane. I've had the old Galaxy buds for about 8 months now daily use and these out of the box are blowing it away with both sound quality and ambient sound.My wife always complains about phone quality from my old buds. We will test that and I will get back to you with that opinion later.

Pros: Has great features. Good battery.Cons: Have to install Galaxy Wearable app to get the most out of it, lags and pauses a lot with non Samsung devices, notably my Lenovo pc. The galaxy wearable app also auto launches every time you manually connect, very annoying. not worth the cost with the performance issues alone.

So I have the regular Galaxy Buds, and the Jabra Elite 75T Active. I mostly listen to my earbuds at work, usually in one ear, but when I'm out and about I'll have both in. However the Galaxy Buds didn't last through out the day, and the Jabra Elite's actually had even worse battery life than the original Galaxy Buds despite claiming otherwise. Jabra's sounded much better no contest however.I upgraded to the Galaxy Buds+ Hoping to find a medium between the two. To my surprise it really doesn't sound any better at least to my ears than the regular Galaxy Buds, so if that is your sole reason for upgrading I wouldn't do it. It also isn't any louder than the originals. However it does have other features that I enjoy quite a bit. In the option menu you can turn on gaming mode, which eliminates audio delay pretty well. It also has an option to turn the ambient mode up even higher than normal. Much higher than the original Buds, and the Jabras. Another thing that you can do that you couldn't do in the original is use ambient mode with only one ear bud in your ear. Perfect for when I'm at work. However I only recommend doing this with the right ear bud, I think that is the only bud with the extra microphone. (It works fine with both in however)

I still don't quite understand the ambient setting. Know it amplifies background noise, but don't understand why.Never used wireless earbuds before, but to me the sound was good for being wireless buds.

Using Flossy Carter's ranking system on a scale of 1-10 these are a triple major go. The battery on these is no joke with 11 hours on the buds alone and 22 hours with the case. Also, call quality on these are great with everything sounding clear you should have no problems taking a call with these and with ambient sound you could listen to music and still here what's going on around you which is great. Now, this could vary from person to person but for me these are comfortable which is perfect for long listening sessions but your mileage may vary. All in all these are great buds for the price and would highly recommend.

After having them for 1 week, I would rate these 4 stars out of 5. The sound quality is excellent and the ability to customize each sides function is more useful than I originally thought it would be. The ambient sound feature comes in handy, especially as a delivery driver. Being able to switch from hearing nothing to hearing customers and co-workers without having to remove the earbuds is very convenient.  The ear buds have had a few problems, but nothing major. First, and this has only happened twice, is that the earbuds will be out of sync.  One earbud will be a few seconds ahead of the other and the only way to fix it I've found is to put them back in the case and wait a minute before using them again. The second issue is occasionally the earbuds will make music come through sound slightly robotic. I'm not sure how to describe it other than that. This only lasts a few seconds at a time and doesn't happen too often. They also randomly switch playlists on Spotify, I haven't had this happen with any other earbuds and it's nothing more than a slight inconvenience. One issue that was almost unbearable was the notifications. They worked perfectly on the first day, but by day 2 it started reading my notification non stop. I would receive a snapchat, and it would repeat "Snapchat" endlessly. I ended up turning notifications off and haven't turn them on since.  Lastly, they do get uncomfortable to wear for any more than 45 minutes to an hour. I'm not sure if intentional or not, but whenever I remove one of the earbuds from my ear, spotify will either pause the music playing, or resume it if paused. This is useful when I have music playing and it pauses it when I remove an earbud, but if the music is paused and gets resumed when I remove an earbud it just doesn't make sense and it annoying when I have to re-pause the music. I would like to see more functions for the touch pads in the future, maybe like a certain tap pattern that allows the user to lock and unlock the earbuds, rather than having to go into the app to do so. Overall a very good product and I would recommend getting them.

The left earbud has a good strong sound, but the right earbud is weak and faint. There are no instructions as to how to balance the sound. So these were basically non-function on arrival after charging them. Also, the controls are way too sensitive - if you touch them even slightly it will trigger a track change - and so adjusting them in any way while they are in your ear is basically impossible. I doubt I'll buy samsung again.

These buds were great for the first couple months, then the sound quality/volume started to fade and even after thorough cleaning they never worked the same. After the right earbud died completely, I sent them into Samsung for warranty repair/replacement, but they said due to "damage" that it voided the warranty and would cost me $108 to repair them. I never got them wet or abused them, I'm unaware of any "damage" done to them beyond the right bud stopping completely and the left bud having low volume. I'm having them sent back as is, since I could buy a new pair at that rate. Really disappointed in the longevity of this product, as I looked forward to using them for a long time, especially with such a high price and "good" warranty.

I've owned the buds+ since May and while the features are great the quality in time has diminished. My left ear piece volume is really low and wont match the right side in loudness for whatever reason and randomly out of no where. As well as my charging case suddenly stopped charging and working all together. Very disappointed since the case its self is $80 to re-purchase.

I bought these and they were great until one stopped working after 2 months, no problem it's under warranty. Well Samsung will not honor the warranty for this product if purchased from Amazon because they will not consider it a certified vendor.  I wouldn't bother buying Samsung products because they don't want to honor a warranty for a product bought on amazon which is ridiculous.

I had the old Samsung Galaxy Buds. These new ones are a certain UPGRADE. Granted the sound quality is almost the exact same (slightly more crisp, slightly better bass, slightly better overall) but if you're looking to have much better ambient sound AND call quality, these are the perfect upgrade. Especially with a slight increase of $20.The only real complaint I have is the feel the new case has. It's more plastic-y and the hinge feels rather cheap. A nitpicky observation.

Owned the original Galaxy Buds and AirPods.  These are only a slight sound upgrade from the previous Galaxy Buds.  They are considerably lighter and the battery life is significantly longer.  The bigest difference from the original is the call quality.  The caller won't be able to tell the difference in you having the phone to your ear.  Compared to the AirPods they're more comfortable and sound better.  You really can't compare these to AirPod Pros because they are in a different proce category.

Great sound quality for the price (compare airpods pro: $250). No noise canceling, but I'm ok with that. Connecting to my phone couldn't be easier. Battery life is good enough with the case. I use ear buds an average of 9-10 hrs a day, and putting the buds in the case (giving my ears a break) after 4-5 hrs, I can finish my days use with some battery to spare.The ambient sound feature works ok. It gives a tinny sound to your surroundings and is very noisy out in the wind. I don't know how you could expect a better sound honestly.

I loved them in the first 2 weeks!!!. After 2 weeks, they started losing connection to my phone, muffle sound and make me hear robots and people were not able to hear me well very frequently.The left battery started to drain much quicker than the right one and I need to charge them more frequently. The ambiant sound feature is super cool, but sometimes you hear the air passing by, specially after I upgraded their software.

I'm actually disappointed, because I have a Samsung phone.  I got these hoping for magic - but only ONE earbud would connect.  Crazy.  I searched online and saw SO MANY POSTS of people complaining about the same thing - which is odd, since you don't hear about that with any other earbuds.  From what I could tell from just the right earbud, the sound quality seems good, so I'm really disappointed.Secondary issue is that the charging cord wasn't in the box.  I could live with that - but not only ONE earbud working.

I have these connected via Bluetooth for my PC and they are by far the worst. People say I cut in and out in meetings so I always have to switch headsets half way through.The sound quality is horrible for the meetings. After I bought it I noticed there were 2 different modes for these on PC

Bought a pair NEW and they only lasted 5-6 hours at under half volume with ambient on high on full charge. returned those and got replacements.Replacements i battery drained them twice at full volume with ambient on high, streaming music/live streams/netflix and they are currently lasting 8-9 hours on a single charge!
I have two pairs of these headphones. After less than 2 months of use both pairs are inoperable for the following reasons:Pair 1 - right headphone no longer produces sound.

I ordered these ‚Äúlike new‚Äù from Amazon Warehouse. While they had everything in the package, they had definitely been used and the case was scratched up. That said, I cleaned the tips and tried the buds for several days. I was underwhelmed. The sound is thin and lacks separation and depth. I also have the Jabra Elite Active 65t buds, and while they are much older, they sound significantly better for music and work MUCH better for MS Teams meetings for work. Hated how my voice sounded on the Samsung buds, robotic. The most annoying thing about these buds are the finicky touch controls. They rarely work. These also had trouble pairing with the iPhone. Finally, the battery didn‚Äôt last anywhere near 11 hours, but that might be because my ‚Äúlike new‚Äù buds were, in fact, quite worn. I‚Äôll stick with Jabra.

I am in LOVE with my buds. The Cloud Blue color is just the blueberry on top!!! I've been wanting these and was waiting for the price to drop a little and then it happened! Came down a full $10 when I bought them üòãI have the S10 so I can use the Buds plus app that quickly recognizes the buds when I open the case and immediately connects and continues to play the sound my ear when I put in my bud.

These ear buds are exactly what I've been searching for!! The wired versions of these earbuds came with my phone but I had been wanting a pair of wireless earbuds so I decided to try these out! Now I don't leave home without them! They are great for listening to music and podcasts and watching movies! These earbuds come with several customizable parts so you can get the perfect fit! One of my favorite features is the ambient sound feature! I dont have to take my earbuds out when someone talks to me as their voice is pushed through to my earbuds! I also love the extended battery life and the extremely fast charging!The bonus charging pad was an awesome addition as it charges my phone, watch, and earbuds!

I bought these hoping they would be a top notch product to match my Samsung Galaxy s10 and Samsung Q70 TV, but, the sound was subpar and thin, even when using the software equalizer. Could only be paired with one bluetooth component at a time. Bought mainly for working out and listening to tv . They paired with my Samsung tv quickly, but I was unable to increase volume while watching tv.  The call quality was so-so...So, they went back and I bought Jabra Elite 75t which are far superior to the Samsung earbuds.

Love, love, love these Galaxy Buds Plus. I've purchased five other brands of earbuds and these are stellar by comparison. Battery life is great and the sound is incredible due to the customizable Wearable App from Samsung. The fit is perfect. They feel very light in the ear and the comfort is a welcome change from most other earbuds. I strongly recommend these for purchase and, unless you're the type to constantly loose your buds, these are well worth the investment. The red version I bought looks sexy and sharp. I listen to everything from Audiobooks to rock, Bach to blues, symphonic to Broadway. Every genre is well suited for these buds The sale price of $130 was a real enticement. As the newer versions come out on the market, the price is likely to drop even more.  Snatch these up before they discontinue them!!!

I have used a lot of different wireless ear buds. From other vendors, what I can say is after using them all the Samsung buds were and still remain my favorite. You will hear complaints of missing premium features like built in mp3 player with out your phone and such non-sense, honestly all those features are silly. At the end of the day I am rarily with out my phone within arms reach, and even less do I leave with out it. With these headsets, I have them paired to anything with Bluetooth, they connect easily seamlessly, they stay in my ears and sound great regardless of what activities I am doing. The battery is long enough that I never need to worry about being caught with them not charged. Simply put these are the best bang for buck.

Seriously, where have these been? I feel so free with this product. I can walk around without having to worry about being attached to a wire or cord. These are (obviously) my first wireless bluetooth ear buds. I am not an expert on sound quality or other technical aspects of this product, but they meet my needs and then some. They fit snug in my ears and even come with several sizes of rubber ear pieces in case one size doesn't fit in your ear. I've used them working out as well as around the house doing things like washing dishes and cleaning and they have not fallen out of my ears. I am paranoid about that, though, so I do push them in every once in a while to make sure they are going to stay put.  I feel like the range is wide as well. I sometimes leave the room where my phone is and they are still working all over the house or at the gym. The ONLY thing that's annoying is that there are features on the side of each ear bud that if you press it, pauses your music. I have to make sure that I push around that area when I push them back in my ears otherwise my music will pause. Other than that and the fact that nothing is perfect, especially electronic items, (hence the 4 stars), these things are great.

I can't hype these up enough. I wanted to invest in a good pair of true wireless headphones for awhile now and I did days upon days of research. All of the reviews said to try Jaybird, the Jabra earphones, and there were also other cheaper ones rated well. Well let me tell you...these are BY FAR THE BEST. Don't waste your money on anything else.They fit perfectly and aren't uncomfortable. They don't go so far in your ear that you feel pressure (I felt this when I wore the Jaybird buds). They have different sizes of attachments for the earbud that you can use if they seem to move around a bit. I decided to go with the biggest sizes and they fit so perfectly.

The base quality was poor. My wired yurbuds are better. I tried every trick on the internet and even contacted Samsung directly but nothing made them satisfactory. Noise cancellation really only works with over-the-ear headphones.I returned them.

I purchased these back in july. I have been using them since then. I done a little bitnof research as far as the Specs are concerned and these seem like the Buds+ and the Buds are the same as far as sound quality and battery time. Every charge up on each ear bud gives me only 5 to 8 hours before another recharge (5 hours music time, talk time, and youtube combined back to back and 8 hours not really using it at all).To be honest, I think what I received was different from what was actually purchased.

Great battery life with a pretty good sound too. I have better sounding headphones sure, but these things are in my ears almost all day at work. I just set up the ambient noise thing so if someone needs to talk to me I can hear them without taking them out and I'm good. They're comfortable and actually pretty small for having such a crazy battery life and much smaller than the airpods, the Sony early 2000 Bluetooth earpiece look or the giant looking Sennheiser buds that only last 4 hours. I've tried the airpods and the Sennheiser and the airpods pro are definitely not worth their price and although the Sennheiser buds probably have the best sound that I've heard from a wireless bud, 4 hours is just not nearly enough for me.

I am giving these a 2 star, but that is a reach.  The right bud quit working after 5 months.  I tried all the "fixes" to no avail.  The battery indicator is black in the app, but the green light is on saying it is charged.  There is no connection to it at all.  wireless charging is great as is battery life.  So my search for wireless ear buds continues.  So far, 0 out of 2 have been satisfying.  I have 2 pairs that have a wire connecting left to right.  One is fair, but no bass.  The other has bass, but disconnects if my hand or arm gets between the buds and the phone.  These are cheap, under $40, but they still work after over a year!  Klipsch and Samsung = fail.
‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning ‚ö†Ô∏èI received a fake knock off version! They would not link to the Samsung wearables app and the inner speaker mess was not the same as the authentic Samsung Galaxy Bud Plus.

Right Earbud was dead on arrival.Received order 1 day ago.  After charging for 2 hours, I paired earbuds to my phone.  Right earbud was non-responsive.  Checked settings on Galaxy Buds app - case battery was fully charged, left earbud displayed full charge, right earbud was completely dead.  When double checking to insure buds had been paired correctly to my phone- case was paired, left ear paired, right earbud would not register.

So first off, I've only had them 2 days. But I just couldn't wait to review them. So I've had two pairs of samsung level bluetooth headphones. I've had the level u and the level active. Both are great, but the buds plus are way better. The pictures make them look so huge, but they are so tiny. Even the case is tiny. Way smaller than the samsung level actives, but with almost twice the battery without the case. The sound is amazing. Features galore. The ambient sound feature is absolutely amazing for a work environment. I haven't pushed the batteries to the limit. I do work an 9 hour day. I have the ambient sound on high and listen two about two albums throughout the day on top of calls. I had about 35% in each left (34% left 36% right). Once you get them fitted correctly the sound is excellent and loud. Worth every penny. Pairs well with a galaxy watch and s10 plus!

I bought these buds to replace a pair of 2 year old Gear IconX that I've been having serious problems with. I'm VERY happy with my purchase. These buds are smaller and fit my ears more comfortably for long use. The sound quality is far superior and the noise cancellation is almost total. I've been working from home with 2 kids, so being able to block out their noise during conference calls has been clutch. I also use them when I run, but they don't hold up to sweat very well as anticipated. I have to keep pressing them back in my ears. I might have to use the provided fins to hold them in place, but that's not a dealbreaker for me. Great little earbuds. I highly recommend them.

After researching for a week obsessively, I went with the the Galaxy buds plus. Now I have used them on average 6 hours a day for 2 weeks now and j absolutely love them. I have walked, jogged, hiked, and biked in them. The ambient passthrough mode is literally a life saver and probably the best out there. The battery life is unreal and the case battery is so small it goes unnoticed in my pocket.Color, feel, ease of touch functions and comfort make them easy to use all day. My only negative issues  would be the silicone tips. I had trouble getting a good deal with any size. This was easily remedied with taking the old ones off my previous pair. Problem solved. I highly recommend these to anyone looking for a crisp clean sound and all day battery and comfort. (I have heard of other users having low bass issues but with the app and your phones setting this was a kon issue for me, actually find the sound almost 3D and deep)

I have both the original and the Buds+. The sound quality is a tad bit better on the Buds+; however, when it comes to battery life and bluetooth range is where you see the upgrades.On a windy day with my phone in my pocket the original buds would have occasional dropouts in audio, hasn't happened with the Buds+. The battery life has improved, it's nothing to write home about but it is much improved. I feel with how large the case is Samsung could've made them last as long as AirPods and AirPods 2nd gen.
No fluff review for the earphones.Precedence: tried Sony wf-1000xm3 really good but were too heavy, fit was loose, and lacked a good seal.

At first, I was disappointed in the sound quality and comfort of these earbuds. Considering the price, I was expecting more. However, I ran across an article that compared sound quality and comfort of various devices. Surprisingly, it all boiled down to the silicone ear tips. The ones that came with the Galaxy earbuds were not providing the quality I wanted. I experimented with tips from various earbuds I own and finally found a pair that was snug and comfortable. That definitely solved the sound quality and comfort issues with the Galaxy design of their eartips. So if you purchase these earbuds, be prepared to swap out the ear tips and you won't be disappointed in this product.

There are 2 options when using these in windows 10: stereo and hands free. Stereo sounds better, but doesn't work consistently when using full screen games. Sound is working, open the game, sounds cuts off. I need to switch to hands free and get sound, but it's tinny and not ideal. Also, there is audio delay when watching videos on the computer. I just wanted a simple bud that I can use in just one ear while using my computer and for the most part, these do the trick.I only used it briefly on my phone and works fine. It's probably designed more for use with your phone than computer, but I feel it should work perfectly that way, too.

During the covid-19 quarantine, I attend lots of video or audio conference meetings from my Lenovo laptop and galaxy buds+ sometimes do not work properly. Microphone just randomly stops working and cause lots of problems for me.But with my Samsung galaxy phone, I haven't faced any earbuds issues. Biggest disadvantage is that there is no mute button or noise cancellation. It is 2020 but Samsung still launches new products as it is 2010.

So far, so good!  The one and only negative is the touch controls on the ear buds.  The "how to" explanation is too subtle for me to grasp.  I eventually turned the feature off using the App.  I control the volume via the App.  That said, they are comfortable.  The sound is very good.  The charger case works well.  I use them for listening to music and for telephone calls.  Given that my biggest complaint about other wireless earbud that I've owned is the poor battery life, I'll reserve comment in that regard until I've owned these for at least six months.

Apple air pods didn't work for me. (Very uncomfortable) so i was looking at these for sometime now. Once I saw a good deal, I decided to get them and haven't regret it. I'm still learning them and everything they do. I recently learned that when I catch the bus, the left or right bud beeps when the bus is approaching depending on the direction I'm going (cool discovery)Overall, the fit the sound and functionality are great. Had them for about 90 days now, and only had to change the case twice. Haven't tried to see how long they will last full to empty yet, but don't think I will ever need to.
Battery Life: better than anyone üåüLight weight
I bought these for my wife as she has a Samsung phone and I though she might like the compatability features more vs. airpods.Pros:

Seems where some earbuds succeed others may fail, making decision making a bit difficult. In the end, from what I've seen and can attest to, the Samsung Buds+ has the best sound quality, design, battery life (11hrs), and best of all value.Honestly, the only issue I've had with these has been comfort, specifically in my right ear. In other words, I can't speak for any other than myself in this regards. that said I still wanted to give my piece of mind. I'm very torn and although highly considering, haven't yet returned them due to my absolute love for this product.

These earbuds are amazing. They are super comfortable and just stay in the ear. Sound quality is great. Be forewarned that they do not work in skype for business calls, which was why I bought them and the reason for a 3 star review. After 15 minutes into a Skype call, the mic stops functioning and you can no longer be heard. I have posted in the Samsung community and no resolution.

These buds + are seriously amazing. The stuff you can do with them is awesome. The sound, at first, was a little disappointing.  But then I realized I didn't have a tight seal with the size eartips that come installed on the buds. I switched them out for a size bigger and instantly the buds came to life. The noise cancelling is top notch for when you want to escape your surroundings. And when you need to be able to hear your surroundings, turn the "ambient sound" on to 1 of the 3 levels and you'll be able to hear cars coming from behind you if out exercising,  or even be able to hear things at a magnified level if you put the ambient on the highest setting.
