I highly recommend and don't know why anybody would waste money on anything else (cheaper earbuds OR ones that are more money).

These fit great in my ear, and feel great, and sounded decadent. The only problem I had (because I had to return them) was my ears are very sensitive and after only maybe 10-15 mins of use, my ears started to hurt inside my ear canal. Something I've never experienced with OVER the ear headphones. I thought it was maybe cuz I wasn't used to them because these were my first set of earbuds, but every time I used them, my ear canal would hurt. Do after only 2 or 3 days I had to return them, and kept using my BOSE QC35II and no issues.. Because those don't go in my ear. So I would say if your have sensitive ears, DO NOT buy earbuds

The feedback you get from the earbuds is pretty bad. You need to tap (or hold? I'm not really sure) to enable the mic during calls,  but the only feedback you get when either turning it on or off is a simple beep and I can't really tell when it's being turned on or off.I tried to test it in a sound recorder, but guess what? You don't actually get the option to use the mic outside of calls! So I can't even test it outside of calls. In calls, I'm told I sound fuzzy. For how expensive these are, and the fact that this is Samsung's answer to the Airpods, I'm really disappointed.
Honestly just not a fan of these in nearly any dimension...1. The mics pick up too much outside noise to be very good at things like work conference calls or normal phone calls even.
definitely not happy with these ear buds. Left one is super choppy and has issues staying connected. $150, they should work flawlessly...

Muy buena calidad de sonido, la calidad de sonido no superan a los buds live, pero para las personas que buscan traer los aud√≠fonos todos los d√≠as en el trabajo y necesitan tambi√©n escuchar todo el entorno que los rodea estos son los mejores audifonos.Este modelo a comparaci√≥n de los buds live son m√°s compatibles con las diferentes formas de orejas, y son much√≠simo m√°s c√≥modos que los buds live, as√≠ que si tienes oreja peque√±a estos creo q son m√°s recomendados que los buds live y si buscas mejor calidad de sonido, mejor micr√≥fono y un poco m√°s de bater√≠a los buds live.

The sound quality is very good. Good bass, and treble. The mids can lack with certain genres, but still good. Some might be better, but not without spending twice as much. The ambient sound detection is a very nice feature. These are the most comfortable earbuds I've tried. With the different sized tips and wing tips, you can get a perfect, snug fit. They don't come loose under any circumstances I've encountered.  Combined with a Samsung phone, it's a seamless product. Even though the charging case doesn't hold a ton of recharges, 11 hours on a single charge more than makes up for it. Even if you don't have a Samsung phone, the play store app is great for controlling these.

These ear buds exceeded my expectations.  In addition to having excellent sound quality I love that I can adjust the amount of ambient sound that I want.  Also they are so comfortable that I actually forget that I have them in and they stay put.  I had a pair with the ‚Äústem‚Äù and they would pop out if I brushed against them and the stems just hanging out of my ears looked stupid as hell!  These fit right into the ear and actually look cool.  I got them in white because I think they will be easier to find than dark colored buds.  Easy and fast recharge and I have not had the batteries run out even after wearing them for hours on end.

These are the best I ever had after owning 3 other wireless ear buds. The sound is the best. The noise cancelling is the best. The battery life is supper! 11 hours! I only have to charge them once and they are good for me most of the day.  If I need them for longer than 11 hours I only have to put them in the case for a half hour or less and keep on going. The best ear buds ever. I am so satisfied with my purchase. With that being said. These are the only ones that have occasionally popped out of my ear after long time use. So I adjust them every now and then to make sure they are secure. I don't know if it is because I have not found that sweet spot when adjusting them to my ear yet. It only happens every now and then. Not enough to bother me. I hope they improve on that with the next model. I have had these for at least a month now. It happened twice and I use them everyday all day. Not bad.

These sound loads better than the original Galaxy Buds, which I actually liked.  The fit is the same, and is comfortable despite being inside the ear.  The nubs hold them firmly within the ear; I have never once had these fall out of my ears - which is a common problem for me with earbuds, especially those that don't go inside the ear.  No active noise cancellation but the sound isolation is good enough in most scenarios.  The ambient mode is great and I love that you can auto-enable that for phone calls.  If you own a Samsung phone, these are a must-have, and I'd honestly recommend them even to those that have Pixel, LG or other phones.

This have been a pleasure to use when jogging and being out and about for fitness. They stay put in your ear, although sometimes they get a bit heavy (after 2hrs+ of wear) and I can't wait to remove them. They are surprisingly super portable and durable.The sound quality for Bluetooth is fantastic and I don't have much complaints here! However, I have been spoiled by the sound on my Sennheiser Movement, the lack of richness in the base or the nuances of the treble is apparent in these Galaxy buds and can get a bit lost. I've had to fiddle with the preset selection quite a bit to match the sound profile I prefer to listen to.

I was incredibly excited when I received these, but I had a hard time trying to download the app that allows you to customize these. UNFORTUNATELY I have an iPhone 6s - and the app is not compatible with my phone. I believe it requires 7 or later. With that being said, I still love them - the sound quality is good, could be better if I was able to use the app, but hey maybe I'll eventually upate my phone. Just make sure to read ALL the fine print before making purchases. I've had these for over a month and use them almost daily for several hours, I've never ran out of battery life and the case still charges... so far.

I wanted these especially for using with Zoom. These are so comfortable I often forget they are in my ears. The sound is excellent, and others say they hear me clearly.  They do pick up sounds in my environment, but not as much as a previous BT headset. I guess that would happen with speaker mode on a phone, too. The long battery life was important to me. When listening to music, you can tap to go to next track or pause. There's still a lot for me to learn about them.

Honestly the best earbuds you can get for a galaxy phone that aren't hundreds of dollars. They last for a very long time and charge in the case very fast. The case is small and convenient to keep in your pocket all day. Using just one earbud works very well. The ambient sound feature is not exactly what I thought it was and can pickup on other sounds than someone talking, however it is not a big deal.

These are a really nice pair of headphones. I was super hesitant to get make the jump to wireless as I was worried about charging and things but these really take the hassle out of it. The battery life on these is great and has really taken the stress of that out of the situation with the charging case and long life.Samsung has done a really good job partnering the these with their existing tech. The wireless charging on my phone is super nice.

Overall great choice. Very happy. I constantly keep a bud in one ear. Tried to share with my girlfriend, who has small ears--the bud doesn't fit well in her small ear, due not to the ear-canal rubber portion being too large, but the body of the bud itself is too large to fit into the concha of the ear (the area of your ear just outside your ear canal where the body of this earbud rests. Yes, I had to look that word up.) So keep this in mind if you have small outer ears.Infinitely more comfortable than the airpod v1. One other note--yes they work with iphone, but unless you can find an Android device to download the paired app, you will be unable to change the core function of holding down the earbud. Default is call your voice assistant.

I'm normally pretty picky about my music. I've had many earbuds and they've all been disappointing. Picked up the Galaxy Buds + as it seemed to have excellent reviews. My Buds+ arrived today and I installed the Wear app on my Galaxy Note 9. For me, I had to change out the ear canal inserts to get a nice fit. These buds are very comfortable...unbelievable.  I normally use Amazon Music since it seems to have much better sound than Pandora. I fired up some music and could not believe how nice these sound. They have an excellent, clear and clean sound quality. Bass is surprisingly very nice, not overpowering, but it's there. Once I got the buds fitting nice and the app set, the music is just incredible.  Also, the battery life is amazing. Currently, I'm on my first charge and I'm at 5 hours and only at 70%. The range is great, I got about 50-60 feet away before it started skipping. For this price point, there is nothing that's going to sound better than the Buds+.  Nice job Samsung!!!  Just buy them....you won't be disappointed.

I like that they fit inside my ear as oppose to hanging out of your ear. It has that slick low-key design to it. People can't really tell you have them on until they get up close to you. The battery last me all day and I work 12 to 14 hours shift. There's no noise cancelation on these if that's what you're looking for. But the ambient sound on these are the best. It's almost like you're having superman hearing. I had the first Gen and then I upgraded to these ones when they first came out. So far these do not disappoint me.

I purchased this product in March 2020 and not even a year later the right ear bud won't hold a charge at all. I have cleaned out the case and there is no damage to the product. I have called Amazon for a replacement since I use them for work and school and figured that since I had also purchased the protection plan(3 yr coverage) that I should be ok. Not! I was bounced from the amazon rep,to tech support, to Samsung rep and then the Samsung supervisor. No one at any given time was willing to offer a replacement but wanted me to send them in to be fixed(2 week turn around) and I informed them that this wasn't possible. The only other option given to me was to drive out of my way to go to their chosen store to get them fixed. It was made clear to me that their convenience and need outweighed my own as the customer.I will not be purchasing another Samsung product. 3 stars.

I like the fact the microphone is on the outside so you can hear ambient noise if you want/need to. It's nice to be able to hear what's going on around you when you've got earbuds in and then to cancel out everything to hear a call or music if you so choose. They fit so well, and come with sizers to change to fit your ear properly, I'm actually surprised at how will they stay in your ears. All around amazing!

Bought two sets for spouse and me to use with our two new Galaxy Tabs S6. In addition, we each have a Galaxy S9 mobile phone. The earbuds work flawlessly with either device and connecting to/switching between them is a snap. Long battery life in both the earbuds themselves and the case/battery charger. Charging the case/earbuds is easy and relatively fast since we can simply put the case on the  same Samsung charging stand we use for our phones. I use mine a lot and, in a month of daily use, I have not had an instance where I've run out of charge. I am pleased with this purchase.

Bought two sets for spouse and me to use with our two new Galaxy Tabs S6. In addition, we each have a Galaxy S9 mobile phone. The earbuds work flawlessly with either device and connecting to/switching between them is a snap. Long battery life in both the earbuds themselves and the case/battery charger. Charging the case/earbuds is easy and relatively fast since we can simply put the case on the  same Samsung charging stand we use for our phones. I use mine a lot and, in a month of daily use, I have not had an instance where I've run out of charge. I am pleased with this purchase

I debated on spending the money on quality bt earbuds. I'm glad I bought these. I use them frequently when working out, mowing the lawn, or working on projects. The sound quality is better than I expected. The sound can be customized using the galaxy wearable app on your phone, which is nice. There is a good balance and the sound is clear. The bass is also better than I anticipated. The volume is not the loudest I've used but it's enough. It's not lacking. I have had no issues with charging, taking calls, or any function. The battery has easily lasted over 4 hours with no problems.  I'm very happy with these.

I had the original galaxy buds the yellow ones. Pretty much the same for me just glad they improve the sound for calls. I also like that the case doesn't open so easily like the previous ones and like the different ear attachments which is a plus not everyone has the same shape with their ears. I do have apple products so I do have the ipods the regular ones so it was a no brainer to get both. Ipods clearly don't work the best with Android so stick with the buds if you do. I hands down will use samsung products anyday because their products are so user friendly.

I own the previous version of the Galaxy Buds and also own the Airpods Pro. I wanted to give this a shot and so far, it is so good! When I started using the first gen Galaxy Buds, it started off wack with so many connection issues, but that wasn't the case with this. Adjusting the bass, it sounds just as good as the Airpods Pro and worth the price. I recommend this for anyone who doesn't want to spend $250 on a pair of headphones.

I really like these earbuds. I had tried many different styles (wired, wireless, over-ear, in-ear) to try to fit my ears. These fit great, and feel very secure. I use the small ear tips and large ear wings. The battery life is sufficient for what I need, and the case battery lasts for week without charging. The controls are easy to learn, and work well. The noise cancellation is great- I could mute all sounds except my own. That was great when a family member was in a loud conference call while I was taking a test. These earbuds aren‚Äôt water-resistant (I think they‚Äôre IP-X2, splashproof), but I plan on using them inside anyway. Good for my needs!Overall, I enjoy using these.

These are excellent earbuds! Coming from the powerbeat 3s, which cost the same as these new, they sound way better!!!! The bass is good, nothing crazy, but definitely there. The sound is very clear and ambient sound is a dope feature! It didn't have noise cancelation, but the seal provides a good amount of isolation. On top of that I bought these used -very good for $90. They look and sound brand new. There are no scuffs, scratches, or any signs that they have been dropped. If i wasn't told they were new I wouldn't even know it. Compared to my $150 powerbeats these are louder, more clear, and the bass is stronger!! These could easily cost double what they do. Very impressed, I love these!
+ i did not expect such a good sound from this tiny things (only normal preset is fine; others sound like sh!t)+ battery life is really impressive!!!

I see a lot of reviews regarding the intensity of its bass lacking.  It can be improved and enhanced by finagling with your phone's audio settings and with Buds+.  The clarity of these is simply awesome.Since my left ear is very different than my right in size and shape, I accommodated each bud securely by using the extra and different sized bud accessories included.

I was debating between buying these or AirPod Pros. In a side-by-side comparison between the two, the sound quality is very on par with one another. I love using the Dynamic and Bass Boost settings on these. I also enjoy the touch pad. The battery life is excellent. The audio is also great with calls. I love the variety of ambient settings, but my ONLY complaint is that if you‚Äôre outside, ambient is very sensitive to any wind, and it‚Äôs really annoying. Overall, I would recommend these, especially since they‚Äôre less costly than the Pros.

First day with these and I wore them 10 straight hours. No soreness, no discomfort, single full charge. Only a 4 on sound quality and noise cancel because...1 day. Looking forward to more "testing". AND...they came a day early!  They come with 3 size fittings. Buy them and see for yourself.Edit: the only true issue that I have is that replacement fit covers aren't offered as an add on or suggested item. Don't lose or damage them.

I only have a couple pairs of true wireless headphones so I don't have much to compare it to, but man oh man these headphones absulotely rock! Plenty of ear tips and wing tips to get a good seal and block out ~80% of the noise around you(there is no active noise cancellation, not a deal breaker for me) and you could always bump up the volume and you barely hear anything around you. Very nice lightweight buds that don't look ridiculous, if you're using a Samsung device like I am the connectivity is flawless, I just turn on Bluetooth on the phone and open up the case and they're already paired in about 5 seconds. Highly recommend!!!!!

Have had these ear buds for about a month and really like them so far. Fit perfectly and never fall out. Are comfortable to wear and sound great. Block out noise very well. The phone sounds very well and people on the other end say I come through very clear without picking up noise. Haven't talked with them on outside so don't know about wind. Usually I can walk quite a ways away from device I'm connected to without losing connection. Have been a couple of days I could not go far. Might be because of not being fully charged. Noticed that when they are fully charged no problems. I do have interference going out to garage from the kitchen which I lose connection. I have walked upstairs to furthest bedroom from the same spot in kitchen and not lose connection. Outside i can walk at least 30 feet away.
Galaxy Buds+ is better than Buds, but not good enough for me.The sound is kindle same with last one, or maybe 20% better.

Just received these yesterday. Absolutely love the color! I selected, cloud blue, reminds me of a Cinderella blue. Although if I am being honest, the sound quality is almost identical to the Galaxy buds but the real reason I purchased these, were because of the extended battery life. They exceeded my expectation in that field. They truly do last 20 hrs. The ambient sound option is also improved when compared to the Galaxy buds. Overall it is an upgrade from the previous model. And with that being said, both are a good option to purchase. Its all up to whether you have a bit more to splurge.

Every single minor complaint I had with first gen Galaxy Buds was addressed with the Galaxy Buds+. Everything I wish the first gen had or did, these ones have it or do it. Much clearer ambient sound, like cant even tell you have headphones in. You can use ambient sound while on a call. A much better overall battery life. Clearer and better sound quality overall. Better setup with the Galaxy Gear app. Massively improved voice recognition for voice commands through headphones. I cannot say enough good things about these. The Galaxy Buds+ are without a doubt worth the extra $50 over the first gen Galaxy Buds. I recommend them 100%.

First I want to tell, really really fastly shipping. I ordered 4 am and I received 9 am in same day!! I loved this colour. So It has a modern and stylish design.  It does not fall from the ear.  You do not feel uneasy wearing the headphones will fall while listening to music.  It provides great comfort while cycling.  There's heavy traffic right now and I don't hear car voices

I came from airpods and did not like the in war feel of these at first. They did grow on me and the sound pass through is fantastic.ibuse these at work every day and because they are in war they block a lot of noise which is great. I can enable pass through when needed by a long touch and talk to my coworkers. The touch controls are really good too giving you a lot more control over these than airpods. Battery life is a big sell here for me. They can last a 10 hour work day when my airpods were dead before lunch.

I have an issue with earbuds. They usually hurt or won't stay put for too long, and are heavy in the ear. AKG has so far made the only ones I like with the ones that come with the phones when you buy them (hardcore Galaxy fan here), but they're wired and I never thought I could get an earbud that I really liked.I saw AKG makes these and that was the selling point for me. I got them, immediately put them in and was not disappointed. They fit my small ears well. So let me list for you the pros and cons here so you can decide for yourself.

I am a college student and with the ongoing pandemic, I figured I would splurge a little and treat myself to good quality earbuds. Colleges praised the mic on the original galaxy buds and friends sounded crystal clear over calls with these buds. I received my pair and absolutely loved them for about a week. They work miraculously paired to my Galaxy S8 and the Galaxy Wearable app makes these buds sound extremely nice. Everything works smoothly when connected to my phone, however when I connect to my Surface Pro 7, these buds have a serious audio lag. I tried for hours to mess with my audio settings to make sure it was not my device but nothing seems to fix the issue. This makes it extremely problematic and almost impossible to participate in meetings and online lectures. People can hear me fine but my audio cuts out constantly. The same happens with listen to music and videos and is extremely annoying for having spent so much dough. I shot my shot and concluded they great for commutes and leisure but not fantastic for classwork. Again they work fine paired to a phone, but they are trash when paired to laptop devices.

First pair i bought were defective but i was able to return them for a refund.  No issue. Bought another pair and they work beautifully. Great sound quality and i love all the features it has to interact with my Note 10+Was worried they wouldn't fit in my ears since I've always stayed away from buds because they usually just fall out of my ear. But these fit perfectly. I can dance, workout, ride my nit, etc. With these and they dont budge.

I did lots of research and decided to go with these instead of the AirPods. For 5 months, they were great...no complaints except the touch commands aren‚Äôt very responsive. One day at work, I took the left bud out so I could better hear coworkers if they needed me. The next day, the left bud wouldn‚Äôt connect to the case or charge. I have tried all of the suggestions from Samsung to no avail. Apparently it‚Äôs a common problem and they make it very difficult to utilize their one year warranty. I‚Äôm waiting to hear from them after messaging them, but I don‚Äôt plan on wasting hours and hours of time like other people have reported doing. I just won‚Äôt purchase anything from Samsung again. I did like them when they worked, tho, so it‚Äôs a shame.Edit* On 9/26 I received my repaired earbuds in the mail! It did take a handful of back-and-forth messages, 4-5, and 3 weeks, but they paid for shipping UPS and the repair was free. Interestingly enough, after I wrote this initial review, I went ahead and ordered the AirPods Pro and after receiving my galaxy buds+ back yesterday, I processed the return of my AirPods. They are just not as comfy as the buds and way too expensive to hurt my ears! I just hope the repair lasts on these!

When it comes to wireless earbuds I more sound and features kind of guy. If the earbuds have good features but do not sound good I will not buy them. If they have good sound and ok features I may consider them, but when it comes to the Samsung buds plus they are really worth it sound is amazing and love the touch feature and especially the feature that allows ambient noise so you can hear the outside while wearing your buds. If i had to compare these buds between the Bose soundSport wireless earbuds for 200 these Samsung buds plus do not compare anything to the Bose soundSport. If you are looking for earbuds and you are looking at Bose because its a well known brand, save your self the time and get the Samsung buds plus for 148 instead of spending 200 and you get more features that the Bose SoundSport does not have and the sound is louder to and sounds better. Now with the Samsung buds plus you may not get the good thumping you want like you do with the Bose but you can change the equalizer to one of the presets to your liking. To make a long story short, These are the best wireless  buds i have ever owned. It is not about the price that makes the buds better. its about the brand and quality and how they sound. I am surprised to say that a 148 pair of earbuds are better then a 200 dollar buds. You would think the high dollar ones are better but that is not always the case. You never know til you try the product out. I have hear reviews that say the sound is not wow taking and i have heard reviews that these are fantastic buds and I'm going to agree with the fantastic buds. Sorry to all for making a long review but the more detail the better the review and the more it helps others understand the awesomeness in these Samsung buds plus.

Great headphones I'm really impressed I switched from airpods pro. Comparing them biggest things I noticed was buds had more bass without a doubt but airpods pro got louder.  However the volume was my only complaint especially without noise cancelation...however I did find an app for Android called "volume booster" that makes these painfully loud (200% boost). Personally I think they are more comfortable than airpods and feel more secure. Just to summarize since I got these and the volume booster I haven't picked up my airpods 1 time

I work in a loud area, and these really drowned out the noise so I can hear the music loud and clear. Plus the battery life is insane. Used them for a little over 9hrs and they still had juice! Lastly, they stay in place. I put them on and violently shook my head. They stay like magic! Also the Galaxy Wearables app makes them even better!!

The battery life, audio quality and compatibility with my note 9 is wonderful. They connect super fast, the ambient sound feature works great.My problem lies with these things constantly loosening and falling from my ears. I have tried all 3 sets of tips and wings, all giving me the same problem.

AMAZING product. I've gotten fed up of trying to find quality products. Everything has a caveat these days - battery life, bluetooth connectivity, buggy noise canceling, etc.These products just work. I take them out of the case and they pair to my phone before they're in my ears. I take them out of the case and they pair to my laptop (Windows 10) before they're in my ears (unless they were previously paired to my phone, in which case I need to manually pair them via bluetooth settings on the laptop).

The battery life alone sold this for me as I usually listen to music during work. It'll last my whole shift, a jog after work, and some audiobook time at night with still over 50% charge on the case.The sound quality isn't the greatest compared to some higher end earbuds or headphones, it does deliver clear sound with good highs and decent bass. It may not be for some audiophile purists, but for most it will do just fine.

I spent hours reviewing options, these got such high reviews, and seemed the right match for my Samsung Galaxy S9+. I'm completely disappointed. I mostly use them for walking. Facing upwind (in a breezy area) they catch the breeze and get wind noise interference. And I get "dropouts" even while holding my phone in my hand, no matter the app being used. I spend a lot of time walking in an isolated locale during this pandemic and this is just one more disappointment to add to everything else (fully aware, a small thing compared to what could be). I only bought these because my over-the-neck earphones finally gave up. They did not have great sound, but worked just fine. This rather pricey "upgrade" is a complete failure.

These things have adequate sound for listening to podcasts and music. The equalizer is pretty much non-existent. None of the settings make much difference. The received sound during telephone calls is marginal, the transmitted sound is an unintelligible staticky mess. No one can understand anything I say. If I wasn‚Äôt passed the return date, I‚Äôd send them back. Fail on the telephone use, adequate on the rest.

Excellent battery life, lasts all day at work and then some. Sound quality is great, but not mind blowing. Bass could be a little better. Doesn't have Active Noise Canceling, but you don't need it since these seal in your ears. Ambient sound is a life saver at work when you need to hear what's going on around you. I really like the touch controls, very customizable, and the volume up and down controls are a nice upgrade from the original Galaxy Buds. Call quality is crystal clear, even when I'm 10 or 15 feet away from my phone. Buy them, you won't be disappointed.

Prior to taking the jump into "expensive" wireless earbuds, I used to use those taotronics earbuds, which lasted me a full year before running into any battery/connection issues. Thinking I could get my money's worth in a more expensive product, I bought these.The sound quality was awesome, and a huge upgrade, and the fit was awesome when I was running/ working out. The seal is also great, even without ANC these do a great job of blocking out noise. (To the point where I can't tell a big difference between these and my ANC headphones when it comes to everyday use; I'm sure in planes or in loud places there's a difference.)

These are wonderful. They sound amazing and fit me very well. There isn't much I can say that hasn't been said better by someone else.-HOWEVER- If you ride a motorcycle. And, if like me, you are concerned about your earbuds being pulled out while pulling your helmet on and off? I can tell you that in my experience they have always stayed put perfectly while putting my helmet on. Taking my helmet off does pull them loose, but not all the way out. And for that, I couldn't be happier to finally have good quality music on my rides where I can still hear traffic and my engine. Even if I have to push them in a little bit after I get off the bike.

I bought these hoping that some people were over-exaggerating about these headphone's flaws. I was looking for a non-Apple/reasonably priced pair of wireless headphones for phone calls and exercise. These are good for neither. They are only just barely compatible with iphone, and one side frequently doesn't connect. I have to reset the bluetooth connection about every other time I use them. The ambient sound feature isn't a good thing. It just increases the volume of things happening outside of your headphones. Trying to jog with these was a joke. The sound of wind flying between my ear and the headphones was so loud I could not hear my music. It was only audible while walking. These also have about four different touch "buttons" on the sides. So if you need to adjust them in your ears, you're bound to pause your music, hang up your phone call, or blast the volume on accident. Total waste of money.

First of all it's a Samsung. You can't go wrong with any of their products.Sound is amazing!! Especially when it's on the dynamic mode. With dual drivers in each earbud, everything is crisp and clear. The biggest seller for me was the ambient sound mode. With this you can listen to music and still hear people around you . This works well especially if you're at work. They have a low, medium and high setting just in case it's too much. And today.....as I got out of the car to walk towards my house I accidentally dropped one of the earbuds, that was laying in my lap in the car, on the ground when I got out.  Of course I panicked thinking I'd never find it and probably misplaced it at work thinking it's lost for good now. Then  I remembered that on the Galaxy wearable app there's a way to find a lost earbud by tapping find my earbud. When you tap it and if it's close by, you'll  hear a loud chirping sound. Thankfully I found it on my front lawn. If it wasn't for that feature I would have been SOL big time. Another big reason I'm satisfied with this product.  üëçüòÅüòé

These things don't sound very good to me, in fact they sound just as bad as the gen 1 version which my wife has. When I compare them to the standard corded AKG buds that came with my Galaxy S9 there's absolutely no comparison. The corded phones have more clear bass, smoother presence, less fatiguing highs. You know, like real headphones. The upgraded sound was the main selling point and why I decided to spend the extra money on these but I'm disappointed. I'm sticking with my corded phones for music listening while these are just for meetings and phone calls.

i was originally going to purchase the IPHONE air pods, even though I have an android phone.  But all the features won't work with an android phone,  so I decided to buy these and love them very good quality. Love the charging case. Charge on these ear pods last about 9 hours of talking time. Not straight talking time but like calls off and on all day. Which is good. Glad I got these.

I'm a cheapy when it comes to headphones. I purchased the raycon 55 which were serviceable but terrible bass. Then I got some knock off brand $30 cheap plastic actually decent sound but failed every where else. Did not want air pods because I just think they look silly with the book. And I was going to go with the original air buds but for $50 more it seem to make sense. What I can say these sound amazing! Balanced sound and bass great clarity. I wish call volumes little louder buts a knit pick. I purchased these actually because working from home amid covid I needed good teleconference ear buds. But now we use zoom so I use them to hear and cancel out background noises. When music is on they basically are noise cancelling. I have Samsung level over the ear blue tooth headphones as well and will put those against Bose. Great product!

Disclaimer: I've had these for about a week nowAlright, let's start with the negatives first since there really aren't that many. First off, the ambient sound feature is cool, definitely something that previous wireless earbuds didn't have, but it's a bit weak in my opinion. I have to turn my music way down in order to listen to someone who's trying to talk to me from about 3 feet away. Second, the sound quality is great, but you kinda have to shove the buds deep into your ear to hear the bass clearly, which starts hurting the outside of your ears after 30 mins or so (it might just be because my ears are small but who knows). Thirdly, the touch system on the earbuds' pads are VERY sensitive. I could be combing my hair and if I accidentally touch the bud at all during a stroke of the brush, my music will pause.

I'll keep it simple. Worth the money.I ordered three. Only one came with a small issue. It would sometimes disconnect from one side, randomly. Unusually but it happened, figured I would mention it. I returned it.

I absolutely love so much about these! Where do I start? The battery legit lasts about 11 hours. The sound has great quality. I prefer the bass booster setting. I love how the app allows you to modify the settings. When I first heard of ambient sound I didn't think I'd like it because it sounded weird. However, after using it, I love it! Being able to hear my surroundings without compromising the volume of the music is an incredible feature. The functions make it easy to switch ambient sound on and off. Lastly, even though they aren't noise cancelling, they block out nearly all sound. This is crazy because I only use about 50% volume. I highly recommend these!

These are my first wireless earbuds so I don't really have much to compare to. I investigated a few pairs but decided  I wanted a a good pair w/o the huge price tag and features I would never use.So far these are working very well with phone calls and listening. The ambient sound controls are very useful when at work or transit as they allow peripheral noises that allow you to be aware of surroundings. Overall I am pleased with my purchase and would recommend these. I am glad I waited for the upgrade as the 1st gen had complaints about call quality.

Great when they worked, but left bud stopped working. It was charged, tried re-pairing, resetting earbuds. Tried letting the case and buds die completely, then fully recharge. Can't seem to get it to work. Left bud is completely grayed out in Wearable app, as if it isn't paired. Looked online and followed numerous guides, no dice. Short of taking them in, im at a loss of what else to do. Loved them while they worked, and ambiance feature is very nice for while I am at work and need to communicate, or even while I'm out and about. Sound quality is impressive for their size, and I found them to be very comfortable, and battery life is outstanding. Would recommend 100% if both buds worked no issue.

These are great on battery life and have the same basic functions as the 1st buds, but the touch response is awful.  They are slow to pause or they don't respond at all. They also don't catch all of the taps each time. Also, don't get the white ones, I've had these for about a month and they are already dingy.

Not as good as expected. Can't get more than 20 ft from your phone. Call quality is good per everyone I speak with. Good battery life. Not great for listening to music. Not loud enough and bass is definitely lacking.

I got these because I was unable to find a pair of comfortable Bluetooth headphones. I intended to use them for Zoom calls. Audio quality is fine, but it's a coin toss if people can hear me, and if they can, another coin toss if they can hear me *well*. Part of the problem is the touchpads on the buds which affect volume/muting etc... which are difficult to avoid when inserting. They are somewhat comfortable. I find myself switching back to my uncomfortable headphones frequently.
These earbuds are amazing!Pros:

I got this for work, primary purpose was for Zoom calls and phone calls. It would frequently disconnect and send my laptop into a haywire situation, where it would completely shutdown all sound from the laptop, headset, headphones, other devices etc. and I needed to restart my computer.I also got this in order to play games with friends over Discord and Zoom calls, but it had a terrible connection. My friends voices were frequently distorted and laggy, but worst of all was my voice had about a 3 second lag time and it was incredibly annoying. I'm connected to Zoom/Discord over bluetooth obviously using my Samsung A50.

Sound quality is rather okay-ish, even with the app's equalizer. Reminds me of those early '90s dollar store headphone days quality. Figured the brand name would be better than those in the under $50 category but not too sure. Finish is great, & comes with enough sizing parts to fit many ear types. Will find more out about battery life after extended use but lasted for quite a while depending on use. Microphones work fine & no issues with calls. These are not noise cancelling, but will block most noises if you're willing to damage your eardrums by cranking up the music.

I bought this to compare it with the google pixel bud2. Overall I would say that this is an AMAZING set of earphones. I am NO audiophile, but trust me when I tell you that you will be amazed with the sound quality. I also like the ambient sound mode where you can hear your surrounding while listening to your music.For calls I have had mixed experiences. Some calls have been crystal clear and other have been a bit finicky. Unsure what the issue is.

My journey to falling love with the Buds+ took three less-than-stellar experiences with other models.  First was the Boltune Bluetooth V5.1.  Music quality was good.  Call quality was poor.  They wouldn‚Äôt stay in my ears and operation of the buds was not intuitive.  Next was the Jabra Elite Active 75t.  I expected so much more for the price they charge.  Fit was not comfortable or secure.  People I called had a difficult time hearing me.  Next up were the AirPods.  They were good quality and decent fit.  Battery life was relatively short and I didn‚Äôt like that they require a third party app for just partial integration with Android.With some trepidation from my poor experiences, I bought the Buds+.  I think they are perfect!  Super comfortable and secure in my ears.  Call quality is great on both ends.  Music is a pleasure.  Battery life is terrific.

I love them more than any other ear buds that I've owned but they arent  Water resistant at all supposedly and mine only last around 8-9 hours but they are still amazing and last longer than any others out there plus they sound amazing and you cant even feel them in your ears hardly even after 9 hours straight I love them and that's why I love everything Samsung lol

I tried many brands and types of headsets and  this one is one of the best. Battery life is awesome 11-12 hours of listening, sound is great controls are nice I like that you have to tap twice to pick or hang up the call (no accidental hanging up while correcting fit) Only down side is a range definitely a lot shorter then other sets I used but I will trade that for 12h of battery life

I gave them a test run I‚Äôm sold I got sick of my AirPods falling out hurts your ear after awhile and always having to forget device and reconnect and it wants to read out text when it wants too AirPods generation 1 suck not worth the money these pods plus are awesome fit perfect and don‚Äôt fall out the sound is amazing and you have way more option with tapping pause rewind skip sound works great on my iPhone with the app don‚Äôt think about it just buy them you won‚Äôt be disappointed
Pros:- sound quality is very good; deep bass with sharp vocal and treble

I had gone through a lot of earbuds for my workouts and I can say that in terms of comfort, range, and the ability to stay in your ears in quick motions workouts. These earbuds stand the test of time. Awesome ambient mode and multiple touch options to play, skip, pause, and replay. With the battery in the case, these buds have the longevity to last for the entire day of listening and then some. No active noise cancelling but with how they fit, you can barely hear anything around you without ambient mode turned on. Bass is a little lacking but for the price its a bargain compromise compared to the air-pods pro being twice the cost.

These work we'll while I'm in the office working (not moving around much), but the moment I go outside to jog or any physical activity they start cutting out. Another issue I had with the first pair was the touch pad on the ear bud started flaking off (these were returned).

Sound is pretty good. It's very clear, but could benefit from increased bass response. It seemed flat at first, but changed the EQ setting to Dynamic in the Galaxy Wearable app which greatly improved the sound. The others EQ settings are terrible. Ambient sound works well enough, but don't expect it to sound you're not wearing the buds. While sounds do come through very well, it's very tinny and artificial sounding. The passive noise cancellation works as well as one might expect, but it dependent on getting a good seal. 3 sets of tips and 2 sets of wings are provided, so you should be able to find a combo that works well for most ears.

Well that was disappointing. Decided to get wireless in ear this time and the leftnone would not function at all. The case recognized it per the charging light but my Galaxy s9+ only ever saw the right bud. Tried all kinds of troubleshooting but it seems this is a widespread issue if you search online. Wish I had seen that prior to buying, hopefully I can find a different brand.

I bought these on impulse after I washed my last pair of bluetooth headphones at work. The last pair were a $40 pair and the price difference shows. The Buds+ are extremely comfortable. I didnt realize they have an option for ambient noise which is perfect for work. Now I can wear both buds but not miss important information going on around me. Call quality is great. Sound for music and movies is great. The touch sensors are a *little* too sensitive for me. If I roll over in bed with them on, my pillow can pause my show. You can lock the touch pad sensors in the app. I wish there was a way to dull the sensitivity like on a cell phone screen. I also wish I didnt have to go out of the way to purchase a case for the case. It feels fragile and it's so small I could lose it. I decided to buy a case with a carabiners clip so that way I can clip it to a bag or my jeans. Overall extremely satisfied. I definitely wont be washing this pair.

I normally don't write reviews however when a product works well we have to tell others.  I have a Samsung s8 (soon upgrading to the s20 ultra). I also own Samsung gear s3 smart watch and a few Samsung televisions. The Galaxy Buds+ synced up really with my phone.  They have this feature called Ambient sound.  It works extremely well if you work in a environment were you have to be aware of surrounding,  however if the volume of your media is too high you won't be able to understand a person talking next to you. I personally love this because I can listen to music while I also interact with the outside world all without taking my headphones off.  They are small and light weight.  My dreadlocks covers mines, so people often don't notice I'm wearing them.  I love that they charge wirelessly in case. The case is a bit small for my liking and also very smooth. The equalizer controls are in the galaxy wearable app, and are comparable to their labeling.  I prefer to be able to control my equalizer level in all ranges. The controls are a simple series of taps and a tap and hold command. The tap and hold commands can be changed from either voice command, spotify, Ambient sound, volume up, volume down for either right or left ear bud. One thing to be aware of is that if choose to use tap and hold as volume control the other earbud will automatically set other earbud as well. I love that if miss place a earbud I can make it alert. Music and media sound quality is great. The call quality is wonderful when coupled with the ambient sound because your able to hear yourself and the person your talking to clearly. The only thing about these earbuds that I don't like is that if you use the ambient sound feature you have to be careful not to cover the bottom mic otherwise causes feedback loop.

I was enjoying them but one earbud started having low sound one day. Called Samsung support and they want me to send it to them. It's extremely unfortunate and frustrating that a product would break so soon.Update :

The new virsion earbuds are the best pair I used, they have fast and perfect connection between single or both earbuds and devices. The sound is pretty good except when I played Red Alert 3.  Compaired with music and background sounds in video, the human voice is relatively weak. Meanwhile, sometime the sound seems a little bit wired.(I dont know whether it is issue of stream source or defect of buds) . All in all, currently sumsung +buds seem like the best choice, compared with other TWS products, such as airpod, sennheiser momentum, powerbeats, hammerhead.

These are by far the best pair of headphones I've ever owned. The sound quality is amazing and calls are crystal clear. The ambient sound is a plus when you're out and about and need to be aware of what's going on around you while listening to music or whatever. They pair immediately when I open them with my galaxy s9 and the battery life is exceptional I work an 8 hour day and when I get off they're still at 35%. If you're looking for a pair of really good headphones and have the money look no further these will not disappoint.

I'm loving these wireless earbuds!  I've never had a pair before so I have nothing to compare to but the sound quality is excellent.  You have the ability to have "ambient noise" on or off which means that you can hear what is going on around you or have conversations if you choose.  Or, if you are in a noisy environment, you can switch that feature off.I wish the battery life was a little longer but the charging case gets them charged back up pretty quickly.

I love these things these are officially the 5th pair of Bluetooth headphones I've owned and I've come to learn you get what you pay for. These don't have the issues the cheap sets do. I don't have to worry about them randomly turning on, connecting, and taking audio off of my car speaker and throwing it into headphones in the center console where I can't hear it. Not an issue with these babies. I even had someone in public notice them and ask what brand they were. That's never happened. I highly recommend these. Excellent ambient sound balancing (most interesting/unique feature)  noise cancelling, firmware update via app. Ultra portable, excellent battery, wireless charging. All boxes ticked.

First off, i am an aalllllll SAMSUNG PRODUCT PERSON!  Overall,  though im going to continue to use them  because i spent my money on them,  they are more of a pain than pleasure.  Battery life completely sucks. And maybe my ears are weird but none of the esear plug sizes keep ther buds in my ear.  If i could return them,  i would

Love the buds, but they stopped working the other day, and troubleshooting is a joke, because they no longer connect to any devices, which makes the software 100% useless.Called support, but since I bought it on Amazon, I have to wait around 3 weeks, for them to ship me a box, ship it to them, have them look at it, and then they'll call me, to tell me if they will send me out a new set. Yeah, sure, I'll hold my breath. Samsung support is a nightmare.

- three different ear sizes to choose from for the silicone pieces that snuggle in your ear- Is the noise cancellation 100% isolating? You can hear hiccups here and there but know I like them so much I use them in the morning when my family is contributing to my chronic sleep deprivation.

Wow.. Nothing but GOOD. I have a Samsung Galaxy Note 10 and I wanted something to pair well with my phone. At first I did my research on skull candy, bose, and beats. None of the reviews won up to these buds. I read nothing but good about the regular buds and these buds+. all I can say is I am satisfied and in LOVE with the buds+. The connection and sync is on point. As soon as I opened them they connected to my phone right away! No hassle, easy set up with the Wear App already in my phone.SET UP ‚Ä¢Satisfied with the different TouchPad settings, the Equalizer choices and especially the Ambient Sound settings! The Ambient sound setting is what sold me, its so crisp and clear when set up to the users preference. Or you can just easily turn it off to enjoy the awesome noise cancelation! You won't be disappointed.

I really like the comfort of the buds, but unfortunately came defective. Sometimes the connection get lost. Not super good noise cancelation but it‚Äôs still ok. Sounds quality is pretty good, and I like the control app. Battery life I don‚Äôt think is what they says 11 hours straight, but still good like 6-8 hour play time.
I don't normally leave reviews, but I just cannot resist this time.Pro - the setup for these is really nice and simple. I do like how simple they are to setup and the use is nice and simple as well.

I'm on the phone 4-8 hours per day for work. My airpods were a few years old and would hardly make it though an hour long call. I was looking for the best battery life in replacement headset. I'm totally impressed. I popped these in at 9am and took them out at 5pm. Had about 5 hours of call time and they were still at over 50% battery capacity!The sound quality is fine- nothing amazing but nothing bad. It took a bit to figure out the fit but once I got it they don't fall out.

Update: second pair arrived very quickly, but to my disappoinment there is something terribly wrong with the sound quality.  I'm done.  Will try another brand.Arrived defective.  Left bud could not be found by 2 different phones and the set only played through the right bud.  Connecting the right bud was easy with the samsung app.  Disappointed that they arrived defective.  Will peer-review if exchange pair works.

I recieved my galaxy buds+ cloud blue today. I ain't expected crazy sounding ear buds. But once I paired them to do a sound test I was blown away, the bass was strong along with the treble and mids was like wise. They sound like the over ear AKG headphones. I have B&O E8 ear buds and I swear the galaxy buds plus blow them out the water far as sound quality and call quality,  along with battery life. But be mindful I have a galaxy Note 10 plus phone. So with the Dolby Atmos on really push these ear buds over the top. I'm being honest, these Galaxy buds+ is the best ear buds on the market. I ain't expected this from $150 ear buds. I paid $300 for my B&O E8 and they dont compare. If a person say galaxy buds ain't loud with strong bass and bright Treble. Then they need to order ear wax cleaner.

I was surprised that these ear buds sounded so horrible when listening to music considering the generally positive reviews and the overall rating. I found these work great for phone calls, I love the form factor and how they fit in my ears, and the tap interface was intuitive and responsive. However I was extremely disappointed by their sound quality when listening to music--at first. The ear buds are tinny, with barely any bass response. Vocals sounds like they are coming through a tin can. Despite messing with the equalizer in the app and on my iPhone I couldn't get them to sound good at all compared to my older AirPods. However, after doing some research online I found that the ear tips and wings that you use can make a difference. I thought the mediums were a good fit, but I went up in size to the large and what a difference in the music! Be sure to try all the ear tips and wings before deciding if you like or don't like these ear buds, because they made a huge difference in the quality of the sounds after I found the proper fit.

La m√∫sica o sonidos de los videos es muy baja y si cancelas el SONIDO AMBIENTAL no escuchas nada de m√∫sica,  mal producto por este precio con 40 d√≥lares compras algo con las mismas caracter√≠sticas. La bater√≠a soporta escuchando m√∫sica 10 hrs pero no 16 como las caracter√≠sticas dicen.

Hey this is a great product. I love the sound, really confortable to use, it fits perfectly in my ears qith the ear pads it brings on by default. The battery life is great. I have no complains I'm really pleased_____________EDIT_____________

I bought these as a birthday day gift for my boyfriend. He was using my first gen Apple AirPods. But he loves these!! He enjoys the sound quality and how easy it is to pair them with his Samsung phone. There‚Äôs also multiple ear piece sizes that are great, it‚Äôs also a wireless charging case, and battery life has been decent for him, for all that you get, it‚Äôs a fair price!

Initially bought for perceived quality and expected sound experience and was severely let down by sound quality with a complete lack of quality bass and treble! They fit and feel high quality and the case is beautiful but after adjusting the settings for hours I was disheartened to learn it was as good as it got which wasn't very good for $149! They do not sound as well sorted as even the wired speakers that come with the phone. I plan on returning after 1 week of ownership

These earbuds have changed the game! They paired with my phone and the Samsung Wear app with no issues. The sound is crisp and clear and with super high ambient mode you can enjoy your music and still be aware of your surroundings. The touchpads are customizable and yes you can pair with 2 different devices...simply open the Samsung Wear app on the device you want to pair with and just like that they are in sync with it. The battery life is second to none. I listened to music for 6 to 7 hours and they still had 20% left. I really can't picture paying $100 more for Airpods and them being worth doing so. Call quality is great and they don't hurt your ears with extended wear. If you're in the market, these are it!
Waste of money. Don't buy.$50 or less ear buds are much more better audio than these. I recommend go for Tozo T12.

Sound and voice quality leaves alot to be desired for the money.  Ambient sound is poor and noise canceling is practically non=existent.  When using withmy Galaxy S10+ the person I am speaking to keeps telling me that the wind noise is terrible when there is adead calm..

These are great, sound quality, fit and battery life all great. However I just want 3 things to do better, the magnets that keep the earbuds in the case, x2 rating and these weird air bubbles I just found. I dropped the case once and the earbuds just flew out, luckily I got the red ones so they weren't hard to find, but I just wish they were stronger. With the x2 rating I would just like it to be x4 so that I'll have more confidence about getting them wet. Just a few hours ago I saw that there were some sort of air bubbles on both buds, turns out there like a "wear and tear" thing, but I've only had these for a week! But that's it everything else is great. Also I had this battery issue that the right drained faster but I just did a simple rest in the app and everything was fine. But overall these buds are great and would totally recommend.

I was on the fence for a long time on buying wireless earbuds. Recently I got a job in which I can wear buds so I figured now I have a actual reason to buy some. After doing some research I decided on these to go with my galaxy. After receiving them and using them for a full work day I have to say I wish I bought them earlier. I like everything about them the fit, the color, the case, and there ability to make 8-10 hour workdays go fast. If I had to say anything negative would be that the sound quality for music isn't you know mind-blowing but for wireless tech that's to be expected.  It's in no way bad but for people who really can pick up on that stuff you may be disappointed. All in all great product.

They worked great with my iPhone for 3 months. There‚Äôs a really loud beeping when it disconnects from whatever you are listing to, which drove me crazy, so I almost returned it. I decided to try to ignore it. Then, 3 months of use hit (and I cant return them) and now, they don‚Äôt connect to my iPhone together for very long. One or both will just disconnect, either to the phone or from each other. I can‚Äôt listen to anything. Don‚Äôt waste your money. Just get the AirPods.

I had the original galaxy buds and loved them so much. However, sometimes the audio would blip and it annoyed me since they were expensive, so I returned them. I had to try these out and they are perfect. They're a little big but still look sleek. I love the blue color. The number of available controls are great. Tip: turn on the beta control "double tap edge to change volume" and then you have everything: open spotify, next song, previous song, pause/play, ambient sound (or voice assistant), and volume control - all from just touch. Battery life has lived up to its claims so far.

The battery life has been great with these. 11 hours per charge, with the case allegedly holding one additional charge for a total of 22 hours of battery. For the price these are amazing, with good sound and good noise isolation. These do NOT have active noise cancellation. That's not a big deal for me personally, but if that's important to you these are not going to work out.They fit securely, and the microphone sounds great as well.

I bought these on February 24th. Within a couple of weeks, the left earbud had dropped to about 10% volume. I contacted Samsung, and was told to file a claim and send them into the factory for 6-8 weeks. I searched online and found that the results for sending into the factory were overall negative, so I decided against that for my brand new earbuds.I opted to push the audio balance from my phone to push 90% of the left ear and %10 to the right. The max volume was very low, but at least it was even.

I finally decided to get some good earbuds and these are impressive! Sound quality is top notch. Battery life is ridiculously long. I could have them on all day (I use one at a time). I have a Samsung phone so there's an app that I can use with the earbuds that let me change the sound with an EQ, it tells me how much battery life I have for each earbud and the charging case. I would definitely recommend these. Better than the $40 earbuds I bought in the past, way better.

First off, I'm returning these because there's some sort of incompatibility between the buds' touch controls and the latest Spotify on Android 11.  I like these buds a lot, but I'm not migrating my entire Spotify library to another service to use them.With the right insert the buds block out noise really well, and the Ambient sound mode lets you let noise in if you want to.  Gestures are responsive and intuitive.  Pairing between different devices was pretty seamless.  Sound quality, provided you use the companion app to use the Dynamic equalizer setting, is also really good.  The buds stay pretty secure in the ears and are relatively comfortable for buds that go in the ear canal (I usually prefer around-ear headphones).

These Bluetooth earbuds are super exceptional. They are great if you want to set your phone down and walk around and talk while hands free.  However if I'm planning on sitting still for a while and watching my tablet on being on my phone for a while I find I tend to grab my corded earbuds first because all I have to do is plug the cord in my device and listen ( no checking the Bluetooth connection). But that's probably just me because I'm an elderly person who is not used to all this new technology. These earbuds have an amazing battery life and the app that installs on your phone tells you the battery life of both ear buds and the case they are stored in.

I really like my Samsung buds + , they are pretty amazing. The sound quality is pretty awesome and I also have Sony wh-1000xm3's. The buds are loud enough. My favorite thing about the buds is probably the ergonomics. It fits in my ear perfectly and It feels like nothing is there. Also I doesn't really protrude out of the ear too much so you can take your shirt off or take off your sweater without worrying that your buds will get nagged on soemthing and fall out. Well done samsung.Samsung Buds+ > Airpods Pro

These earbuds allow you to use one bud independently of the other. Other products don't allow the left bud to be used without the right being activated.There is an interface for settings you can access via phone. As well as a feature that allows for outside noise to be heard. The earbuds almost act as a hearing aid when this feature is activated and no media is being played.

product has a good sound stage and clarity and comfortable to wear for hours on end not a lot of bass only some I love the touch controls and ease of use and they get pretty loud There are occasions where I have had signal drop out when I'm not too far from phone and the battery life isn't 11 hrs on earbuds more like 7 however the case does recharge the buds up fast and wireless charging works at a slower rate than wired charging

Based on all the great reviews, I thought these would be a great value.  Unfortunately, the multiple microphones seemed to do the opposite of what what intended--instead of reducing the background noise transmitted during a phone call, they amplified everything.  The party I was calling said it was easier/clearer to hear what was happening in the background than my own voice.  This seems to be a recurring complaint on various forums--I tried the normal fixes (reset the earbuds, download the newest update, etc).  Nothing worked, and these were returned to Amazon the very next day.

I've been using the Buds + for almost a week and at least 6 hours each day. They are light and fit snugly and comfortably in my ears and will not fall out. The sound is great and so is the feature set. Haven't completely drained the battery yet so can't speak to the 11 hour claim but they still have at least 40% charge when I put them back in the case. I'm very impressed with them. In the "Labs" folder of the wearable app, try the "Double tap earbud edge" for volumn control, but don't tap the Buds, instead just double tap the back of the left ear to lower the volumn and the right ear to raise the volumn. The ambient feature works great. I just pause the music when I'm talking with someone and the outside mic let's me clearly hear the conversation. I also use a wireless charger and just set the case on it for charging. Overall a great experience with these new Buds.

These are awesome true wireless buds.. Connect auto with Samsung wear app.. Light and feel great but they feel even better with these foam tips Check this out at Amazon.comComply 35-42032-11 TrueGrip Pro Memory Foam Tips for Samsung Galaxy Buds True Wireless Earbuds - Made from Comfortable Memory Foam for a Secure Fit (Medium, 3 Pairs), Black https://www.amazon.com/dp/B081QTH9W9/ref=cm_sw_r_other_apa_i_hxRIEb7F2ME4G

I ordered this for my new samsung buds plus. It does not fit. It fits the original buds perfect. But the new buds plus is slightly smaller. The lid doesnt close all the way on the plus version. But they are great for the original. And I also wished the hole for the carabiner was bigger. Check the pics of both buds with the case on

For a person like me that wears them all day the battery life is great.  Checked them after about 3 hours today and still had 70% battery life left.  Really comfortable.  Very pleased with them so far.  I did return the first set because it seemed to have a bluetooth connection issue and the replacement set is working great.

This new version of Galaxy Buds are so much better than the last ones. The wings help them fit better this time and really help with noise cancellation. When talking on the phone my voice is all people can here now (the last version made people hear EVERYTHING around me) and I can barely here what's going on around me. The ambient sound feature (to let in the noise around me) is a lot better too. The battery life is almost double of the last version and they seem to also charge faster as well. Definitely worth spending the money for the upgraded product.

I did a lot of research beforehand and including the price tag, these beat out even the air pods pro. All reviews said that these were great wireless earbuds but for me they were extremely quite. I have very sensitive ears and even I had to put these up at full volume to sound less than average at the gym. They sounded okay like two clicks away from full volume if you're in a quiet room. I got some friends to test it out as well and they felt the same as me. I think I just got a defective pair and I have returned them and will be ordering new ones soon and hopefully they work properly this time.

Only reason I bought these was because of the battery life. I am used to having the Skullcandy brand and was tempted to get those because they are cheaper, but they also have alot of mixed views. I had seen some mixed views on these as well but more positive. So far I think they are "ok". Decent bass, pretty good tremble. I haven't used them long enough to see how long the battery life last, I usually work 10 hour shifts, once I get back to work, I shall see. Time will tell for sure.
While the product looks well designed on the outside, I tried multiple times and ways to pair it with both my watch and phone, and couldn't get it to work, so I had to return it.
after using twice, the right one barely works now...

I bought these ear buds because I needed buds that would reliably connect to my phone during long runs and stay connected. I had been previously using Bose Soundsport True Wireless Buds, but while they sounded great, they would stutter and disconnect randomly while I ran. It was incredibly frustrating.  I ordered the Samsung buds because I figured they'd have a better connection with my Samsung phone. I have not been disappointed.  They sound great, there is no stuttering or cutting in and out, and they remain connected the whole time I use them. I like the charging case. The battery life on these buds is completely adequate.  I barely put a dent in the battery life even with my longest runs. These buds are comfortable in my ears and I have no fear of jostling them or of them falling out. I would absolutely recommend these ear buds.

Severely disappointed in this earbuds, I have no idea why people are rating it so high. The sound quality is not good at all, absolutely no bass, extremely neutral sound. The app doesn‚Äôt really change much, the preset EQs aren‚Äôt that good and you can‚Äôt make your own personal EQ. The only thing good I found about these was the Hear through mode which works pretty good, calls are good, and battery life is really good for earbuds.

It was an ok product for the price, but after a week of having it one side started sounding louder than the other. I tried connecting with various different devices, settings, etc. Still same issue. Also , was too big even when I changed the rubber piece.When it was working, it was ok. Was very easy for folks to hear noise in the background. Team members complained about the noise and actually said just using my laptop's mic was better.

When these are working, they‚Äôre great. Sound is good, they‚Äôre comfortable and stay in your ear, battery lasts a decent amount of time, and they look nice. However, I ordered these in May and they‚Äôve stopped working now. The left bud seems completely dead (won‚Äôt charge, connect, or turn on) and the right one isn‚Äôt charging properly. After 24 hours in the charging case, I‚Äôm at ~50%. One of the troubleshooting options is to update the app, but you can‚Äôt do that if both buds aren‚Äôt connected and working. Now I‚Äôll probably have to jump through hoops with Samsung.

Not very noise cancelling - instead the ambient noise pass through is an amazing. Two updates ago Samsung beta‚Äôd a super ambient pass through and it‚Äôs like having spy ears. I bought these because of the call quality reviews and all my callers say it‚Äôs crystal clear without crazy background noise. I‚Äôm not a fan of the sticks coming out of my ears. Also, I paired this with an iPhone - the app is really good; you can‚Äôt manually adjust the equalizer but the preset options are still awesome.

I want to start by saying these buds sound and feel great. Super light so I can wear them all day long. And the sound!? It‚Äôs solid compared to other buds or even over ear headphones I have. There are a few flaws that I wish were better though.1) Shut off in longer calls in various app or computer calls! I‚Äôve found that on longer Zoom or Hangout calls the earbuds just stop working. No sound, no mic. Nothing. I‚Äôm sure this is something they can fix with software since I can listen to Spotify all day long.
The picture of the product shown that I order was not the same arrived in the package.

Had previous version, this one is better.  Previous version had problem gearing earbuds on pogo pins to charge properly and would drop connecetion when walking with phone in pocket.  These issues have been resolved and the phone quality on these are great.  The connectivity to Apple devices has been resolved also. The case (charging unit) is smaller now too and fits nicely in a pocket while giving you longer usage per charge -nice redesign (software and hardware) and repackaging!

I like these buds but they are a little pricy. The sound is good but not great. Battery life is awesome with 8 to 11 hours of usage. Fit is great, so far they haven't fell out except once when I was eating and forgot they were in my ears, yeah they are that comfortable. I have another set that I paid $25 for and they are actually louder than these. I would buy them again just for the comfort and battery life but if I wanted better sound I'd shop around a little more.

Bought the Samsung Galaxy Buds+ for my wife for her birthday! She says that the earbuds are excellent sounding, and she has been using them NON-STOP!!! She hasn't even charged the battery yet! I means she hasn't taken them out and put them back in the case to charge, not having to charge the case! I have the OG Galaxy buds, and love them, but after hearing those, I have to say, they probably worth the little extra!

I went through a few different wireless headsets similar to this before settling on this pair. They are incredibly comfortable, and with the battery life and optional noise passthrough I can wear them for an entire work day. 9 hours battery plus another 99 in the case is just amazing. Never had any issues with connectivity, even when switching from my phone to my work laptop or personal computer etc.These are also great for exercising and don't move or jostle loose. I've been using them running and they stay perfectly in place without some huge rubber wedge halfway up your ear like some others I've tried. Ambient sound is incredibly useful when running in a neighborhood with potential car traffic. Would highly recommend all around

Battery life is real good.  However I have had nothing but problems with the sound quality.  The left ear fades in/out and sounds like it is echoing.  Very poor quality so far.  I am hoping to reach a resolution that can be fixed.  right now I have went back to the wired.  I bought these to use when riding my motorcycle but even mowing the lawn with my galaxy phone in my pocket produces very poor sound.

Bought this for my husband for running and he loves all the features. He was not happy about having to use the app to be able to make the volume higher. He was also not happy about having to allow contact sharing to use the app. After he ‚Äúsold his soul‚Äù as he says, he was much happier with the options on the app to increase his volume.He also loves the call quality, and the person he is on the phone with can hear clearly as well!

Bought these used off of Amazon & I'm very pleased with the price & quality of my purchase. Beautiful color & sound quality is amazing. Definitely see why they are such a great buy. I haven't had them long so I can't say much about the noise cancellation but everything else works great!

I do plan on editing this review once I get my replacement buds. The pair I got was (I'm hoping) defective where if I left the buds out of the case for more than 2-3 minutes they would unsynchronize from each other and the only sound I'd hear are high pitched glitches. The only options to fix that would be to reset the buds through the Galaxy Wearable app or put them back in the case for a couple of minutes. I highly doubt the developers would force the users to constantly be wary of whether their buds are either charging or in use at all times.EDIT: the new pair had similar issues, Soni was hoping it was just some specific software glitch. After a couple of updates, it seems to be working a lot better. The ambience mode tends to force the buds to de-sync once in a while, so I just have it off at all times. Other than that, pretty decent earbuds with poor bass but decent noise cancellation.

Amazing headphones! They sound great and are super comfortable. The bass is amazing and the battery live is better than any other earbuds. The mic pass through is not the best compared to my airpods pro but for $100 less it's definitely worth the price. My only real complaint is that one of the buds stopped working after 5 months. However, samsung just had me send in my pair of earphones and they sent me a brand new pair! I would give five stars if it wasn't for the earbud stopped working in the first place and it took almost 2 weeks to get it back but other then that they're great!

The battery life for the case doesn't hold. Going to contact seller to see if I could exchange. Had the case fully charged and the earbuds fully charged but after sitting in my pocket for about an hour the case shows yellow for the light now instead of green. Don't know why it's losing its charge. Other than that, sound is great!

I use these for a variety of things from YouTube videos tow music to watching Netflix and the sound quality is always great. Not sure that I would consider them noise cancelling as they don't seem to actively cancel noise other than being a form of earplugs. The enhanced listening is nice which amplifies sounds so that you can still hear someone talking along with your music and can be turned off if you don't wish to use this feature. I have worn them while working on my car, mowing, and even on a few runs and have never had any fitment issues.

Had them for 4 months they been decent nothing impressive over any other brand but now they over heat and there's a constant beeping in the left earphone I got these because I thought quality was assured but Samsung let's me down again. $160 for just 4 months. Literally broke faster than the ones I bought for $40 last year and they're basically the same in fact the off brand ones I got had deeper bass and longer battery life.

The right ear bud starts to muffle and starts to lower in sound over time. And the only way to fix the issue is to put the left ear bud inside the charger, but you need to leave it in there for a couple of minutes because if you take the left one out right away the right bud will get muffled again. Bought two new ones and they both had the same issue. Would recommend if this issue is fixed but for now its just infuriating

Received them then returned them within an hour. I waited 2 weeks for these to get shipped and I was excited since I rarely if ever spend more than 10 dollars on earbuds only to be disappointed with a defective unit. Left earbud didnt work in the slightest. Even the case didnt pick up that it was there. I tried every possible trouble shooting method there is and none made it work so off it goes back to amazon for another 2-3 weeks.

These are amazing headphones! I've been sceptical of wireless earbuds, and tried a few that did NOT do what they'd promised as far as quality of the call for people on the other line. I'm a soft spoken guy, and sounding like I was in the other room was unhelpful. Especially with hard of hearing folks in my family.After my second refund, Amazon gave me a deal on these, and I decided to give wireless earbuds one last try. I'm glad I did. Not only is the call quality better than my phone's microphone, but the audio quality on my end is spectacular. I love the ambient sundfeature that allows you to listen to music, and hear yourself (or others) voice come through the buds. The galaxy wear app really makes these worth the price.
