The ONLY issue I've had so far is how small the tether length is, but I'll rarely be away from my phone when using them, anyway.

Hasta ahora estoy muy contenta me gusta mucho como se escucha la verdad no me molestan y la bater√≠a dura much√≠simo.  Solo hay algo que no me gusta cuando trato de ajustar el sonido para escuchar bien afuera o sea que no me bloquee completamente el sonido de afuera pues se escucha mal hace un ruido extra√±o.  Pero bueno nada es perfecto. La distancia es bastante buena yi he estado afuera en el patio y el tel√©fono dentro de la casa y no me afecta el sonido puesto estar escuchando m√∫sica y puedo responder las llamadas sin mucho problema.

My little brother wanted earbuds for his birthday, and because I had the original Galaxy Buds, I decided to buy him the Galaxy Buds+. Honestly, BEST choice ever, he loves it so much, and I'm jealous because I didn't buy one for myself. The original one lasted 6 hrs, which is already long, but now it lasts for 11 hrs....That's INSANE, for anyone that is looking for earbuds, this will give you the bang for your buck!

Just like other customer, bought these 3 months ago, 2.5 months in the left bud stopped working. Apparently its an issue across the board with a ton of these devices from the thousands of people with the same issue on a ton of different forums online. I also called Samsung, they verified they've seen the issue a lot recently but assured me NOT TO WORRY because im still well within my warranty. I sent in the buds next day to get fixed, 2 weeks later was also told that I bought internationally and that they can't honor the warranty and ill have to take it up with Amazon. It clearly states that this purchase was made from Samsung official on Amazon and it clearly states in the description that it is the US VERSION. Complete bs, total runaround and after numerous back and forth with Amazon not taking any responsibility, a supervisor that finally heard me gave me refund. My time and frustration not worth it. Will probably not be buying electronics anymore.

I would give it 4 or 5 stars if the software side of it wasn't so bad. Occasionally they'll just randomly pause the song, one bud will get stuck being substantially louder than the other. On the highest volume one will be sceaming in your ear and you can't even hear if the other is working. The only way to fix it is to reset them which they have to be at 30% for. Noise canceling is far from great but the ambient sound works well. If I could go back I would have bought a 50 dollar off brand pair rather than a 200 dollar pair that works well sometimesEdit: took it from 3 stars to 1 because it keeps happening. Now the right one is nearly inaudible and the left is normal. Restoring them to factory doesn't work. Turning ambient off doesn't work. Support is no help. Trying to get ahold of Samsung to return or replace is a nightmare. 0/10 would recommend. Save your money and buy 5 pairs of off brand ones, at least then you expect them to break within 90 days and you have 4 back ups!

Some reason getting extra noise like cracking noise when listening to music or on phone. When on phone have tons of static on them would need to switch to phone becuase of static. Battery last good but case does died within 4 to 5 hours. Contact company and was no help person was rude.

Absolutely beautiful with amazing sound! Ambient sound and noise cancellation works very well! Bravo to Samsung for that. The only downside for me is that the Battery Life has not lived up to its promise of 11 hrs. Seems like approximately 6-8 hrs with light use and standby. Having the case with charge storage does re-charge very quickly within 15 minutes to make it through my day. Overall giving them 4 Stars.

The "touch screen " component is both cool and horrible at the same time as I find myself accidentally pressing it when adjusting the bud. I've hung up quite a few times on accident, almost everytime actually lol. The call quality is excellent both on my side and being able to be heard, seems like the buds pick up quite a lot of surrounding noises too, for example my husband can always hear the kids talk even from across the room. It can go a reasonable distance away from the phone. Charging is easy if you already own Samsung products, can be charged wirelessly too! Set up was a breeze because I already own galaxy products. If you wear these too much you will probably get an ear infection as of course it traps the... ahem "ear mist". BUT that's just what happens with buds in general.I think I'll be keeping these as I am only going to be wearing these for certain activities and for not for long hours at a time.

Do not trust that this seller is offering a "US" version.  I purchased this as a present, so it did not get used for a couple of months.  Then, upon the third use, one of the buds failed.  As these were still under warranty, I sent to Samsung. Samsung denied my warranty because it turns out these are the international version, and thus receive no warranty.  I rarely, if, ever comment on a product, but I was completely lied to by this company.  DO NOT PURCHASE.  Spend the extra $10 to get an official version from Samsung. It's well worth the cost to get a warranted item.

In love with these! So easy to use, so easy to connect with, so easy to charge, so easy to share listening with my husband on car rides/runs/bike rides (I wear one and he wears the other)! The galaxy wear app helps you control their noise level. You can choose through different settings depending on your preferences - for example you can have the ambient noise on/off :) these were 100% worth the money.

Charging port on box went bad in less than 2 months I can't charge the box to keep ear buds charged anymore, the touch pad on buds are terrible I have to tap repeatedly to get them to answer or hang up... too much hassle

Buying these headphones was not a decision that I took lightly.  after reviewing the pros and cons and watching several review videos on YouTube I decided to purchase these instead of buying the original Samsung Galaxy buds based on the improved call quality with extra microphones, better sound quality because of two different drivers in each earbud to handle dynamic and balanced sounds, and  better battery life.  Only had them for a week but great so far

On two occasions in four weeks of use, the left earbud put out a constant, high pitched sound during bluetooth pairing.  The sound persisted until I shut them down.  The first time, for a few uses afterward, the buds included a lot of fuzzy noise over the music.  I returned the Samsung buds because I didn't want an intermittent problem to happen again or get worse.  Other than that, I really liked them; great sound and fit, although controlling them with taps while in the ears is tricky, you have to get the location and angle of tap just right.

An unbelievable generational jump that isn't getting enough credit for how spectacular it is. The Buds+ are the purchase I've been waiting near a decade to make. Flawless connection, amazing sound quality, and all day battery. As a factory worker, these were a revolutionary jump in quality of life at work. Can not recommend highly enough!

Love these buds.  I'm not an audiophile.  I listen mostly to podcasts and audio books so the sound quality is great for me.  Music sounds crisp too.  They don't have active noise cancelling but they do seal out the outside world pretty well. Especially when the music is turned up.  The range is great.  I've never had a cut out.  I love that I can use either bud one at a time.  I switch back and forth and that gets me an almost unlimited play time.  After getting the right set up and about 30 minutes of getting used to the feel they are so comfortable I forget they are in.I've worn them hiking, jumping rope and all day and never had them come loose or fall out. Love them

Great product, but mine DID NOT arrive with rubber buds. I'm not sure if this was part of the deal? And the new ends I put on don't fit in the case, so I have to remove them every time so the connectors can reach. This is a huge disappointment, but the sound quality is excellent.

I was excited to get these earbuds in the mail, when they came they're so beautiful, i switch the ear thingie to a smaller size. I appreciate them but they still don't fit in my ear right, I'm afraid they'll pop out of my ear even when i press them in the canal. They're so sensitive to touch. They sound quality is low. I have the volume up in every device its linked to seems like i can hear a bit louder through my laptop than my cell phone. All in all I'm super disappointed in this product. I really wish the sound quailty was better and you can hear the music clearly instead of it sounding like you have a pillow between your ear and the ear bud. I truly bought this to listen to my music and i regret that i purcahsed them i should have got some nice bulky headphones instead. :(

These are good for work, have all the features, the app is great but it lacks good sound quality. I think most of the reviews in sound blogs and tech blogs are influenced and not genuine. Every review says it has great sound quality and great bass but that is just not true. I would recommend them for work but not for listening to music.Disappointed and returned. AKG needs to do a better job

The sound is amazing, it has deep bass and sharp treble for a great sound The equalizer built into Samsung wearables is really nice, the mic is very clear sounding. The battery is really nice too, after listening to music for an afternoon, the battery hardly budge. I most enjoy they are concealed in the ear and doesn't have the weird phantom look the airpods have. I highly recommend these.

Absolutely love these.  I'm amazed by the battery life, the ambient sound feature, and the sound quality.  I recommend getting these to anyone. They fit perfectly in my ears but come with 3 different size buds and ear pieces for all different sizes. I even tried to make them fall out but couldn't.  And with the ambient sound feature you can just go outside and listen to nature and all the sounds around you crystal clear like having sharing aids.

I love everything about these buds. They have excellent battery length, button programming, and sound quality. My only issue is sometimes it acts weird when I put my phone in my back pocket or put something between the phone and headset. Like connection is interrupted. This is extremely weird as bluetooth speakers or other bluetooth items never has this issue but these headphones do.

I really enjoy this product. I've used it both on my Galaxy s20 ultra and my iPhone 6. I wouldn't recommend this product to iPhone users as the experience on iPhone isn't as good with these. However if you have a Samsung phone these are a great option! The battery life is amazing. I also find the ambient sound mode very useful.  If I could make changes I would add ANC and a higher water resistance. If you're looking to save a little money and sacrifice a longer battery i would recommend the regular Galaxy Buds as they are not super different. Also do keep in mind these dont connect to anything else really besides phones and tablets! So if you're looking for headphones to use for computer these are not going to work! But they are perfect for my purposes and the isolating sound design is good enough to block out a lot of sounds.

I got these for my boyfriend as he is a galaxy user and I got myself AirPods because I love my apple products! I will be returning my AirPods in exchange for these as the music quality is better and the ear phones are more comfortable in your ear! In fact mine get here today and I am stoked!

I had the original buds, they were great. But they started to develop connectivity issues over time. Upgraded to buds+, very happy. The sound quality is amazing, battery life is outstanding, and no more connection problems!  Love the blue color. The software updates are great too. You can name the device now, and have more control with sound quality and ambient noise. Love 'em.

These earbuds work great with my Galaxy s10. The sound quality is great and music/videos come through very clearly. With the Galaxy Wearables app you can adjust the equalizer to choose many different sound enhancing options and you can choose if you'd like ambient sound (also what level of sound you'd like to hear)! The ambient sound really helps on phone calls and to hear what is going on around you if you wear your earbuds in public. The noise cancelling is really great, as well. They are super easy to keep track of despite being small and are very durable. Over all, they are great buy especially if you are a Samsung fan.

I had the original Buds before this, and these are a noticeable improvement. With the originals, I had to always turn on the Ambient Noise setting each time I put them on or removed the ear buds, but not with these. These also begin pairing by the time I open the case, so the buds are being placed in my ears they're already paired, and the Ambient Noise is already turned ON.Sound quality is awesome. The clarity is amazing, and the bass is amazing. I currently have them in Dynamic on the equalizer and it seems to be a great overall setting so as to not be overpowered in one aspect over another.

Good sound. I only took off stars because they sound about the same as my 20 dollar sound peats. I prefer to use these at work because of the sound passthrough. I can listen to music and not tune out the world.

Sound is louder from one side than the other and app/resets/research/fixes/rebootsdont work to balance it.  I am sick of working on these things!  The other set we bought has a different set of challenges.  I have gone back to using wired buds.

Really disappointed in these buds, especially considering the price.  They were great for the first 90-120 days, then started dropping the BT connection sporadically.  For the last 30 days they've basically been unusable.  Connection never stays for more than a few seconds after pairing with my iPhone or Peloton.  I've made sure all software updates on all devices are installed.  I've tried resetting the Samsung app an re-pairing to the phone several times.  Nothing works.  The buds are two worthless bricks at this point.  It's not an issue with the iPhone, as that pairs seamlessly with all of my other BT devices.Sound:  It was really good when it works.  I liked the setting that the app allowed and the ambient noise option.

Bought these and have tried using them off and on for a few months now.  Love the convenience, sound is good, took a bit to get used to having them in for a duration (I live on the phone) but found that as I talk they will loosen to the point of falling out and I would have readjust them and in doing so it would disconnect the call.  Finally had to resort to turning off my Bluetooth on the phone during the call, switching to the phone, adjusting the Bud and then turning Bluetooth back on after the readjustment to not lose calls.  Unacceptable and have to go another route. Disappointed and $150 down the drain.

The battery life is excellent, but the noise quality can sometimes be lacking...it sounds as though the sound is breaking up at times if you too far walk away from your phone or are listening in another room despite being only a few meters away.  The earbuds fit really nicely in my ears, though-ive had issues with other buds falling out and these stay in snugly and are very comfortable to wear. If Samsung just cleared up some of the feedback sounds when you walk away from your phone a bit, I would definitely give these 5 stars down the line!

Sound quality is not that good. I own the Sony WH-1000XM3 so I am spoiled. With this buds you can hear your surroundings even at max volume. I am getting the Sony Wf-1000XM3 instead. Don't get me wrong they are not bad, they just didn't meet my expectations. They are built well and they are comfy.

I was a little skeptical to but these due to some so so ratings. I can only say that I am glad I did. I bought some cheap knock offs prior to this. The sound quality was tinny and the bluetooth connectivity was bad.Not these. The sound is rich and powerful and the connectivity is great.

I was hesitant to buy these, but other reviews and my tax return got the best of me... Long story short, I love them! I have a Samsung Galaxy A70 for a phone, and a windows 10 laptop, and these headphones work amazing with both. For everyday listening, they're great. I love the sound quality (bass is great, and there is a high dynamic range), and they are a joy to take phone calls with. I can hear the calls perfect, and those on the other end said my voice was very clear.I also work on a dusty, loud jobsite, and these are perfect. I run loud equipment, and these block the sound out amazingly, and if I ever have to talk to someone, I can just turn on the ambient sound feature and talk to those around me perfectly. Even using these all day (roughly 6 hours per day), I only have to charge these 2-3 times per week.

These are easily the best wireless buds I've ever owned. The sound quality is really quite good. There is no active noise cancellation, but the buds make a great deal for me that is nearly just as good in my opinion. The tarbsoarency mode is good but not great, certainly functional but everything sounds a bit tinny.The real show stopper here though is the battery life. Yesterday, I wore both buds for over 8 hours and still had about a 20% charge left. Even if I ran that out though I have another 11 hour charge in the case! These buds are worth every penny of the price.

I'm not a fan of bass heavy music , so these are perfect for me , I can hear all instruments .. As for noise cancelation, don't buy them for that as it's not the best. It's not in Bose territory , you can still hear things like the AC in your home (not loud though)., but that's OK with me. So far , this the only bluetooth item that doesn't break up with my Galaxy S8. Perfect for phone calls .

There are little annoyances but overall they're very good. The ear tips are never the right size which leaves it either falling out or ear fatigue. The updates are a little iffy sometimes which can mean either amazing ambient sound or none depending on the update. However I love the crystal clear call quality. Flawlessly switches between devices and as soon as you pop them in, they're ready to go. Amazing battery life. Just pop em in the case for a few and they're good to go for another hour. Pocket sized case which makes it easy to travel with.

This is the first review I've ever written on Amazon. These earbuds are that good! The sound quality is phenomenal, and the CALL QUALITY is fantastic! Huge improvement over the previous echo buds. I bought these primarily to use for conference calls, and they do not disappoint. No one could even tell that I was using earbuds.The pass-through feature is great as well, and I love being able to adjust the amount of ambient noise coming in. Turning the feature up to high effectively gives you superhuman hearing which is pretty neat, but I generally keep that setting a bit lower.

The regular Galaxy Buds have a very bad call quality. I bought these from Amazon. They sent me regular Buds in a Buds Plus box. The only visible difference between the two is that the Buds Plus have two mics on each earpiece, and the case has buttons instead of an LED.  I might not have noticed it, but for the super bad call quality, which made me start hunting for a fix. So if you buy these, beware. Make sure the Buds in the box actually are the Plus Buds, and not the regular Buds in a Buds Plus box. I sent them back and just ordered them from Samsung's site.  I figured my odds of getting the real Buds Plus would be greater.

Don't buy these just get the cheap pair at least that way your not wasting a bunch of money on junk. I have only used these once they worked great sounded great the next time I went to use them the right side didn't work. The app looked like it was saying the right side didn't charge. Don't waste your money on these don't say you were not warned.

I enjoyed these headphones for 4 months. One day the left bud wouldn't work. I tried everything the internet had to offer to fix it and it still wouldn't work. I spoke with samsungs help line and they said it would be covered by their 1 year warranty because these are the international version. They will fix it for $100 which is the price you can buy these new. I understand that I should've read the fine print and saw that the international buds weren't covered by warranty. Regardless, it's embarrassing that Samsung builds products that only last 4 months with regular use then won't back them up. I'm not an apple fan but I will be buying airpods and maybe even an iPhone going forward.

These are fantastic. I use them for everything, they connect to my TV via firestick, they connect to my echo show, and they of course connect to my phone. These are easily the best wireless headphones I've ever had. The battery life is great and I often forget to charge my case. Another great feature of these is the fact if your case is running low on charge and you have a Samsung note 10, you can charge the case via your phone.All in all I'm in love with these headphones.

My 1st pair of any kind of BT earbuds.  They are exactly as described by several YouT reviews.  The better you fit these into your ears, the better is the sound--which is amazing. They work exceptionally well on the phone. The only limitation at the moment, is inability to pair w/Win 10 Pro for PCs.  Hopefully MSFT and Samsung will iron this out, as the regular Buds have capability.
- At first, they were okay, the sound is mediocre at best. Not good at all, very flat- They don't stay in your ear no matter how hard you try

I received my buds over a month ago with a protection program. The product came with a defect, there were electronic components rattling inside my buds+ case so I tried to contact the seller about receiving a new product without having to use up my protection plan since this was not my fault. I emailed the seller three different times over the span of a month with each reply directing my message to the manager, whom I never heard back from. I would rather not spend the $20 of my protection plan to receive a new product that came defective.
Stopped working after 17 days. Not used for workout or in rain. Used for call purpose only.Going to return them.

These are amazing for so many reasons. The sound quality is great, the battery life is outstanding, and are a really good deal at this price. I work in a mostly noisy environment where I am required to communicate via a company radio, so being able to listen to music and still hear what I need to hear thanks to the ambient sound mics is perfect. It takes some getting used to ( sounds like you're talking into a microphone, but sounds are amplified if nothing is playing so thats nice).  With the latest update, you can boost the ambient sound even further, which is how I leave them set now. I was concerned at first about loud sounds being amplified as well, but it quietens as soon as something loud happens (alot like amplified shooting earmuffs). Another great Samsung product!

I was head banging to some music like a violent crackhead, and these little black beauties didn't budge an inch. Not only that, but they have some crazy black magic that lets me hear my surroundings even if I'm rocking out to some loud tunes.The sound is so good, it's like I Rick Moranis'd Blink 182 and put them directly into my ear canal.

Not made for music. If you enjoy listening to music in your ears, you are better off not goetting these. There is barely any mid, no base and 70 to 80% treble. There are setting in the app that allows you to control presets that work but sound like trash with music. Im sorry but it sucks lol. My $20 wired pair sounds better.On a good note, the connection quality to ohone is awesome. Great for talking and listening to audiobooks. Try them out. Return them for free. Maybe samsung will get the point.

I had a pair of Jabra elites that IMO sounded a little nicer, but I had constant issues with them disconnecting randomly when I would walk a little bit away from my phone or get a call.These earbuds are solid. No disconnection issues ever, even in pouring rain. I don't think the battery can die in a single day. I wore them from when I woke up until I went to sleep and they're still going strong on day 2.

These earbuds are purposefully made for Samsung products. It so happens they worked well with my Google Pixel Phone. The sound is very crisp, on point. I like a lot of bass. For my liking, these earbuds don't make the cut, but the sound is so clear, I would have kept them. Call quality might just be the best in the business. The case feels flimsy. Most disappointing is, a Samsung Galaxy Support agent told me clearly they are not compatible with PCs. There is a clear lag between sound/image and sound in the earbuds. Very disappointed. I can't believe someone would pay so much to have earbuds work only (exclusively!) with one device.

I had the original Samsung wireless headphones and loved them minus battery life.  I have also tried the Jabra Elite 65T active, again was not disappointed.After purchasing these, I never realized how much I was missing out! Sound quality is absolutely amazing.  Clear, crisp,  with great bass.  Other online reviews felt battery life compared to competitors was not up to par. Who honestly needs 25 hrs of life on headphones?  Its easy to charge the case using wireless charging on my charging mat in room, my truck or even my phone

It is really awesome for us Samsung users! Everything connects easy.  The commands are easy to follow and the rubber booty on the buds are interchangeable and help them to not fall out. The fix comfortable and stay in place.  I really like the fact that you can turn on SUPER ambiance!  Man I can even hear my dog's nails on the hard wood floor! wow!

They were great, sounded great, call quality was awesome for 11 days and then yesterday the right bud just kept disconnecting out of nowhere. I tried resetting them to factory settings, forgetting the connection on the bluetooth menu, the connection could not be found most times and then when it could be found it would connect only for a moment and then be dropped again. I found fixes online and none of them worked for me. I'm hoping they were just defective. I have sadly and reluctantly returned them and gotten airpod pros.

I will start off by saying there are better wireless buds for the money. However I am very happy with these. They look very nice and don't protrude from your ears like some others. The battery life is pretty good and more than enough to last me a few days before having to charge again. The sound quality isn't gonna blow you away but comparatively its decent and the ambient noise feature is nice to have. Lastly the fit of these takes a little bit to figure out whats comfortable but once you find it they stay in pretty well and if they weren't blasting noise in my ears I'd forget they're there.

I love love love my galaxy earbuds!!!!!!!! The only thing I could say could be better is a bigger battery for the charging case. The sound is indeed rich and pure. I've never had sound like this! And they have features I didnt even know about. Granted I have read the manual much or researched them much either. So as I discover each feature I love them more and more. My favorite is when my notifications go off they announce what type of notification it is; email, text message, etc. I find that super helpful. As well as they fit wonderfully in my ears. No discomfort and very secure. I really like that the buds themselves sit just at the entrance of your ear canal, they dont go into the canal like most other earbuds. It feels better that way! I bought mine brand new and I say they are definitely worth the money. Thank you Samsung!!!

I have owned the Galaxy buds for about a year now and really liked them, except for the call quality (pretty much unusable). I didn't see anything out that had the smooth connectivity (Note 10) and features as the buds and call quality, so I decided to tough it out until something came along that I liked. The Buds+ definitely take it to the next level. The sound quality is great, battery life is significantly improved, ambient sound is effective (but tinny), more controls at the buds themselves, and of course, great call quality. They literally took all the things I liked and improved them and fixed all the things I didn't like. 3 very MINOR complaints. They don't fit quite as well as the original buds, but still great. I hit pause or play on accident when removing them from my ears. The ambient noise is tinny. HIGHLY RECCOMEND!

I was deciding between these, the hd599 and the wh1000xm3. I might still get one or both of those later, but I decided to start with these. These not only have the best audio quality I have ever tried, but they also have many usability features that make them an incredible value. You can use 1 headphone while the other is charging and they have about 10hrs of battery. They also pair and unpair very quickly and of course have no wire. For audio quality they are almost perfectly flat in amplifier transfer function frequency response it is actually like a flat line, I suggest you look at the rtings review. This is perfect for classical music with a lot of mids and highs that is often done misjustice by bass heavy headphones

The galaxy buds plus are great and everything as Samsung Promised. They charge fast, they sound amazing, they look beautiful, and have all these amazing features like ambient mode, tracking, great battery life, etc. Only thing I'm upset with is Amazon. They were estimated 2 week delivery on Prime but they didn't even show up. They came 5 days late. That's nearly 3 weeks where as Samsung could've delivered them in 4 days. Im very upset and disappointed.  Great product but never buying anything important like electronics from Amazon ever again. Don't waste your time ordering from Amazon when it comes to Samsung products, just go directly to Samsung where you can get fast free shipping and even discounts. In short i shouldve never wasted my time ordering these from Amazon and you shouldn't either.

First thing that sucks:  it's been about 5 months, and the right earbud stopped working.Second thing that sucked about these:  These things constantly fall out of my ears. I have to be careful standing up to use the bathroom because at any second, the right bud will spontaneously pop out of my right ear and it could easily...splashhhh

The sound is very tinny, base is practically non existent. Also the sound is definitely weaker out of the left earbud even after trying all possible earpiece combinations which is very annoying and makes me wonder if they sell returned/faulty products as new hoping the buyer would rather just keep them than go through the warranty or return process.

The sound quality is not as good as the AirPods. The only thing good about these is they do secure better into your ears but they do work there selves loose after a little bit of time no matter the wing size or tip I use. The only way to get any sort of bass is to literally shove them deep into your ear canal. Which like I said, they end up working lose. They also do not get very loud. I was very disappointed. The case does feel very nice and they have great charge time.

One of the best android truly wireless headphones around. Noise cancellation is passive, but effective; the sound quality of music is excellent; I have not had any issues with people hearing me during a phone call while outside w/ ambient noise. Sometimes I will have interference in the signal from the buds to the phone; but I attribute that more to my 5yr old phone w/ old Bluetooth standard and not the current 5.0

These are absolutley amazing! The person on the other side of the phone can hear only your voice. It does not pick up any of your background noise.... expect if you are driving fast on the highway. Sounds quality is great. Thr 3 mic's were executed perfectly. Battery lasts forever. They fit comfortably in your ear even when working out and doing cardio... they don't fall out. Nice noise cancellation. I've gone through several different ear buds and these are thre best!

I hoped to love these but couldn‚Äôt. I got the blue one and think it‚Äôs really cute. However the sound quality was mediocre. Because I paired them with Apple devices I don‚Äôt think I got the most out of its utilities.When connected to my laptop the sound was breaking up really bad even though I only had Youtube open and was sitting right in front of the laptop. Had to return :/ I‚Äôm a girl and have the tendency to touch my hair quite often, so I kept accidentally touched the touchpad which play/pause and forward tracks. Touchpad is sensitive which can be good but in this case too good that it turns out to be an inconvenience. The fit was just okay, not solid. I also think it‚Äôs overpriced.

I passed on my original Buds to my son and he loved them. I got these and they sound better and battery life is good too. No complaints. I love them. I use them with my S10+. I got them in red and they look cool. Thanks Samsung & Amazon.

The quality is great on these buds but it needs more bass. That's it in a nutshell.Besides that I love the noise cancelation and the ability to find your buds in case you lose them. I admit it, I lost my last pair of razor gaming buds and wish they had the find your buds feature. Invaluable in my opinion.  Until more buds get this feature I'll stay with the Samsung + buds.

I use the original Galaxy buds. I'm glad to see Samsung the best of times and revamping their software adding a couple of features. Waterproof, and the ability to control ambient sound around you is nice (as is the software suite they updated on their handsets through the Wear app). The wireless charging is fast and convenient, and the fact they added an enormous amount of battery life maybe these an easy choice for me. I wish they offered a couple more colors, but I could say the same about the s20 line as a whole. They stay in my ear when I exercise, and are are comfortable while I'm laying in bed if I don't want to keep the wife awake. if you have never owned a pair I would recommend these over any of the Apple rivals. There are still cheaper alternatives on Amazon that offer fairly similar sound, but if you're fully immersed in a Samsung ecosystem there's no going wrong here.

These earphones are honestly worth it. The lab features and the earphones had upgraded specs with 22 hours of battery life in total with charging case.iOS compatibility smoothly and there is an option to have it on where if you tap the tip if your ear you can adjust the volume level like that due to the experimental feature but you have to turn it on manually

Incredible earbuds. The ambient nose mode almost works like a hearing aid when turned all the way up, and the battery life is incredible. I've had one of them in my ear for a solid nine hours, constantly playing audio and it's only down to 44%. In fact, the battery life is so good, that I can put one in before work, and leave the case in my vehicle, since that one earbud will easily last the entire 10 hour shift (without ambient on, with it on it'll last about 8 hours).

***Always, one earbud dies first than the other, usually the left one.***Signal strength is very poor, the music skips few seconds and cuts itself from a pocket distance, and also sometimes my phone is in the counter while me being in the stove cooking.

Bought mine in the middle of Feb. They sound great and I used them all the time throughout the day. The noise canceling feature works just the way I like.Beginning of April the connection between the buds to my phone started to go out randomly. I want to say after the last update around that time. I disconnected them and even uninstalled them and now only the right bud has sound. The left one is on but it doesn't connect at all. In the app it just shows as disconnected but it still beeps when I press it. I hoped they would lasted longer, didn't even have them for two months.

I really like these headphones. My only two cons are 1 they fall out of your ear.... I don't like that. Especially if you're working out, these are not headphones for working out. 2. Just the app itself for these I have to give a lot if permission just to use the app so right now I don't use the app lol just use the headphones

I purchased this earbuds for my wife's mother days present, the buds' box came whit the seals broken and inside there was no buds nor charging case so basically I paid $150 for a USB cable and the ear adapters.

The sound quality and battery is amazing I just don‚Äôt like the ambience sound I think is not yet there they are going in the right direction for sure but it just sounds to much pressure on your ear it‚Äôs not comfortable for long hours
Fresno Central Cali here.  Just got them like 30min ago did the update and...1st problem they WOULD NOT UPDATE and they bass sounds HORRIBLE.

I bought these Samsung ear buds from amazon and had issues with battery life in the beginning then the right one just failed it was at the 90 mark so I had to send them to Samsung and was told by Samsung these wen't made by them and wouldn't warranty them. So basically Amazon is selling products that are fakes.

I absolutely LOVE these...they go so well with my watch & note 9 in sound quality & functionality.  Can't wait to get my note 20 hooked up to them tho my note 9 does an excellent job. You'll be happy with these & yes I bought the extra warranty my ONLY complaint is that I wanted purple to match all my stuff but the red ones are so vibrant & they stand out. The case stays charged for a long time & so do the ear buds.

The sound is decent but my biggest complaint is battery life. The left bud discharges much faster than the right. I made sure both read 100% charge. Listening only to music from my S-10 for 2 hours, the right showed 85% charge left but the left only showed 63%. I tried this twice, getting the same results. No way these would get 11 hours. Sending them back.

I will go on record saying ... these bad boys are the truth. Sound quality is amazing ... they will blow you away (music)! They just came in so I still have to test call quality, battery, and other features but I just played all my top hits some with bass and some not, and these things handled them all! Of course over the head ear phones may sound better ... I get it ... but for what they are ... they shine! Buy them!

The ear buds are great. They fit well in my ear and they were extremely easy to connect to my cellphone.  I've only noticed one problem; if place the phone in my back pocket I get some breakup in the sound. I don't  know why the sound breaks up because any where else they sound great.The other thing I like is the ability to set how much outside sound you can let in. The setting is great when you want to be more aware of your surroundings.

Terrible product. They have no range. People on the other end can hear all my background noise instead of me talking. No option to lower mic input volume. Top it off my Samsung charging case broke not even two weeks after purchase. Took me 30 min on the phone with Samsung support and they couldn't understand my English enough to get the S/N to replace it.

Absolutely love theses! Amazing sound quality, noise cancelling, and VERY comfortable fit. They stay in my ears very well. I do have an iPhone, but I preferred these over airpods and I stick with my choice. Compatibility with my iPhone has not been a problem. They are much more affordable than airpods, and I feel like they work better.

Me llegaron los samsung galaxy buds plus y pens√© que el izquierdo hab√≠a salido defectuoso porque el diestro si estaba funcionando pero solo estaba descargado, los puse a cargar y ya funcionaron los dos. Descargu√© la aplicaci√≥n en ios y me sirvi√≥ de ecualizador aunque no hay mucha diferencia entre los diferentes modos.Personalmente estos aud√≠fonos creo que estan dirigidos a un p√∫blico que escucha m√∫sica electr√≥nica ya que puse una canci√≥n de este estilo y la calidad si fue la que estaba esperando.

Was great till I lost a bud. I owned both the original buds and the plus. The original buds left ear stopped working so i decided to upgrade to the plus. After a month with the plus buds I lost the right earbud, contacted Samsung only to be told a lost bud is not covered under warranty and it would cost $84 for one replacement bud. I love Samsung when it comes to  phones but when it comes to audio there trash. Within a year one set stopped working and I can't get the other replaced without basically buying another set. It's ridiculous.

I have worn these for working at home. Both to use as calls and to listen to music. You come to better understand the noise reduction when you use the ambient sound feature that allows you to hear the audio "outside".  It really keeps you from "yelling" on the phone calls.Very satisfied with them, and I have forgotten they were on a few times. I did have to use my own tips, but that's because I am probably more fussy than most.

Bought these to listen to music, audio books, and podcasts while working, doing house hold chores, and driving in the car. Only had them for 3 months and one of the has already stopped working! That's a lot of money for them to stop working, not to mention if you wear them too long they start to hurt your ears.Wouldn't recommend them! Although the sound is good!

Just got my buds +. Easy setup, fits snug and easy pairing with my iphone. Will blow the competition off with the sound production. I have them on for 2 hours now and don't feel any pain or discomfort. Excellent buy.

I use these to go walking outside. The call quality is amazing on these first of all. The person on other end can hear me clearly and I can hear them. Best earphones I've had for calling by far. Sound quality for music is great as well. I use them in library and am able to block everyone out without them hearing the music too. I hear the music at work over loud noises and no issues. App is nice and case great too.  Overall highly recommend.

Love them so far. The ambient noise setting is perfect. I'm a mom, and have pretty much just stayed away from headphones/earbuds because it blocks out too much of my surroundings (and cant have that with a little one running around) but these allow me to listen to music, an audio book, etc while still hearing my surroundings ( a knock at the door, my kiddo calling me from her room, etc). Amazing!

If these didn't have the left ear bud go out 2 months after I bought them id say they were great but this is the second pair I bought that the left ear bud just goes real real quite and stays like that. It be cool if their was like a replacement policy for this type of thing. Honestly feel like it was an update they had that caused this some how. Other then the left ear bud going out and having to buy new ones I enjoyed them but dang...

Really like the compact design and longer battery life. Works great with my Samsung devices. You will love it if you use it with Samsung phones. Pairs automatically and never faced any drops. Works well for phone calls as it has a good mic. Nice sound quality with good fit makes it a smart buy. Overall it's a smart buy and would recommend to a friend

Honestly if it wasn't for one flaw with the product I would have given this 5 stars across-the-board. When I received the item and opened it the buds+ were completely dead because they are shipped inside the charger so the buds and the charger gradually kill each others batteries over time.  Buds+ were so low when charger was plugged in it did not recognize buds were in the charger, luckily my friends standard buds charger was able to detect them and got an initial charge on them so my charger could detect them. After that no more issues.  May update review after some time, need to determine if the batteries were left dead for so long it affected memory.  Hopefully Samsung will be made aware of the issue and just put a small piece of tape over the contacts to stop this issue.

I fought with myself about buying these for MONTHS because I have such small ears and ear buds fall out all the time. Even the kind with the wrap around piece. These don't! They stay in my ears and cancel out EVERYTHING. I wear them at work to listen to podcasts and music and, 99% of the time, I have them turned up just enough to not notice when people are talking to me. :) The battery life for the buds themselves is great, but the case doesn't last too long. I did buy a refurbished pair, so that could be why. Definitely happy with this purchase.

So when I first put them on and paired them up I was kinda sad a lil disappointed but then I put them in DYNAMIC. I WAS LIKE OMG THIS SH*T IS NICE AF LIKE COME ONNNN. Highly recommend. The bass is nice and full. The highs are vibrant and crispy. Idk how to evaluate mids. Listening to pink Floyd and pop smoke and I gotta tell u it works either way. Fantastic. I got the blue ones and my sister who doesn't give craps about this stuff said they were pretty too. Super good get them

These are the best earbuds I've ever had by far. I've had Sony, JBL, Skullcandy etc- nothing compares.  They immediately connected to my phone (Gs10) and if you have Samsung and lose them you can easily track them through the wearable app (like the watches.) They have excellent battery life, they charge fast and can be charged directly from my phone as well. My Active 2 watch controls them as well and that is super handy since I'll be using them to work out. Look no further these are the best out there right now! Unlike the Sony, they are sweat proof and water resistant, they are comfortable and light weight as well. I hope to have these a few years. I see no reason to upgrade anytime soon.

I ordered and received these at the end of April and today, July, 29th the right bud has already completely stopped working. I've had to contact the manufacturer and I have to pay to ship them back and wait at least 2-3 weeks to know if they can fix or replace them.

The earbuds are ok but definitely NOT a good value purchase.  There are other less expensive wireless earbuds on Amazon that perform just as well at a much lower cost.  I have the TOZO T10, and it has better sound quality when listening to music.  The Samsung's mic and battery life outperform the Tozo.

Great battery life. Good features. VERY low volume and so so music sound quality.  No matter what I did I couldn't get these things moderately loud enough. If I plug in my V-Moda I can't go above 50% without damaging my ears. With the Galaxy Buds + with every maxxed out it wasn't loud enough to hear all the detail and I don't listen to blasting loud music.  Returning to try the Sony's.

Wow I'm very impressed with the clear and crisp sound I have with these. They were very surprisingly easy to pair to my galaxy note 10 and the touch features to pause and skip were very responsive as well (using Amazon music app) I would highly recommend. Noise cancelling feature is excellent so far

These are great ear buds. The battery life is superb, the sound quality excellent.I‚Äôm slightly disappointed with the bass, but other than that these are high quality, easy to set up and use. I use the iPhone version of the galaxy buds + app. Despite reading many reviews complaining that they couldn‚Äôt connect their buds to the app, I had no problem. If you‚Äôre going to use them frequently, I would say they are worth the money.

As someone who sold their soul to Apple, I am THOROUGHLY impressed with these bad boys. Wasn‚Äôt ready to put down 250 for some AirPods, so I figured I give these a try. First and foremost, they work with my IPhone, no problem. They also stay in your ear really well! Which is one of my biggest issues - even when running and sweating a lot. Secondly they have pretty solid sound quality. Not up to par with Bose, but I‚Äôve tried AirPod pros out before and I think it‚Äôs better then them. Noise canceling is solid. Charge time is great - can listen to them through almost whole day of work. Really happy with this purchase. Highly recommend.

Fit fine, controls were fine, didn't try long enough to comment on battery life.  The sound was bad, there was no bass even with the EQ on max. Seems that when you turn the bass up all it is REALLY doing is muffling the high frequencies! My $18 Sennheiser MX 365 Earphones have leagues better sound.  If this is how all wireless earbuds sound, I'll stick to wired ones.
Better than Sony WF-1000XM3.More bass

1) They DON'T stay in (& there were NO additional parts to change the fit in the box).2) There is so much interference from everything metal, everything electronic, every lamp, every door handle...you get the idea. There is "wave" interference wherever I wear them...CONSTANTLY!

The call quality is garbage. Very low sound and static. The music sounds good but only if you‚Äôre wearing both. Otherwise sound is low with no bass. The controls are also not that great. Bottom line, buy Apple. It‚Äôs not worth the headache. No one makes better electronics than Apple.

They've worked great, I'm not missing the wire at all. Now, I need to get the taps on the ear buds to scroll, answer the phone and not hang-up on someone just right. That's more patience and practice on my end. I'm very happy with my buds and the learning curve is closing with practice. Cheers!
for the price, these are fine. I don't love how they fit, even though they come with different size ear piece and wing tips. Sound cuts out when I put my phone in my pocket.

Husband loves it. I bought him the original black ones for Christmas. Someone stole one of the ear buds so I got him these for his birthday. Tells me that they are much better. Fit his ears better, and more comfortable for long periods of time. Sound quality is pristine and battery lasts longer than expected.

I'm normally a huge Samsung fan but these buds were very dissapointing. The sound quality was horrible for music!  There is absolutely no bass to them. If you are a bass lover like myself do not buy these. Even the overall sound quality was bad in my opinion. These are great for phone calls but not much else.

These things live in my ears. Sound quality is out of this world. I work near a freeway and these cancel plans noice. When my husband is being annoying, I pop these in with my favorite 90s playlist and am happy as a clam. Battery lasts 2 days. I‚Äôd say 1 Plus hours of continually play.  Highly Recommend these bad boys.

I purchase the Samsung Galaxy buds plus in Black, and when I open up the buds case to connect them to my device my Animation Display is White. Every video I see have the black Animation when you own the black Galaxy Buds plus accept mine. However when I go into the Galaxy wear app the display is Black in there. And the left ear bud sound lower then the right bud.

These are comfortable and have an amazing sound.  They're slightly heavier than the Pixel Buds 2 but they have a little more range and don't occasionally drop the Bluetooth connection.  I really like that you can set it so you can hear your own voice through the speaker when you're talking.  Otherwise when you talk you hear your voice muffled like you have a cold.They don't have noise canceling but I never found it to be an issue.  They still sound great even with a lot going on around you.

I have had zero problems with these earbuds when using them with my Galaxy Note 9, however there is a serious bug with these earbuds. I lost one in the grass when doing yard work and tried using "find my earbuds", but it didn't work. The earbuds won't make the chirping noise to help you find them if the app believes they are in your ear, which was a problem because there is no override for this feature if the sensor responsible for this isn't working correctly. What would've been a simple retrieval was ruined by a serious lack of foresight.If you plan on buying these earbuds, be aware that there is a possibility that this may happen. A good set of earbuds otherwise.

I've been looking for Bluetooth headphones for a while now and couldn't decide on some cheap 50$ ones or to go all the way and get some real true wireless headphones. These are perfect. Match amazing with my new S20+. Everything about these headphones are awesome, good sound quality, battery life, design, everything. Maybe I'm just a little OCD but the charging case is slightly offset on the door hinge, but it could just be from normal use although I've only had it a short while. I just hope it doesn't snap off or anything down the line, probably just the one design flaw, it can't all be perfect I guess.

Love my new "galaxy" headphones. Sound is good but could be better for the price? Not enough bass and loudness but the mid and treble are crisp. I love the fact that they lock into your ear and wont fall off specially when exercising that's why I am keeping them. Other brands simply fall off or the sound is just not there. Love the unique color also!

I was looking for something that was more in the ear than the classic air pods.  I opted for these these awesome Earbuds.  I love the color, it matches my new iPhone beautifully.  They were so easy to sync to my iPhone and charge quickly and hold their charge.  You won't be disappointed with these.

This is my first time using these type of wireless earbuds, I usually use over the head headphones so maybe my expectations are too high. The sound is perfectly adequate, nothing impressive there. The battery life isn't particularly great, it's nice that they come in a carrying case which extends the battery life but this is definitely a gadget you shouldnt forget to charge if you use it regularly. One thing I really don't like is that you can't buy a replacement charger from Samsung if it you ever lose it. You would need to buy a new set altogether. The main appeal of these headphones is that they're small and light and inconspicuous. Good for working out.

I had the original earbuds and they were very good. But the Galaxy earbuds plus are worth the extra money. With improved audio and longer battery life. I also like the range on these better. Noise cancelling should have been added. But maybe on the next ones.  I really do love the quality of these Galaxy earbuds plus.  They sound great!!!I am  true owner of these and have had them about a week.
Maybe it is just my ear but I found these buds painful to wear and I did try all sizes of the replaceable fittings.  Also an unbelievable amount of wind noise.

In general terms, it's a very good product, it has a very good sound and i'm very strict with this, i love that this products has all the functionalities with all other devices including Windows 10, i'm talking about the touchPad, the battery of these buds is amazing, i used them for about 3 hours and when i checked the battery, it was at 80%, the thing i don't like is that they are not that confortable, at least for me, i used to have the Airpods the whole night, but in this case as they are IN EAR headphones, are complicated to have them for long periods of time. The case in the other hand looks awesome, but doesn't feel premium considering the price.

But they make my ears super itchy! I replaced the tips with some comfort ones and they work a little better. However, the mic frequently gets really quiet and nobody can hear me, or it just quits working altogether. Frequent connection issues even with the Samsung Wear app. I'll stick with airpods, which are more comfortable for me anyway. I don't like the feeling of my ears being plugged like that.

I bought these after reading some reviews. So here's mine. If you work in a loud shop and you want to have ear protection while also having the ability to listen to music or toggle ambient noise to talk to people this is what you want. I can walk across my shop and they don't cut out and when the do it really connects seamlessly. They are great for everyday life as well. Water proofing could be better but thats the bad of them. All HAIL FROG!!! üê∏

I had the samsung ear buds 2018 no good got the 2019 they were real nice wor them out bought the 2020 the pluss fantastic an increase in sound phone calls are a lot better and the ambient sound is amazing if you like good quality sound and want the hole soumd spectrum buy these I use mine every day for about 4 hrs

After reading some reviews, I opted for the galaxy buds plus over apple air pods, and I am not disappointed. I love the way the samsung buds look, and they work just fine with my mac products. The motivating factor for buying these was to have a better mic than my laptop for video calls and remote teaching, and these buds have delivered both.As an aside, on this posting when you choose 'white' the photo shows blue buds. I figured I would be happy with either, so just went for it. Turns out the buds I got match the photo (they're blue.)

I was a little skeptical at first, but I Love them!  I figured they wouldn't stay in your ears, but they do and I have even used them on my husband's motorcycle.  Only feature I think would be an added bonus is being able to adjust the volume.  Or if it is a feature I haven't figured it out yet with even reading the book.
I debated which earbuds to buy & everyone kept encouraging me to but AirPods instead. I just really don't like Apple though, so here we are. I love these & would buy them again if I needed to..

I have yet to run out of battery, they sound good, just not as loud as I prefer, and definitely not as rich. The noise cancelation is ok, you can still here a bit. I HATE the ambient sound feature! It echos everything into your ears. It's terrible. But they are cute, sound good, and have long life battery.

The sound is very good for the price of this unit.  Connectivity is very strong.  I like to carry my phone in my holster while walking and the bluetooth connectivity is very strong.  No static or breakups.  The microphone is a bit distorted.  Not sure it will be useful at all.
Great sound, comfortable, charges fast.I would need to top it off at lunch, but then that would carry me the rest of the day.

even with bass boost there still aint much "bass" , the controls seems more buggy and harder to change songs or whatever compared to the original. If i remember right those were more custom on controls and i had my right bud go forward a song and left one go back. Well this one there is no change and you have to click either twice to go forward and 3 times to go back and there so much more buggy i barely use the controls where the first ones I had no problem and used them quite  a bit. Next time Im going to go with another brand tho. One great things are the battery like I work 10 hour days and they work all day and through all breaks with out needing a charge.

got this for work and its great overall. once you get the right fit in your ear its perfect. theres a app just for the buds and helps with initial setup. the battery life got me past a 12hr shift no issues, and the range on the connection was great. the sound was a bit off , but that might just be me. Worthy purchase, and forced me to review for others insights.

Once I was able to have them charged, they're great & stand up to samsung's reputation.Much better audio than the original buds & airpods. Great control for the Galaxy Buds+ App, that allows full manipulation of sound quality effortlessly.
Do not buy these my first set 1 bud did not work. Now a couple months after my replacement my second set of buds is now not responding MADE OVER SEAS UNLIKE SAMSUNG.COM.

These are definitely worth the price. Replaced my airpods 2 with these and definitely there's a difference. The Mic quality is exactly the same same as in airpods gen 2. Battery life is something else, you can wear these all day long and not need to charge them. The buds do get loud. Very comfortable and don't fall out when training.

the Samsung Galaxy Buds+ Plus could have had a 5-star rating however they will not connect to my phone and laptop simultaneously which is a deal-breaker for me. at the $150 price point, I expected better. It did not occur to me that duel connction would be an issue since my Jaybirds X3 connected right out of the box.
Couldn't get the control tap to work consistently, and battery life wasn't what I expected. They did stay in the ear fairly well.

The ear buds are good. I've had them for almost a month and they've been working fine until recently. Anyway, about a week ago, I was doing some yard work with the ear buds in. I received a notification on my phone and noticed that my left ear bud wasn't putting out any sound. Upon further inspection, I realized that my left ear bud had been quietly going in and out for awhile. Its annoying because it happens all the time now. The only way that I've gotten it to stop glitching is if i turn my sound notifications off completely. But this affects one of the key features of the ear buds. I wont be able to know if I'm getting a text or phone call because of this malfunction.

....I bought cheaper android earbuds and they were spotty. Spend the extra money on the Samsung. South Koreans possess a marvelously talented engineering culture. In fact Hyundai opened a climactic wind tunnel a few years ago that is the rival of the Audi's in Ingolstadt, which is the best in the world.

I had last years model and these have a definitely noticeable sound quality improvement. The microphones also have been improved. I love the the charging case pairs with my phone and i can see how charged it is on my phone. They are super light and with the different fittings they fit my ears perfectly. I can run, jump and work with them in without them falling out and not even notice they there other than the amazing sound.
Samsung has exceeded my expectations on the Galaxy Buds Plus. They're amazing. Perfect!!!The Galaxy Buds + are way better than the Galaxy Buds Live.

This is for my son! He loves the color, so Shiney, he loves the sound quality, he loves that he can talk to google by long pressing! He loves everything about them! He would like to have a fast forward and rewind option, and maybe there is and we havnt figured it out yet, but everything else is amazing!!
The earbud case feels alittle bit sloppy

The buds are really great! Especially on battery life. However, they disconnect soo much even after multiple developer updates. Talking on the phone while using wifi is horrid. The person you're talking to sounds like a robot. Other than that I would say that these are some pretty solid upgrades from the older models.

The sound is amazing and the feel is great! I've never felt more comfortable using them.The ambient sound feature makes it great choice when going on the bus or the metrorail, can hear everyone clearly! However the one flaw is that my buds tend to disconnect or give distorted sounds when I have my phone in my pocket or blocking direct line of sight between the buds and my phone. Granted it is uncommon but a nuisance when it does happen.Overall, a great purchase!
These headphones are amazing but after a few weeks with them the right ear started messing up, really disappointed because they are good headphones, id reccomend them but get a warranty
These had amazing sound quality and battery life but they get 1 star for not staying in my ears. Too expensive to be falling out, returned.

A good all around wireless earphone. Great battery and charge speed, and decent listening at a distance. I am not an audiophile, but have a taste for quality sound. These meet my needs well.Disgruntled that the price went down $20 two months after I purchased them. Even so, still a great purchase.
Pretty decent little true wireless headphones noise cancellation would be a nice feature to add.Pass-through audio is really cool makes me feel like I have super hearing.

These have so many cool feature it's hard to pick out the best ones. I love the ambient noise feature, so often I'm afraid I'll miss a doorbell or something while listening to music at increased volume. The AN feature still picks up those sounds. Fitment was a breeze as well, I have one ear canal smaller than the other so the extra tips really helped.

Its everything it said they were well worth the money I have a galaxy s10 plus I have tried 4 different kind of airbuds by the time you get done trying all the cheap one you could have had the galaxy buds if you have a galaxy phone and have wasted enough money like I have go ahead and get them they are worth every penny
Is exactly  as described  is  a big improvement. Sound is about the same as the 1st gen but  it is very clear.  I like them alot  thank you
I've had apple air pods. I changed to Samsung and I liked my buds. But these Samsung buds plus are SOOOOOO much better than the originals. It's not even comparable.

Get what you pay for: a great product made by Samsung. Also bought another cheapie but raved about set of earbuds recommended by an electronics review website. Although well rated by the electronics website, the Cheapie earbuds terrible: they muted and refused to unmute - so $30.00 down the drain. Buy the Samsung. Samsung works!
I have only one complaint about these buds and it‚Äôs the battery life.I only get about 6 hours on a full charge compared to the 11 advertised. I might have received one with a defect

Sound quality seems great  but I need to have me phone close by or it cuts out.  I left my phone on the kitchen counter and walked into my laundry room 20 feet away and it started breaking up the music. Sometimes the double tap won't skip to the next song either.  Also, package did not come with a charger. Not a big deal for me because my phone uses a usb-c.

Really enjoy these. Sound is clear however, haven't had them but for a few days. Comfortable to wear. If there is one thing that I am disappointed in is that I haven't been able to pair with Kindle 8. Either I don't know how or they just aren't compatible. Great quality at a good price.

I would say these are absolutely a must if you're a Samsung person like me. Also, the sport team did I great quick job helping me out over a problem that was my fault. I gave 4 stars on battery life just because there case seems to need charged frequently. I've had them for 2 weeks and they've been fantastic. Like I said, if you have Samsung products these buds are a MUST!!!!!
I was debating between this and airpod, but decided to get these as I am an android user. My decision was great. The sound quality is great and they don't fall out even when I'm jogging.

I use these all the time. The battery life is no joke - literally 11+ hours of audiobook/music. The case holds about 2 full charges so I charge my buds+ once a week. Call quality is good and the ambient sound feature works, but both are a bit "tinny." I'm a little bummed that these are not water and dust proof, but I am more than satisfied with this product. Also, i like how it doesn't look like I have little cigarettes sticking out of my ears.
Got these for my hubby for Father's Day and he loved them! I already had a pair, so we knew how great they were.

Great sound and excellent battery life.  If you are looking for a great pair of earbuds in the 100 to 150 range these are great.  Calls are great, everyone can hear me clear. That's the biggest difference when you make a jump from a cheaper pair of buds.Tip: there is an equalizer in the wear app, but if your phone has eq settings, you can fine tune your sound. I have a Note 9 with Dobly where I can set the eq for each BT device separately.

I bought  3 sets of these for myself and my family in June. A month ago my right bud disconnected and no matter what I do it won't reconnect.  Two days ago my husband's left earbud did the exactly same thing. With what I spent on these I shouldn't be having all these problems with trying to get a new pair. So I'm just waiting for my last pair I bought to do the same thing.  I'll just go back to my around the neck wired earbuds from LG. Don't waste your money. I've read tons of reviews with the same issue.

These were great while it worked.  The 1st pair stopped working after 3 months.  No or low sound.  They sent a new pair because they couldn't fix it.  Three months later, they 2nd pair have the same problem. Sent to repair again and I was told that it will cost $108 to fix the problem. They said it was not covered under warranty because it was dirty. I don't know how the earbuds can get dirty since it was in the case after each use.  I checked it over before I sent it and it looks clean.  Don't buy these!

DO NOT BUY THISwhen our headphones stopped working we brought them into Samsung for repairs. Samsung said this was NOT sold by them (the seller is actually something like "coolwifi" I hunted them down). Samsung will NOT honor the warranty bc these are NOT the US version. Samsun does NOT sell their products directly on amazon. Call them directly if you want but DONT BUY THESE

My wife loves the new ear buds+ sound quality better than her old ear buds. But for some reason the right ear bud does not want to charge in the case. Only when you plug it in. Wich defeats the purpose of having portable charging case. This is the second pair the first pair of galaxy buds+ dif the same thing. But I will say amazon is quick to refund or exchange the product. So thank you for that. Not sure what we are going to do with this second pair. Anyone else having the same issues?

The sound quality is excellent, pretty comparable to my Marshall headphones that are about 100$ more expensive. Battery life is excellent. Noise isolation could be better, but I didn't buy these with noise cancellation considered, so it's ok. most noise will be blocked out when music is playing, for podcasts ambient noise could be a little distracting. all in all I'm happy with this purchase.

The noise cancelation is great! Even with 1 in i can tune out most of my toddlers shows while I'm trying to clean. I've only charges them once since I got them almost a month ago. I wasn't sure about the shape of the pods but they fit really well into my ear

We bought this item as a gift. It arrived on time and was exactly as described. We haven‚Äôt heard anything negative from the recipient, therefore you get 5 stars from us. In the unlikely event we hear anything out of the ordinary. We will update our posts as necessary.
It's a great product but my left earbud literally stopped working,no water damage, no drops nothing

Best battery life of any wireless ear buds.  Sound quality is awesome.  The fit takes a little getting used to.  My last ear buds were the Airpods 2nd gen, I hardly noticed they were ever in my ears.  These ones sound just as good and work much better with my Galaxy S20 Ultra.  I love the touch controls.

Very nice for the price! I love them easy to use and the app is easy-to-use for all the set up and sound adjustments. Im very happy with all the adapters that come with them to make them feel comfortable in your ears. I enjoy them bedder then my pids from a different company.  Enjoy your music!!

These ear buds are very nice. I was reluctant to buy them because my French Door refrigerator is defective on two fronts - the ice maker and the fridge portions have malfunctioned bi-monthly - and Samsung knows there's a problem with thousands of these products and they still fight the customer.

Beware ordering these from Amazon Warehouse Deals.  Got the first set, and the left earbud wouldn't work no matter what kind or how much troubleshooting I performed.  Returned them and got a replacement.  Second set had the exact same problem.  Will not be ordering a third.
Reasons TO buy:Wireless
*Good battery life*They are too cute

I ordered this for my husband. He is an enthusiast of technology. We actually had high expectations for this device. Battery life can be improved. With this price it should have noise cancellation. But overall a good device based on accessibility and structure of the ear pod. It sticks nicely into the ear and doesn‚Äôt fall down when working out.
great features excellent noise isolation super comfortable and they never fall out of my ears .The only issue is the lack of bass .

These earbuds are very comfortable and the battery life is great but as far as consistent sound quality, they are terrible. I thought it was a defect with the first pair I received but, I exchanged them for a new pair and am still having the same issues. The sounds randomly cuts out, the left earbud has a high-pitch beeping sound at times, the sound quality is terrible when used with my computer and there is constant static. Never once I have used them without a sound quality issue. I would not recommend these earbuds at all. I have no problems with any other bluetooth phones/buds with any of my devices so I know the issue is specifically related to to these earbuds.

I love alot about this item .. the only bad for Me is not loud enough but i am a little hard hearing.. I've listened to them well over 12 hours before recharge in there own little üì¶.. one fell out of my ear cause i was sweating really hard it fell in water i dried it off works as if nothing ever happened to it... great product probly 150 feet if bluetooth range .... for me price was a little high and i think i bought the name more than the product....ear buds are a dime a dozen.....

Touch ear to change songs/volume that's dope! But doesn't get as loud as I'd like. Noise cancelation is there with an optional setting to turn on ambient sound that means you can hear around you. All together awesome tech! With that said there is always room for improvement. Price to Functionality i would say its worth it. My only issue that I can put my finger on is that I wish they got louder. Mind you I can't complain on the volume. Atleast with the noise cancelation. Just got them so can't review the battery.

Fast delivery, sound great! These fit perfectly. Hardly know they are actually in my ear. Stay securely while exercising, while out for a run, or doing yard work. ***Note that I had issues with low volume until I set one for volume up, and the other for volume down. It's all in the Buds+ app.
These earbuds are high quality.  I didn't expect the battery life to be to good on these but its actually pretty strong.  That combined with the case that charges it makes it last that much longer.

I was slightly hesitant when I first heard that they were coming out with the next generation of Galaxy Buds. I wasn't a fan of the quality in the first generation and it didn't seem like they had much to trump competing buds in the same price range; however, I am so glad that I bought these. After having these for months I completely forget that I am wearing them, they sound great, and the call quality is outstanding! I am incredibly happy with the direction Samsung took on these!

I was really excited on getting them, however; once I analyzed the buds I realized that the material for the ear piece and the case it's self is very cheaply made (at least when compared to the first generation) and as I was changing the ear wing to a larger size, I noticed that the right one was slightly ripped from the bottom and figured that it would rip over time. I tried to get ONLY the earwing replaced, but costumer support wasn't much help. After talking to several reps, I finally decided to replace the whole product for a new one. Sorry Samsung, I was kind of disappointed this time around. Over all, the buds have a really nice touch to it (at least the red one does), and the added mic is excellent!

I just purchased them about 2 weeks ago and really like them.  Yesterday for about 10 minutes at one time, there was a very slight static sound.  It hasn't happened the rest of the day.  I hope it doesn't happen again.  Overall I'm happy with them.On a frustrated note, I already lost one of the earbuds.  How can I replace it?

Had the previous Galaxy Buds for 1 year. Thought about replacing them with the Buds+. That thought turned into actually doing it after sending them through the washing machine last week. All I can say is wow! Huge upgrade. The ambient mode alone is soooo much better which is huge in my work environment. Tons of little improvements basically make these an entire overhaul and definitely worth the upgrade.
DO NOT BUY THESE!be warned IF YOU BUY THESE THERE IS NO SUPPORT FOR THE PRODUCT

I like these. They have great sound quality and noise cancelling. The battery life does not last very long. Some times if I am using them while on Zoom, the microphone will just drop out. I don't know it has stopped working until I look at the little microphone on the screen and see the green sound bar not moving. They fit nicely in the ears and I have small ears that sometimes earbuds hurt. These do not.

All I'll say is I bought two other pairs of wireless ear buds before these and returned both within a week or so due to issues. I finally decided to go all in and spend the money for the Samsung Galaxy Buds+ and have not been disappointed. These are great and I love them. If you are on the fence, these are worth it compared to cheaper brands.
These are great. They fit well and I don't feel as if I'm missing any of the music.My only problem is the ambient sound when I'm running or riding the bike.

After reading all the bad reviews,I was still dumb enough to think it would be different for me.... I read all the instructions  I followed them...all I got was pure STATIC! THEY ARE GARBAGE! I HATE THEM! I AM RETURNING THEM!!!! PURE JUNK!

I have a Samsung phone so I purchased the earbuds. Either it doesn't have noise cancel to hear when someone is speaking or I'm just not figuring out how to work it. Either way, I use them to mow my lawn with and I can hear my music and not the mower so much.

I bought the Samsung Galaxy Buds+ Plus to upgrade from $30 AUKEY headset.  I use the buds with iPhone 11.  I give 1 star because the buds keep disconnecting even though I have my phone in may pocket or in handbag.  I didn't have hit issue with AUKEY headset. Maybe I'm unlucky and got defected ones?  I wish I could return or exchange to the new ones.

Love this buds with my note 9 and s20!! Perfect sound, love the ambient sound, and clear voice calls. If u got samsung, u gotta get the matching buds, this are a A+++ way better than my previous beats for working out. These stay in ear and no need to worry about a short cord that goes around your neck. Just pop it in, and u good to go!!

Love this product even my husband loves it and it syncs to his iphone nicely. I'm team Samsung!  I can use one and when it has low battery I just use the other while the one I used is charging.  But it has never lost charge when I'm working my 8hrs.  My husband uses it while he goes for a walk/run in this pandemic and for his safety uses the galaxy earbuds to be able to hear outside noise while listening to his music/podcast.

as far as fit and sound quality out of box the left bud it was good. long battery life is convenient however the right bud failed to even turn on. You think with a brand like Samsung this shouldn't happen but I realized that this is a common issue with these earbuds.
