So I bought these hoping they would fix a few things from the original pair of GB's. Mainly call quality and the frequent cut-outs in their connection. While they fixed one of those things, I was disappointed by the other and something completely unrelated changed compared to the original buds.I will start by saying that they did not really fix the connection issues. I tend to keep my phone in my left pocket and with the original buds 90% of the time when reaching in my pocket if my hand covered my phone at all I would get an obnoxious cut-out from the Bluetooth connection. They have sort of improved this over time and it happens maybe 60% of the time now, still too much but it's kind of bearable. I bought the Buds+ hoping this would be fixed entirely since I own a few other TWS that do not ever have this problem. Unfortunately the Buds+ are about on par with the regular Buds in this department. Their range is also not great, I can be less than 5 feet away from my connected device but if there's a wall between me and the device the connection struggles quite a bit.

I bought some of these at Costco for $100. I like a lot about them. You can use either bud by itself. The case/charger is secure, yet it can be opened by one hand. The sound was fine. But people on the other end of phone calls had difficulty hearing me. It seemed to be worse when there was background noise. Best Buy says that they've had to return a lot of these because of the microphone issue. Costco gave me my money back.
Downloaded firmware update after updating wearable app. It improved the sound quality.Comply foam tips for galaxy buds fit these.
1. very comfortable2. block out a lot of noise because of fit

I sent in my galaxy buds under warranty for peeling clear coat after 6 months of use. I really loved them but didn't think it was right to have peeling paint so soon. While on the call with Samsung, the customer service rep told me of  buds plus. I instantly offered to pay the difference to get the upgrade rather than the regular buds as replacement. Sadly, they said their policy did not allow it... fast forward to today. I got the replacement and to my surprise, they sent me a buds plus!!! What customer service! This is why I only buy Samsung for my electronics. And yes, the sound and call quality is noticeably improved over the normal buds. Just got off 3 back to back calls and I didn't have to deal with people not hearing me anymore. SWEET~

TL;DR - Good headphones as long as you don't lose one.I had the original Galaxy Buds and loved them. Unfortunately, lost one fishing after having them for a year. Just in time to pick up the new Buds+. Love it right away! The upgrade is decent, not life changing but the longer battery life and other enhancements are good. If own original buds and they work fine, I don't believe it is worth the upgrade but if you're in search of a new pair, these really are good.

I have such mixed feelings about these. I will start off by saying: when they work, they‚Äôre AMAZING. Customer service: AMAZING. Earbuds as a whole... not so much.The sound is great. The seal is great- they aren‚Äôt actually noise cancelling, but they might as well be with how totally they cut off sound around you, which I really liked. The fine-tuning to the touchpads and sound through the Apple app is great. They‚Äôre a bit obtrusive visually, hanging out of your ear more than other buds I‚Äôve seen, but they don‚Äôt feel like they‚Äôre about to take a tumble unless you start chewing or talking a lot. But when it comes to durability... read on.

I bought this product (not at Amazon though) because many reviews on Youtube reported on the excellent call quality. Although it is maybe better than average, it is still not satisfying to me.I bought and tested 12 bluetooth headsets (Soundbuds Slim, Taotronics, Philips, JBL, MPOW, Samsung, ANKER - unfortunately I can not upload a photo here) and surprisingly, the inexpensive MPOW S15 (not TWS) came out on top regarding call quality (noticeably too!). Even when listening to music the MPOW sounds better than the Buds Plus! Unfortunate, because I would truely like to have TWS earbuds with excellent call quality.

Battery life 10. Fit, fits me fine comes with larger and smaller earbuds which should be fine for anyone, also you can buy others. Connection with any Android phone (apple guys I'm getting to you) is so simple my 11 year old did it as easily as my mom. Water and sweat proof.The sound...

Just got mine from Target and they are incredible. 5/5. These bad reviews from other people must have either had defective reviews or paid to leave 3 stars or less because the ones I got are insane. They sound better than my AirPod Pros. Yeah those have ANC but these right here for $150 are a much better value. Plus the app it‚Äôs compatible with is also another plus. The overall sound is great on top of the INSANE 11 hour battery life.
I really want to love this product more than I do. They look great, they sound great when only listening to music, and the battery life is great.But.

Like the fit and quality of sound. Tighter fitting eargel definitely increases bass. Haven‚Äôt had it long enough to say anything about battery life. Had to return it to Samsung (not Amazon) because case would not charge on Qi charger.  I have yet to receive a replacement. It is now March 25. I sent it on the 1st of Mar. ,they received it on the 3rd.  I have chatted with Samsung support twice and called once. All they can say is that the ticket is still open. No word on when I will receive my replacement or why it is taking so long. Very frustrating.  One star for Samsung support.

I purchased a pair of these earbuds in March 2020.A couple weeks ago (~2 months later), one of the earbuds stopped working. I've tried reconnecting it a couple of times to different devices but it did not help. I wanted to factory reset the earbuds, but it can only be done through the phone app, which is not compatible with iphone 6's (what I own) or older. It turns out a lot of folks have experienced this issue as well, so I'm giving it a one star due to poor reliability.

I bought these as an  upgrade from the Galaxy Buds which work flawlessly. The plus have a microphone in each bud and I expected better microphone quality as the originals don't pick up well in certain situations.However, on arrival I cannot charge the left bud or connect to the app. I tried everything I could after hunting on the internet for a solution.
Talk about a upgrade.Let's hit in the main aspects.

These didn't last. Not a bad product but add these to the list of Samsung products that are undependable.2500$ refrigerator, lasted 3 months. 3 very expensive telephones broken down, one right out of the box. Have purchased at least 7 TV;s from them,  several have broken down multiple times, including 1 that broke down 3 times in 6 months. Samsung makes good products but they don't last.

I am a long time Samsung mobile user in spite of most of my family being iphone users.  I recently purchased a set of Galaxy Buds+ to go with my S20 directly from Samsung.  The arrived today and unfortunately the left ear bus was defective.  After an hour on the phone with tech support and sales I, was told that I needed to ship them back, wait for a return and reorder all over again.  I can only imagine that this process will take weeks.  I never come across such a policy that was so customer unfriendly.  I would have expected at a minimum that Samsung would have been embarrassed to have shipped defective product and done everything possible to make up for the obvious lack of quality control by immediately shipping out a replacement overnight and not some archaic process of return, credit and repurchase.I have to say that I am very disappointed and may have to rethink my allegiance to Samsung given that there is no allegiance to their customers in return!
The Momentum TWS Are Now $200Some Pros - JuSt SaYiNg .  .  .

These are definitely the best sounding ear buds I've ever used. They are decently bass heavy & sound clear for just about any genre. I listen to mostly rock music, & I can hear the bass drum hit every single time. Thats pretty awesome for ear buds. Keep in mind, you really have to make them fit right to get the best sound out of these. When they first came in, I used the wing tips that came on the buds, and it made it so they didn't go all the way into my ear. They sounded VERY quiet & I thought about returning. After adjusting the tips & finding what fits perfectly. They literally sound like different ear buds now. Even on half volume I can't hear anything around me unless I turn on the ambient sound. Which works wonderfully to. So for sound quality. Id easily give 9/10.Now for the noise cancelation, it works amazing. You can set it up in the Galaxy wear app to turn it off & on by holding down on one of the ear buds. Amazing feature, if I want to hear my surroundings or just drown everything out. I can do that without pulling out my phone. The ambient sound is also pretty clear, & it really picks up the sounds you want. I recommend using the medium setting, worked the best for me! As for noise cancelation I'd give it a 9/10.

Purchased from Best Buy. Out of Jaybird, Beats and off market brands from my past, Samsung Earbuds plus is the best. I have already recommended to a friend.Easiest set to fit in my ear, sound and call quality are great. I carried a one hour phone call session while walking around the lake (practiced social distancing).  Although the recipient didn't realize I was outside during our conversation.

Interested in comfort only with this type of product.Compared to jabra or sony or many others, these are lightweight. But also have that little wing that keeps them from falling off even if not firmly in the ear. And that's the key - can wear them loosely, almost like Airpods, which is a must if wearing all day.

These seem like the total package at first glance. They have long battery life, good mics, wireless charging, USB-C, a small case, good sound quality, and even an easily serviceable design. All of those are true and very compelling reasons to keep it around. Unfortunately, there are plenty of turn offs that keep this from being the slam dunk they might appear to be.The most important one is the size. They don't stick out a lot, but they're legitimately painful to wear if you have smaller ears. Very few earbuds fit in my tiny ears, and these were killing my ears and jaw after only 5 minutes of use (with any of the wingtips and ear tip combos). The size of the buds themselves is still quite large, feeling like a marble in my ears.
They were my favorite earbuds till an update started asking for all permissions.Since the update, earbuds are useless unless you're willing to give all permission to you data.

I have owned quite a few ear buds in the last several years, but these are by far the best every day buds that I have owned. First off, they stay secure in my ears no matter what activity I'm doing, and they are very comfortable in my ears even after 6 hours or more of continuous use. Sound quality is excellent and adjustable with the handy equalizer within the Galaxy Wearable App. Sound quality during phone calls is excellent and clear for both parties, even in a noisy environment. Ambient outside sound quality is excellent and has adjustable volume levels within the app. At my age it actually works better than my natural hearing. Battery life is excellent and is viewable within the app. They are also rechargeable from the case alone if necessary. I use mine for about 6 hours a day while working, and they still show about 60% charge left afterwards. Initial pairing is a breeze, after which they automatically pair with my phone as soon as they power up. Answering/ending calls, pausing/starting music, adjusting volume up/down are easily done with finger taps to specific points on the buds. Use firm taps to execute commands. If you buy these buds they will quickly become your everyday go to buds.

To use the full features of these you have to install the Galaxy Wearables app. And when you install that it asks for every permission available, including 24/7 location, contacts, ability to install software on your phone, etc. As an added bonus, when you install that app you have to agree that Samsung is allowed to collect and sell your personal information. This is great! Expensive headphones weren't enough for me - I also want you to monitor my location all the time and sell that info to god knows who.

There's been reports of the case laing percentage even when not actively charging the buds. I did my own tests and the case definitely seems to have an efficiency problem.Disclaimer : I didn't use ambient sound at all during testing.

I really wanted to love these.  They're red and shiny...but the sound is really lacking and has no depth.  I downloaded the Samsung Wear app (as recommended) and tried all different setting there, which didn't fix it.  I tried all different phone settings to make it better, but they were just too quiet (you needed them set into the orange volume warning to hear at a normal level) and sounded flat.  I found an equalizer app that helped.  But let's face it, for that much money, they should just work right.  Maybe I got a dud, because the reviews are great, but these seemed defective or just not worth it.  I don't want to gamble at trying another pair to find out.I gave them 2 stars because they are very comfortable and pair easily.

The right earbud quit working about 3 months after purchase.  I contacted Samsung and was told that I was still under warranty as they had been purchased on 5/18/2020.  One week after they received them I was informed by email that it would cost me $108.00 to have them replaced as they were not covered under their warranty as they were manufactured outside the USA.  I spent over 90 minutes on the phone speaking with 4 different people who all repeated the same thing to me.  I own a Samsung TV, Samsung Galaxy S10 phone, Samsung wireless charger and other Samsung products.  None of which have been made in the USA.  The warranty does not say a thing about not being covered unless made in the USA.  I am done with all Samsung products for good.

These buds work great with seamless Bluetooth connectivity. The range isn't as big as Airpods pro or Pixel Buds 2nd Gen. The buds fit into the ear very nice and block out most of the outside noise. This feature acts as a noise cancellation.The ambient mode works quite nice allowing outside sound to be heard clearly.

Sound isolation and the fit are very good.  Great fit for moving around and working out.  At first they sounded hollow and tinny but im adjusted to them now and sound is good, not great but pretty good.  You could say great sound considering their very small size.The bad.

I have samsung everything - the galaxy watch active, the s8+ (still), the TV, even the buds. I've had the buds for several months now and they were honestly great. But after about 5 months I started experiencing problems (which is why I rated everything a 1 star). The buds will connect to my phone, however the audio will be dramatically reduced, sometimes in both or just 1 of the buds. I was able to fix the problem by resetting them through the galaxy wearables app. I continued to do that for a few months and the other day I think they totally crapped out on me (still less that 1 year of owning them). Currently both buds connect to my phone but only audio from the right bud is working. The left bud produces audio but barely audible - it's really annoying. I tried everything to troubleshoot these, I reset them, unpaired them, uninstalled the app, turned by bluetooth off, and then repaired everything and still doesn't work. I contacted samsung to have them repaired as they are still under warranty but apparently I bought an international version on amazon directed toward latin america and samsung USA cannot repair those. They said I would have to send them to Samsung latin america which would cost me more than the buds themselves. Amazon has also refused to help me whatsoever even though the product only listed that it was international in the small print of the product features 3/4 down the page (I thought that was pretty misleading). Anyway, I'm stuck with these garbage headphones now and pretty much SOL. I did purchase my gf a pair of airpods about 1 year ago and I will say she uses them everyday and has never experienced any sort of issue with them. I guess you get what you pay for. It pains me to say this as a samsung phone owner, but I will probably be buying the airpods or the google pixel buds come November. Hope this helps.PS: this issue is apparently very common from what I've found on the internet while trying to fix them. Definitely look into what types of issues people have with which ever buds you decide to go with

I bought these at best buy since I had a discount with them($20 off). Great upgrade from the originals, sounds much better during calls and battery lasts waaaaaaaay longer. I recommend. And to the moron giving them a 1 star rating for cancer? Living inside your house gives you cancer. Stepping out of your house gives you cancer. Literally everything gives you cancer. I hope you catch cancer soon with your unhelpful hater based "review".

You may see others reviews and make note of the excellent sound, superior fit, and amazing battery life of these headphones, and they'd be correct.The buds are able to produce exceptionally clear and full sound, for being entirely wireless, and they deserve credit for it.

Yet again, I tried out a Samsung product and at 2 months and 1 week in, I had problems. It does not charge wirelessly at 2 months use every day or every other day. The connectivity during phone calls since day 11 are absolutely horrible. I get about 12-21 seconds into a phone call with these and NOBODY CAN HEAR ME, LIKE EVER!!!!!! I'm beyond angry and I want my money back because I got roped off but apparently Samsung won't issue me a refund because, "I made a bad choice". Really!?!? Really Samsung!?!? Wow! Way to keep up that customer satisfaction and keep your name trustworthy. I'm extremely displeased with these ear buds. They worked great for about 7 days, 1 hour, and 12 minutes. I documented it based on what it showed I used. LG headset and Google pixel buds will blow this crap product it of the water! I'm so angry with Samsung! Very very VERY unhappy with this product!

I have bought everything, Bose, AKG, Motorola, named brand, no named brand, at least 25 different pair of head phones/wireless earphones over the last several years.  My daughter bought me these as a fathers day present (i may have mentioned them to her) and they are magnificent.  I am very critical about sound quality.  Battery life seems ok.  If you have a samsung tables it automaticalyy recoginzes them and the pairing to a samsung phone is perfect.  Very good value, well made, very good sound.

I've switched earbuds quite a few time over the last few years, but I don't think I'm going to switching off from these any time soon. The sound sounds absolutely stellar (I use the dynamic setting on the galaxy buds app), with the lows being punchy, and the mids and highs being crystal clear (and do not sound tinny at all). Overall, here is a list of pros and cons:Pros:

Good sound, great battery life, and even has an app to remap touch actions. They fit in my ears well and the charging case is small enough to fit comfortably in my pocket. Basically everything I could ask for in true wireless headphones without completely breaking the bank.My only note is the call quality, unless I raise my voice it is hard for the other person to hear me. Even than it still seems to have trouble picking up my voice at times. However, considering I never intended to use them for calls I will not knock points off.

Sounds better than the galaxy buds,  but the bass is not as strong,  but the highs are better. I like listening to music loud.  Too bad they can't go as loud as i would like them too but it's probably because of the volume on the phone. when i have them on, i cant really hear anything around me,so i don't think noise cancelling matters unless you're around heavy traffic and construction or something.

I'll start by saying the audio on these is fantastic when paired with my iPhone, the battery life is solid, and they're fairly comfortable, although after a couple hours of use my ears do get a tiny bit sore. My biggest complaint is that I can't pair them with my Macbook Pro, which makes them unusable for about 50%+ of the audio that I listen to. They just don't show up under Bluetooth devices. I've tried troubleshooting the issue ad nauseum to no avail. The samsung website says they can pair with any bluetooth device, and I've never had an issue pairing other headphones or audio devices with my laptop. So if you just want to use them with your phone, go for it. Maybe they work well with PCs (I wouldn't know), but in my experience you don't wanna buy these if you want to use them with your Mac.

2 stars because I have been through 2 sets of buds in less than a year.First, the left bud started loosing volume till barely any sound came out of it. Sent it back to Samsung and what a process that was. They sent me a replacement - 5 stars for that.

I already noticed a difference compared to the og galaxy buds. Battery life and ambient mode for me have been the biggest difference. My wife can also understand me when I call her and no longer sounds like I'm talking through a tin can. Hands down worth the price.I used to have the airpods pro as well, but due to a defect i had to return it. I loved the ambient mode on them but honestly I like the galaxy buds plus ambient mode just a touch better. The og buds sucked in this department. I liked the active noise cancelation (anc) on the airpods pro but it would give me a headache after 30 min. So to be $100 less than the airpods pro and perform equally, and in some areas better than the pro, with the dropped anc feature is worth it imo.

I bought these ear buds from T-mobile  and they are awful.  It literally sounds like the music, TV, and calls and coming from a tin can. I dont know how anyone can be pleased with these ear buds. The fit was perfect and they were comfortable but everything else totally sucked. I have a  ote 10 plus and changed every setting possible and still sounded like crap

Unless it is cold in your surroundings or u don‚Äôt sweat that much from your ear.  They are perfect for casual use, but for gym use if you don‚Äôt have these requirements met, DO NOT GO FOR THESE. IPX2 is not enough for gym use.My left ear bud‚Äôs touch response is gone and my right earbud‚Äòs microphone is busted because it fell down while doing a push-up.  I hear a microphone static whenever I activate ambient mode. Don‚Äôt make the same mistake I did.  My ears might have been a bad fit. But the sweat from ur ear will make them slip out

I've held off on wireless earbuds because the sound quality and function just wasn't there.  Decided to jump in with these and I have no regrets.  I've recently been traveling more for work and the ambient sound feature is great.  Walk up to the rental car counter and turn on ambient sound, finish my business and ambient back off.  No pulling an earbud out to hear.  Phone calls sound great.  I've asked several people how I sounded on a call and they all said fine.  Even in challenging high noise environments.  Only complaint is not having control over all touch assignments.  Assigned volume control to the user defined option but would also like to turn on and off ambient.

Cons- really only had one con for me and that is that they hurt my ears a lot. I would say I have smaller ears and even with the smallest wing and gel tip its to big. I've only used them for three days and when I put them in it feels like my ear is being stabbed.Pros- just using one bud gave me all day battery at work. Sound quality is fantastic and I listen to a wide variety of music (not an audiophile).

I loved these earbuds for a whole month I was convinced they were the best of the best‚Ä¶After 30 days or so my right earbud stopped working. If I use both of them they both stopped working‚Ä¶ I still have use of just the left one.

These buds are great got them from Samsung 24hrs ago and what I can say is call quality is freaking awesome 10 times better than the first buds. I have a Galaxy note plus and the connection is great put I also connect them to my iPod simultaneously and when my phone rings my iPod stops and when I hang up the iPod starts back up again, the best thing ever.

These things are amazing. Great sound. Great battery life, really it's out of this world. The buds aren't heavy or clunky. The case is slim and smooth. They work independently of each other, with the app the functionality of the touch sensors on the sides is exactly what you would expect with options in their "Lab" that are expanding it seems. The touch response is very good, no complaints. The adaptive sound is impressive and doesn't feel invasive in an office setting at low or medium, where high I can see would be great for outdoor activities or exercise. Call quality is probably better than what I can get out of my phone itself (Note 8), I am heard clearly and don't have to worry about asking for or being asked to repeat what was said.As I said, treat your self.

Dont buy these they are not worth it for $150. I bought them thinking they would sound better than the earbuds that came with my s10 plus but they dont. They sound worse than a $15 pair of AKG wired earbuds. There is no noise cancelling and they have ambient mode so you can here more outside sounds. I think they have it mixed up. The battery life is okay but after 5 minutes of usage the already go down by 2%. Get a pair of wired AKG or a pair of beats.

I bought these in June (from the Samsung website) and the end of September the left bud is so quiet no matter what the volume is at. They stay in a drawer until I want to use them on the couch so I don't take them anywhere where they would get dropped or exposed to water. They don't last.

These are alright, I paired them with an iPhone which sucks but it‚Äôs all I have. No custom features, just expensive wired earbuds that happen to be wireless. The Bluetooth reach is bad, and sometimes disconnects. My first wireless earbuds, so I rate these :Okay

I love the ease of access, the fit in the ear. The ease of operations, the small size of the case, and it's ability to stay in the ear. The charging feature of the case is out standings. These are perfect for me.

These earbuds have done me well in the past 3ish days. I've used them till they've been drained and the 11 hour play time isn't a joke, these earbuds will last you an entire work / school day with no issues.
Sound better than airpod pros! Sound isolation is great even without ANC and transparency mode works amazing. Highly recommend these over airpod pros
Best pairing process, nice sound quality, the battery does not drain quickly when they are in the box like previous generation. This is the first time Samsung made a decent headphones.

They're decent as far as ear buds but, after about a month of use, I went to sleep with my left bud on my dresser and it died. The next day it stopped working even after charging for 24 hours. So for the price of basically $150.00 you get tinny mono sounding ear buds which have great tech inputs, but even using the app + choosing dynamic equalizer, these are still like 15-25 sounding ear buds. These earbuds are preset to prioritize: 1. Treble -> 2. Bass -> 3. Mids (instrumentals).The treble is quite nice, the voices are very distinct, but the bass is a bit muted, and has no feeling or soul to it - and then the mids - wow. It doesn't even exist! It's very very drowned out.

The reason i bought these when they first were released was due to two important factors for me. 1. the ability to use the left or the right earbud independantly. 2 was the ability to have two devices connected at the same time. My computer and my phone connected without needing to disconnect from the other when using. There have been reviews where people have said this is possible. Well after getting these buds, setting the up and trying them out..I have to say THAT IS NOT THE CASE AT ALL. sure you can pair them with two devices but you they will disconnect from one while using the other. I can not listen to music on my computer and have the ability to receive a phone call and talk through the buds without disconnecting from the computer. FAIL..my Jabra Elite 65T can do that. the other issue with these which is the reason i'm returning them is when i put on Ambient sound I get a horrible ringing and buzzing in each ear. when I tun it off, they sound great. Again, my Jabra Elite 65t have a great ambient sound feature that just works. If Jabra would update these to be able to use the left or the right alone..they would be perfect. I'm hoping I got a bad pair of buds, i'm going to try one more pair.

I will preface by saying that I have been in the market for some 'Truly Wireless' Earbuds for the past few months.I went through the Jabra Elite 75t, to the Jaybird Vista to these. I received the Galaxy buds+ today and I connected them to my iPhone XS Max. So far my experience with these buds are great! Connecting them was simple thanks to the galaxy buds+ app. Glad it could be installed on my iPhone. I do like AirPods other than them falling out of my ears from time to time. I bought a pair in May and they broke not even two months later. They never went anywhere near water and were used exclusively for music during exercise and everyday music. I am a UPS driver and used this product for a month and a half before I started having problems. Left one would not charge properly and right one at full volume could barely be heard. I contacted Amazon and they said it was outside of allotted time to return the product.When I contacted SAMSUNG they told me it was covered under warranty and I shipped it to them for free.

I bike everywhere. I bought these earbuds specifically because they offered Ambient mode, so I could hear traffic. It turns out, the Ambient mode kind of sucks. Essentially, it puts you on a skype call with the outside world: speech is understandable, but it amps up certain frequencies (footsteps, car tires, and air conditioners are all super loud) while leaving others alone. I should have seen this coming, but I thought with 3 mics and an equalizer they could do better than they've done. On top of that, the microphones get overwhelmed with wind noise at anything above 10mph, and you get constant crackling. Between these issues, Ambient mode is totally useless when biking.Fortunately, these earbuds have a second feature that kept me from returning them: You can use either earbud, independently, and it works *really well*. Not only can you switch from left-only, to both, to right-only, while playing music, without dropping any audio or so much as skipping a beat... when you put one of the earbuds back in the case and close it, it automatically plays both channels out of the remaining earbud. You can try this yourself by playing a song with distinct left and right channels. I recommend Such Great Heights by The Postal Service: the intro beeps alternate between left and right ears, it sounds super wrong if you're just listening to one ear normally. Try it with both earbuds in, then take one out, notice that you're missing half the beeps. Put that earbud back in the case and close it, and the missing channel will get added back into the remaining earbud. This is *amazing*, and a really difficult thing to do technically, I'm very impressed.

When I first put the Buds in, they sounded rather tinny, like the cheap headphones the iPod used to come with.  But then I discovered a few things that helped make them sound really fantastic.First of all, make sure you're using the correct size ear piece.  If it's too small, sound will leak past and it'll sound much less than awesome.  The Buds come with the medium-size ear pieces installed.  Those were adequate to keep them in place, but switching to the large ones really helped seal off outside noise and improve the sound quality.
Summary: not worth the hype. Instead, buy Sennheiser Momentum earbuds. You won‚Äôt look back.I tested Apple AirPods vs Samsung Buds+ (2020) vs Sennheiser Momentum.

I have experimented with all of the included ear pieces and finally found the one that actually sounded the best.  However, it is very uncomfortable to wear for any longer than 10-15 minutes.  My ears start to hurt.  This is my first pair of out of the box earbuds.  I own a pair of custom Ultimate Ears earbuds for music.  I can have them in all day and they are fine, but then again, they were molded to my ears.  These are very painful.  I have tried just about every combination, but in order to get one that does not hurt, there are no mids or bass.  Very difficult to hear people talk on the phone unless I am using the largest buds.  Those are the only ones that will seal them off.  When they are sealed, the sound is only ok, nothing to write home about.  The battery life so far has been incredible and I love how they just start charging when you place them in the case.  The other nice thing is the fact that when they do die, you can give them a really quick charge.  I am on my phone almost all day and will be using these for backup only.  I will be going back to my plantronics headset that I can wear all day long and not even know it is there.

ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I desperately wanted to love these earbuds, after all they've gotten pretty stellar reviews.The case feels solid, has a nice snap whenever you close it, the synching is pretty easy. The buds themselves fit perfectly in my ear out of the box. The controls were simple and intuitive enough.

I was so excited to hear that the new buds would multi device (which was a main feature for me). Sound and all that is good. I live by the ambient sound feature. The app that controls there buds is awesome. battery life exactly what i needed. I have a note 9 so the connection is seamless all you have to do is open the case and it does everything. Controls are almost fluid (still have to get volume to work more frequently)Now onto Samsung's half truth. Multi device was was not stated clearly by Samsung. It does have it but only works with other Samsungs tablets. I Don't think it works with their laptops which is a shame.

They're quite good, especially compared to the Apple Airpod 2's. Most reviews on YouTube compare these headphones to the Airpod Pro's, which is unfair, because the Airpod Pro's are $100 dollars more, and not meant to compete with one another really. For me, the swappable rubber tips and wings of the Air bud+ headphones are superior to others I've tried, these headphones fit extremely well into my ears, and give me a great seal. They stay in even better than standard wired earbuds like Beats and other brands, which I own as well. I can even chew food while wearing these without losing a seal. Having AKG tune these was a smart move by Samsung, the headphones have a studio quality to them and are very clear. Their soundstage is upfront, and bass is delivered in a manner that is true to most recording types. I have seen reviews that claim these are not bass-heavy headphones, and they're not, but don't believe anyone who tells you that bass is lacking. They have more bass than what I was led to believe after watching a dozen YouTube reviews. Battery life is industry leading, and I have never come close to running out, even after wearing them all day at work. The capacitive touch feature works really well, and you will never fumble around looking for a button on these, being that there's no physical buttons that must be pushed in, you won't be readjusting your headphones from having to mash them into your ears like on the Jabra's after a button press. The only critique I could mention with these headphones is that I wish they were even louder. I normally listen to music at a level that is borderline unsafe, and most wired headphones will give me that. Wireless bluetooth headphones on the other hand have to balance battery life and longevity with all of their features, so most won't play at the blistering levels that I prefer. Really though, I am stoked that I bought these headphones, I don't always make a satisfying choice when I purchase electronics, but I feel 100% with these. The Android and iPhone apps are really well done also.

Currently own 1st gen AirPods paired with iPhone X and multiple MBPs.With all the remote working, the old AirPods just didn't have enough battery life (less than an hour when using it for calls).  After trying out Jabra Elite 75t and Apple AirPods Pro, i settled on the Galaxy Ear Buds Plus.

Many positive reviews are confusing - maybe I just got a lemon1. They worked for about 9 hours of playing after which the right ear bud volume became very low. I tried resetting a couple times and other troubleshooting tips. No help.

I loved the quality of the sound from these buds.  I doubt you will find better and they likely rival many wired earphones.  They fit well, feel comfortable and all of the features work great.My only problem and one that may make me return them is the latency when watching tv.  I expect it is hard to find worse latency.  Using the same setup, these thing are clearly awful and make using them for tv impossible unless you pay no attention to the lip sync.  Using a cheap pair of older Taotronics BT earbuds, my same setup is spot on but with these, its just no go.

Good design, great features, ambient sound in particular.  Sound was good, but not as great Soundcore Liberty 2 Pro.1. Soundcore Liberty 2 Pro sound is richer with deep base. Galaxy Buds+ sound is pretty good. Average consumer will be plenty satisfied.

Used the Galaxy Buds+ for two weeks. They were my first pair of true wireless earbuds. I loved so much about them, but I couldn't shake the feeling I just wasn't getting my $150 worth. I did some research, returned the Buds+ and purchased the MPOW M20 for another perspective. Here are my takeaways:Galaxy Buds+ - Pros:

I bought them because I wanted to call my elderly mom, who's several states away, a couple of times a week during my commute to work.  The A/C in my car is marginal, so I drive with the windows down.  It was either a dedicated Bluetooth headset for calling at about the same price (but that's a one-trick pony) or these because of the zillion reviews I'd read or watched, these averaged more good phone call reviews than anything else anywhere near this price point.Before I tried calling the first time, I had a chance to check out the sound quality, music-wise.  I was disappointed.  I have them paired with a Note 8 and although I expected a little quality loss just due to them being wireless, still, it wasn't what I'd hoped for at $150.  I was seriously considering boxing them back up.  Then I remembered I should probably try adjusting the audio settings through my phone with them on.  BIG difference.

Hey ya'll....so here's my quick review.  I started with the Jaybird Vistas....LOVED them, but they're built to be in-destructible and lack a lot of features that are now available on most wireless headphones.  Plus, the buttons are kinda tricky to press.  I started with a black pair of Buds Plus, but they overheated a couple times when i was hiking so i opted for the white pair (less sun absorption, etc).  Had the white pair for a while and love them, honestly no issues at all.  They stay connected when i walk around OUTSIDE my house doing yard work, they cut out sometimes if i get really far away.  Customizing the buttons is essential, the touch sensitivity of the buttons is pretty spot on.  The tapping outside of your ear for volume up and down opens up the door for these headphones to literally have a button for everything!  Charging cause is super slim, USB C and wireless charging...awesome.  They are super light, you don't even know you're wearing them.  Ambient noise option is perfect for hiking so i can hear someone behind me or if i'm walking down the street, i can hear a car.  The ONLY thing that blew my mind with these headphones....is you CANNOT TURN THEM OFF!  They have to be IN the case and the case HAS to be closed before they turn off and disconnect from your phone.  That took some getting used to...i feel like this is kinda dumb as maybe i don't want to charge my headphones EVERY single time i pull them out of my ears?  Just odd.  Anyways, overall love the headphones!!  Great price for what you get, a lot of the other headphones out there have some short comings or you sacrifice connection quality or sound control, these you get it all!  Thanks!

Decided to buy Galaxy Buds + after having used cheaper $20 Anker wireless buds for 2 years.  I have an iPhone but did not like the style/cost/color of the new Airpods, so was looking for a good alternative.  Various articles said that the Galaxy Buds + worked in the iOS system perfectly, but when I received the Buds, I quickly found that it works fine in iOS via the bluetooth connection, but you can't access any of the advanced features (ambient noise, equalizer, setup, etc) without installing the app.NOTE:  The app does not work AT ALL with iPhone 6s or below.  It checks your phone hardware, and even with the correct iOS version, it just flat out refused to run on the device.  Further, Samsung doesn't say this but it didn't work on my first-gen iPad Pro either.  Same thing - absolute refusal to run even with iOS 13.6.1 (requires 10+).  I didn't have a device that could set up the headphones, leaving me with a basic bluetooth device.  Samsung unapologetically offers no alternative way to access the basic functions of the equipment.

I bought these mostly for use with my Galaxy J7.  They pair quickly with this phone, Samsung app unnecessary (and leaks data per reviews). Charge level shows in Bluetooth connect screen.  Good sound and dynamic range when playing popular music, exceptionally clear mic.They are very good to wear, even if I shake my head they do not move.  As other reviewers have pointed out, the charging case has no latch.  Not a problem if you have it in your pocket, but you should not put directly in bag or briefcase and expect case to stay closed.

These are great ear buds, but there are some substantial caveats.First, these overheat and will beep at you incessantly. After only 10 minutes outside on a hot day I got the beeping and it would not go away until I went inside.

So I just received the Samsung Buds +, right out of the box, they required a charge which went quick.  I'm happy about that.  I did purchase the Airpod Pros and I really didn't like the fact they didn't stay in my ear.  I tried all 3 sizes and none had a good fit.  These Buds+ right out of the box fit great, I think it has something to do with the wing that secures the bud in the ear and are very comfortable.The app for the iPhone works very well.  I understand if you have the original Samsung Buds, the app will not work.  There was an update waiting for me as soon as it connected.
These SUCK.  there is ABSOLUTELY ZERO bass

I really wanted to like these buds.  I did research and decided on these because they were top rated for their phone call quality which would be my primary use, during the working from home period beginning in March.Let's look at each feature that has affected my review

I use uncompressed files for music.  The audio on this set is horrible. No bass and weak thin mids with the highest frequencies almost twice as loud. The volume has to be way up in the red to listen at average volume and starts distorting even at low volume. Using Poweramp app helped level the sound out by lowering the high frequencies as they start to hurt your eardrums very quickly.  Any attempt to bring the bass or mids in caused instant distortion. They simply can only carry high frequencies and not any reasonable volume level. There is high levels of noise sometimes as if the volume level is up high but with low output from the audio track.  I was severely disappointed and find the $5 drug store earphones much better for music though these have better treble. Through the noise,high distortion and low levels, music is immediately unpleasant. The ambient noise feature works well but I was able to use an app for that on standard headphones anyway. I'm awaiting feedback from others regarding call experience when talking to me.

For $150 and being made by Samsung, I would've assumed the audio would be tolerable to say the least. These sound barely better than the Samsung buds I got with my S10 lmao. I never liked earbuds because the audio was always bad and fell out, but still. These don't fall out but the audio is not worth the $150 price tag. I'll stick to my headphones or eventually try a more expensive model from Sony/Sennheiser/etc.

The infamous sony wireless earbuds, which everyone raves over, do sound better than these, and the Apple AirPods Pro Sound significantly worse than these.Buds+ are a solid buy for Apple and Android users, and I use mine for both. The huge advantages they have over other headphones is the quality of the ambient sound feature, the two driver design gives them far more range than Apple Pros, the case is 1/10 the size of the Sony case, and the buds last longer than the Sonys.

I run 100 miles per week. I needed something sturdy that doesn't fall out, can survive sweat, has ambience noise for safety, has good sound quality and can make clear calls. This does it all and more. I run in the hot texas summer heat and sweat like no one's business and these little guys don't slip out at all with the right adjustment in the ear piece and wing tip. There have been several updates since I purchased these and the ambient noise function has been significantly improved. I was hearing a lot of wind before, but now it is minimal enough to the point that my mind can zone out the rest. As for call quality, I like to chat on the phone with friends and family while running and so far nobody has complained. Of course they can tell I'm outside doing something like running but we don't have issues with communication. The last thing I'll say is the battery is CRAZY! I run about 14-16 hours a week. If I forget to charge throughout the week it's not even an issue as I'll still have plenty of charge to last the next week over. That is insane. I plan to use these in some ultramarathons where I'll be out there 12-24 hours continuously.

These are waaayyy better than the previous models (Galaxy Buds 1)....the ambience is nice...I can hear people talking while music is playing...as long as the music's not too loud, you can converse with people around you...and I can hear people about 15ft away from me in a different room talking...can't understand what they're exactly saying but, I know there are people in the other room talking...pretty cool....you can still hear yourself as a muffled internal voice, but you can also hear what you are saying via the extra mic they put in this model of Bud+...pretty cool....I gave my AirPods PRo to the wife, she's on the iPhone and I moved to the Note 10+. Overall, very happy with this purchase....easily worth 150$!! They're the same build as previous, nothing changed physically, however, the touch pad is more pearl like finish. The life of the battery is what ultimately sold me on these as they're supposed to have 11 hrs of use...I haven't got that far with them cause I only received them today....

I had the original buds and the only weakness it had was its poor call quality. It had a good sound and were very comfortable to wear for very long periods of time.The new buds + fixes the 1 complaint I had with the original buds while improving the ambient sound feature drastically. Ambient sound was just OK before but now it sounds great and natural depending on the level you set it to. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because I prefer the sound of the original buds over the buds +. The bass response was better with the old buds in my opinion but I'd still recommend these over the originals.

First of all, I had a different, much cheaper brand of wireless earbuds before this. The sound was good, but they didn't have nearly the features of these Galaxy Buds +. When they stopped working, my search began for a decent priced pair of earbuds that would be awesome for me, and these fit the bill! I was slightly hesitant seeing that they only have an IPX2 rating. I love to listen to my earbuds mostly when I workout, so worrying about sweat was something that made me push off my purchase of these for a while. I finally decided to just go for it, and I'm so glad I did! Here's what you need to know.. these are pretty great. They have a warranty and also you can purchase an extended warranty through Amazon. I absolutely purchased the warranty because these were not cheap, and I'd like to protect them as long as I can before a new version comes out maybe. When you get the buds, they come in a small box. Nothing extra fancy, and very basic looking. I didn't mind this at all! You get a small cardboard insert with your various ear tips and wings, along with a short charging cord. When you connect these to your phone, (i have a galaxy s9) the connection was easy and flawless! The galaxy wearable app shows you all different settings and the amount of battery life your buds have. I loved playing with the ambient sound, It was amazing what I could hear through these things even with music playing! The ambient sound even at its loudest will still be difficult to hear someone talking or whatever if your music is up fairly loud. Still an awesome feature to have! You have different things the buds do when you tap them a certain number of times, and you can set it up where a triple tap or holding the button does something different of your choice. Like, open your virtual assistant. The sound quality of these is great. I prefer to listen in dynamic mode, via the in-app equalizer. None of the sounds are flat or falling through, you get a really rich, great sound with these! One of my favorite things about these versus my old earbuds is, for example,  when you double-tap the right bud, it skips to the next song. You hear two small beeps, but you don't hear a voice saying "forward " every time! I love this aspect! It was getting old hearing voice feedback every time i did anything on the old buds.  Overall,  these are excellent bang for your buck! I have had no issues with sweat getting in them and hurting them,  and I workout 4 times a week pretty heavy! Just wipe them clean and dry afterwards and good to go! If you're interested in these,  look no further! The whole experience with these has been great so far.  If anything changes I will update this review, but so far I am highly impressed!

So I was excited to upgrade from my Galaxy Buds to the new Galaxy Buds+ today. The extra battery kife, 11 hours, meant I could wear the buds longer each day. And the improved sound is anazing.But there is a feature that has not been touted yet and I think it makes these Buds+ number 1. It's the ambient noise feature. It includes options to increase ambient noise volume and I love it. I have a hearing loss issue and could use hearing aids. But these buds+ actually allow me to hear much better without expensive hearing aids.
Brand new out of the box, charged for 1 hour, left bud connects (Galaxy Note 10+), right bud does not.Forgot them on bluetooth, forgot them in app, uninstall all, reinstall app - same thing.

Either the abundant amount of excellent reviews is suspect or everybody has very poor taste in audio quality.  If you understand audio you'll know what I mean when I say they sound out of phase. No matter what EQ mode you put them in its awful.  Horrible second rate EQ settings as well.  The mids and highs are VERY fatiguing, brittle, shrill.  The bass is lacking even with a good fit.  They sound like a dollar store set of wired headphones.  Not impressed at all.I fought with one of the buds for a number of hours.  It refused to charge or respond at all.  I don't know what happened but it eventually began charging. They seem to behave a little better than the latest Apple products which isn't saying much.  The current iteration of bluetooth for two separate devices that pair isn't reliable at all.

I use them everyday with my iPhone. Much more than I ever thought.I like the battery life, sound quality is good but don't except it to be good as wired headphones.  They get loud, but sometimes I wish they were a bit louder.

I'm a huge samsung guy. I have a samsung phone, samsung laptop,  samsung tv. The brand has never failed me. These headphones are really good. Sound is great. Nice features. Price is a little high then what I'm used to paying for other headphones  but I guess its becuase it name brand and really isent far off from similar name brand earbuds. The ambient sound feature is nice as well but I noticed when I turned that on when I run I hear lots of wind that the microphone catches. So I had to turn it off then it was fine. After I was done I turned it back on and it was kinda cool I dident have to take off my earbuds to talk to people. The samsung wear app let's you change alot more settings then I'm used to so that's a convient feature. The battery is a great bonus to. 11 hour off one charge and 11 more with the carrying case. Bottom line I'm very happy with them. Great sound, battery life and the look and feel are great!

I bought these after doing a good bit of online research comparing them to Airpods Pro and others but am utterly underwhelmed by the actual product. So much so that I actually prefer my $30 bluetooth ear pods over these.Battery life: The battery life is advertised as 11 hours but with the pair I got, what I found is that they lose charge by the end of the day (probably in about 11 hours) with or without use. So you have to charge them every day for them to work. My cheap ear buds have to be charged only once every few days.
Let me start by saying I have I am a fan of android.Most of my phones since the beginning of smartphone era has been andoird, and specifically SAMSUNG!

These earbuds are fantastic. I reccomend using the dynamic setting on the app. The bass setting loses way too much of the high end. AKG who makes these is a brilliant German company who makes a fine product. If you have a newer Samsung phone the earbus that came with it are AKG, but are there cheapest available which you can purchase foe under $20 and are pretty weak, so don't exrect anything like that because you get every bit of what you pay for. The touch pads are also very nice. The build quality is great. Charging is quick and convenient with a wireless QI pad. I also bought a the case cover that has the chrome trim and a keychain clip which I attach to my belt loop and can still put the case in my pocket knowing I will now lose them. The QI pad charges through the added case. I have had other brands and these are the best wireless I have had.

I gave this Samsung earbud a 5, because it is a good example of a quality product for what it is. Keep in mind, that it doesn't have the sound quality of my floor-standing Infinity speakers - nor should it. It's a wireless earbud. But, for a set of tiny speakers, the sound is pretty darn good. I use them when I ride my bike on an indoor trainer, for motivational music. I've transferred my entire digital music collection to my Samsung Galaxy S8 phone, which has a 256G memory card. Over time, I've tried several sets of wired earbuds, which didn't work for me. My knee hit the wire to the phone, and the earbuds kept falling out, particularly when eating an energy bar during the ride. Not surprisingly, these earbuds paired up very easily with my Samsung phone, using an Android app. The app gives a wide range of features, including an equalizer (which I tested on Jefferson Airplane's "3/5 of a Mile in 10 Seconds and Nico's "Femme Fatale." Normal worked better on the former, dynamic on the latter). Best of all, they stayed in my ears, comfortably, even when eating (though they amplified the bone sensation of chewing). There are three ambient sound settings. Full ambience is too wide open for me, and no ambience really restricts outside sound. The medium setting allows me to hear my insulin pump tell me to eat, and I can hear my pedal cadence. I received a robocall during my ride this morning, and the sound quality was good - I disconnected via the phone. While preparing for my ride, I found that the Bluetooth pairing was effective for a couple of hundred feet, and beyond that, the signal broke up; since I only use the buds while riding, that's not a problem. Overall, I'm very pleased with this purchase.

I have been waiting for this earbuds' price to come down and Amazon recently had a special on this with the Samsung wireless charger included free. So I jumped at the opportunity and purchased it.SOUND QUALITY. It's not the best compared to an over-the-ear headphone like the Sony WH-100XM3 but it is decent. If you like a heavy lows/bass, this is not for you. The lows are subtle and not over powering even when you select the preadjusted EQ (Bass Boost from the Samsung Galaxy Wearable App that you download from Google Play). It seems all the PREADJUSTED EQ from the app (Normal, Bass Boost, Soft, Dynamic, Clear, Treble Boost) are all subtly adjusted with very minute differences from each other. The good news is that you can customize the EQ to your liking using your mobile's system audio EQ (specially if you have a Samsung Galaxy) or a third party EQ app.  The overall volume level is a little too low. At 70% volume (recommended listening levels by manufacturers), it is a bit low compared to other earbuds/headphones. However, you can also adjust and add extra volume to it using the Galaxy Wearable app.

i am so happy i upgraded to the new version from the regular buds.the battery life is nice and i use them all day every day one ear at a time. however that is not a reason to upgrade nor is the possible sound upgrade. the only reason to do it is if you want to use it for calls. the older version is all but the same thing other then this. i could not use it for calls at all. no one could hear me at all. it was useless for calls and very much a pain in the ass. the new version works perfectly as a call head set and gets about 2 hours more play time.
:Update:After sending it to Samsung for warranty repair they told me the buds were out of warranty because of the 'damage' they had.

Disclaimer, I have only been using these a few weeks. I will update as needed 06/15/2020These have been fantastic. Got tired of the cheaper ones konking out on me, so I decided to splurge a little on something pricey, and I would gladly buy these again. I'm no audiophile, so most I can say on that is they're great quality sound for me, but the real value is the ambient sound function. I have to carry a radio at work, so I used to have to do the one earbud thing,  uncomfortable and easy to lose track of where a sound came from. These earbuds you can set to pickup sounds around you and balance it with your music/audiobook,  allowing you to hear the rest of the world clearly without having to take them out. It takes some getting used to, but it's fantastic.

I've usually avoid Bluetooth as it usually sounds terrible.  These earbuds sound great however and I love the feature where I can hear some ambient noise.However the bluetooth connectivity of these is pretty horrible, and it seems to happen whenever I turn my head to the right. My cheapo headset, while sounding bad, has WAY better connectivity and never cuts out.

Samsung is an innovator and is one of the few companies that continues to be a top technology beast.  I own more Samsung devices than any other products from the other manufacturers. I may have put the bar too high when it came to the buds plus and am admited audiophile.  But I also know this company is up to the challenge. Whith all that said here are my pro's and cons concerning this highly coveted and quite frankly very good pair of wireless ear buds.Pro's:

I'm very happy with nearly every aspect of these buds, but after 1.5 months of use one bud became nearly silent.I've researched this problem and found a fair number of other people have experienced the same thing.  I have tried all the solutions I've read about, short of opening up the bud.  The bud appears to receive charge....if I 'use' it along with the other bud, charge% does go down as reflected in the phone app.  I can then charge the bud (by itself to make sure), and the charge light stays red for an appropriate amount of time.  I've thoroughly inspected the bud for clogs in the speaker, and cleaned the bud anyway, but found no problem there.  I will probably send these in for warranty service.

My initial impression is that I'm blown away! The original galaxy buds were wonderful but the buds+ are a massive improvement. Here is a list of improvements I felt are notable-Sound quality is incredible. Crystal clear seperation of sounds with balanced bass. The wearable app has preset settings to fit your taste as well.

These are cute. These fall out of my ears. I lost one of the for about 3 months. That was irritating as only 1 ear bud lasts a good 4 hours at work due to battery life. So I didnt get to listen to a book or music for most of my day at work with 1 ear bud. Moving on, when windy or jogging outside the wind is irritating because it interrupts whatever is coming thru my microphone. Maybe there is a setting I'm not aware of. Also since this is my 1st summer with these I've noticed they over heat quickly.  They beep in my ear. So if you want to do yard work or walk around an amusement park on a hot day forget about it. I'm so sorry about this review because the sound is amazing. The base is out of this world. I feel like I'm in a club. Maybe there are settings for some of the minor things that I'm not aware of and wouldn't mind someone letting me know. As far as heating up, that a thumbs down!

First, the bad... I hope this was just a one time issue but I got a very loud buzzing sound in the left bud that hurt my ear. I had to power it down and reset it to make it stop. So far it hasnt happened again. Ive only used them 3 times so far. I also am a bit iffy about there not being a latch to close the case. The last version had a button to press to open them. So I do worry they will come open in my bag.The good... I love Galazy buds, and these are great. The improvements are clear as soon as you put them on. The way they fit better and actually stay in my ear unlike the last version.  The connection to my phone ,firetv or playstation is great & quick. The last version I had to constantly re-pair them. They also pair very easily, just open the lid and done.  All the settings are done through your phone or Samsung tablet. So you will need to do that before using them with anything because the volume is low by default. Also you can reset the bud touchpad for volume control. Imo is much better than the previous version where everytime I put them in my ears it played all factiry tracks which was so annoying.  They also dont turn off or pause when I turn my head like the previous version did.  Last but not least,  I love the blue color!

I didnt think I needed a BT headset but thats because I didnt have a pair.  These are excellent.  As soon as I got them out of the package I started testing their capabilities.First test was phone calls.  I found the call quality to be almost perfect.  Both ends of the call were very clear but when I tested the range the call got echoey at about 25-30 ft when maintaining line of sight to the phone.  Going around corners the call got echoey.  I went for a little walk and I didnt have any issues with the connection at all.  Outside noise is blocked out well and  I can turn on the ambient noise feature to hear the outside world if I want.  This feature works very well and has adjustable levels using the app.

I just upgraded to these from the first generation of Samsung Galaxy wireless earbuds. I recieved them on time and in good condition. I think the sound quality is well balanced and Samsung gives you six options with their preset Equalizer which includes a Bass Boost setting, Normal, Clear Voice, Dynamic, Normal, Soft, and Treble Boost. Do they sound like a set of kickers thumping no, but they are well balanced and sound great. The biggest problem with the 1st gen. was the microphone picked up too much background noise and people had a hard time hearing you if you were on a busy side walk, wind, or noisy car, so far it seems like Samsung was able to improve the microphone with noise cancelation. If that changes over the next couple weeks I will update my review, but so far so good. The other problem with the first generation was a update that was sent out for the Samsung app. after downloading it caused my earbuds to register as two separate devices and I could only use one bud at a time. Samsung did ask me to send them back so they could fix or replace them, but I had bought a different brand and was waiting on the new version to come out, so I never sent them back, but I will say Samsung stands behind their products and customer service is above average.

I've been searching for quality earbuds with all of the features I want and I've finally found them in the Galaxy Buds+. I poured over page after page of wireless earbuds on Amazon, reading specs and watching Youtube video reviews. I was about to purchase the Mifo 07 earbuds when my woman told me about the Galaxy Buds+ that just came out so I decided to check it out. Although I preferred the look of the Mifo 07 and its compactness, the Galaxy Buds+ won me over with its single charge battery life and ambient mode. I like the fact that you can customize what the touchpad does in the Galaxy Wear app. It also has different EQ options. The buds will also start the music when you put them in your ear and pause when you take them out. A feature I didn't know about. They also have seamless switching from single to dual buds with no music interruption which is another feature I was looking for. The "find my earbuds" feature is a nice touch and something I haven't seen with other earbuds. You activate it from the app and the earbuds will chirp like a baby bird so you can find them. lol Oh and they also sound great with the 2-way speakers. I have my volume controls set to double tap on the earbud edge which frees up the center touchpad for other functions. The only thing I don't like is how slippery they are. You kind of have to fumble around to dig them out of your ears. lol Not a deal breaker though. Overall, I'm very happy with them.
Ended up giving away my Jabra 65ts to a friend who lost her (third, el oh el) pair of truly wireless earbuds. Bought these not expecting a straight upgrade, but here we go:*Advantages*

I've used inexpensive bluetooth earbuds for a long time and never paid more than $30.  I typically go through a pair every 2-3 years due to drops and other abuse.  For me, the most important feature is reliable control via a tap of the ear.  I absolutely have no sense of control with these earbuds and I have to constantly adjust their fit which means I never know when I'm accidently hitting a control "touch point".  Even worse, after turning off the touch feature due to engaging random controls the buds will still accidently hang-up if I adjust the bud to my ear.That's not ok.  Sound quality was just "meh" while noise cancellation was really good.  That said, my last straw was the battery life.  The charging case seems to discharge even when the buds are out of the case.  When I pay a premium price for a product I expect premium performance.  I do not get that with the Samsung Buds Plus.  Fortunately I am within 1 day of my return period and am able to get my money back.

I love that they just fit and work! I don't have to try to twist them around in my ears to get a good fit, change the fittings, or troubleshoot Bluetooth. They just fit easily, work well, and pair with my phone (Moto G6) easily. I have used them mostly for hour long business phone calls, hiking, and listening to workout music while I workout. I can do planks, pushups, side planks, and they don't fall out. I bought a cheaper version of these types of earbuds, different brand, just to try out the style, 6 months ago. They were about half the price of these and just wouldn't stay in my ears. II ended up getting rid of them and trying these.  This might be the case where you get what you pay for.  I wish I'd bought these originally, but I didn't know if I'd actually like them, but I really do.  I also like wearing one while I'm riding my bike around town for music, no cord to get caught anywhere.  I'm very grateful for a quality, non airpod option.  I only gave them 4 stars because I want to test using them to record myself teaching a fitness class. Once I give that final test, I'll see if they earn the last star and will update here accordingly.

If I were to describe these headphones using the full spectrum of the colorful language of my people, amazon would never publish my review so I‚Äôll settle for trying to express myself without using any foul language.These things are (expletive typically used to describe fornication however also used to express strong feeling or excitement; in this case excitement) AMAZING! I loved my old headphones and recommend them to everyone, but they are absolute (excrement) compared to these beautiful (male children of female canines) the sound quality not just when listening but also on calls is (fornicating) incredible! The ambient sound feature is really what sets these apart, I‚Äôve never had that in a headphone and I love it! When listening to music, you can block out all other sounds but when the music is off, even with the headphones still in you can hear the clunk of ant (excrement) from across the room! The shipping was incredibly fast too. We are in the middle of the (deity cursed, maternal figure fornicating) covid crisis and they still shipped these to me in less than 36 hours. (Fornicating) incredible! Great job everyone at Samsung. I wish I could buy all you beautiful (children of female canines) a beer!

I skipped the first generation Galaxy Buds but was most impressed by the battery life and external audio pass-through on the Plus model compared to my previous set of wireless earbuds. Audio quality is nothing to write home about but nothing to complain about either out for the price, that being said slapping the AKG branding on these doesn't do much. Wireless charging case is nice and the C type port moves me one step further to ditching my last micro USB cables.My one real complaint is how useless the touch controls are, they are both overly sensitive and difficult to use properly. Samsung's app does give you the option of "locking" the functions but this does not disable the volume controls which are located at the top of each earbud. This is a problem as errant brushes on your hand(such as when adjusting the straps of a mask in this era) can cause you to accidentally change the volume but worse is when running where the jostling of the buds causes the top of one's ear to come in contact and raise or lower the volume randomly.

I liked the buds OK while they worked, but they aren't snug enough to call them sport earbuds.  Failing just after the window where they could be returned should be a serious warning for anyone who's considering purchasing them.  I treated them gently, never got them wet or dropped them; but one just failed.  Both show they're fully charged, but the left one is dead.  Buyer beware.

These are my new favorite thing! I have used them with my iPhone X, iPad mini, and MacBook Pro and the transition in Bluetooth connection between them is seamless! I'm never going back to earbuds with wires. I've worked out in these and they don't fall out. The only thing I can think of that some people may not like about these is that it's near impossible to hear the outside world when you have them in. That can be good or bad though. If you don't want ambient noise (like on a plane), it's nice. But if you're say, bicycling, I suggest only putting one in to hear traffic. But overall, the sound quality is fantastic and so is the fit!

I did all my due diligence researching wireless headsets. I needed a set for all my business shifting to video/call conferencing. I don't like Apple products, nor did I want to spend $250+. Lots of online vids and written reviews said these had the better mics (vs pixelbuds, jabras) . So I bought these when they came out, advertised as having multiple mics on each earbud and having great microphone quality. I don't know what happened, but now they are unusable for all calls. This is why I hate buying brand new tech, there are always issues that are lied about in the launch advertising. Search for "buds plus microphone problems" and you'll see what I'm talking about.The product information section from Samsung says: "Your voice, loud and clear. Ensure you‚Äôre heard clearly. A dedicated internal and two external microphones pick up your voice and isolate it from outside noises. When you‚Äôre on a call, your voice comes through richly and confidently, even in noisy locations." THIS IS JUST NOT TRUE!!!

Bought these based on a positive review and am totally disappointed. They sound as tinny as the free wired earbuds my credit union gave away a couple of years ago. Yes, they stay in my ears better than my MUCH better-sounding Airpods, and the sound they produce is very clear, bur if you like a solid bass sound these will not make you happy. I've tried using the equalizer settings in the phone app, and changing the size of the rubber tips, but I can find no way to make a discernible difference in the bass-free sound. Buy them only if you don't care whether you can hear the lower end of the sound spectrum.UPDATE: Apparently I have larger-than-average ear canals; none of the cusions supplied made a tight enough fit, but I was able to find a set of cushions even larger than the largest ones that came with these, and that made an astounding difference. They now sound at least as good as my Airpods Pro, and still stay put in my ears. So I withdraw the previous comment; I knew that getting the right fit was essential, and now that I have it, these sound terrific. My previous "1" rating is now a "5".

Received the unit and it was timely. I set up the app to control the bass/treble. For the price the Buds were clear but there was a lot of treble. The Bass was literally washed out (no matter how hard I tried to regulate with the App.) I had previously bought some cheaper Buds and thought that this would be a Upgrade. The cheap Buds had a much better sound (although the Samsung were very clear.) I sent them back the same day.

These are great! Battery life is all day. I don't listen to much music but I get 0hone calls constantly in my line of work and when I put them back in the case to go to sleep they were at 58 percent after having them in from the moment I woke up. I am impressed.Music sound fine... Not mind blowing bit I'm no audiophile. Calls were clear and not once did anyone ask "what? You sound muffled, I can't hear you." No echo it was great.

When I got my first order , one bud didn't work. Seller quickly sent out a new set. The new set works pretty good. Sound quality is great!!! The different options for fit in the ear is great. They are pretty comfy and as long as u have a good seal, they won't pop out. Battery has been lasting 11-12 hours for me. I use them all day everyday. Battery life is amazing.Best part for me, my wife call me, doing about 60mph on my motorcycle with a 1/2 shell helmet , ears exposed, and she could hear me fine!

The earphones fit well and they do not constantly slip out of my ears like almost every wireless ear buds I've ever had except for the Bose sport. For a second I thought they were not loud enough until I realized I could turn the volume up manually on the earphones feel application and tapping them on the outer edges. Then my eardrums where almost Blown Away with high quality Sound and Bass. First wireless earbuds where I will decline to turn the volume all the way up. YouTube videos do not Give them Justice. Ambient sound improves your hearing better than your normal hearing Considering that the Ambient sound is volume control at three levels. I love hearing my own voice Amplified as I'm singing along with my music. Samsung must have done this purposely. I can also listen to my earphones on Bluetooth and the music on another Bluetooth device such as my car or my JBL Charge 4. And must I add again that they do not slip out of my ears and at one point I could not even feel them in there standing still. However like almost all ear phones that are not memory foam do have pressure points in your ear Exhausted from wearing them for long periods of time.

Gave these headphones a try now TWICE.  Both times there were major problems with the left earbud.  The first time it wouldn't connect at all.  I sent them back one day after getting them and got a replacement pair sent.  2nd pair came and worked for one day.  After that, the left one started not working again.  It would connect just fine but the sound would cut in and out with no rhyme or reason.  Very disappointed considering how expensive these are.  I've only bought $30-40 pairs of wireless buds before now and they all worked better than these.  These also didn't have great noise cancellation for what's supposedly a name brand superior product.  My no name headphones do a better job.  Also, these hurt my ears after wearing for about an hour.  Overall just very disappointed.  This was the first pair of what I would consider expensive headphones I have bought and at this point I can't figure out how they have gotten so many good reviews.  It can't be a coincidence that I had the same problem twice.  It is a defect.  Going to go back to my cheap headphones.

These are amazing! We've now bought 2 since I liked them so much, I got an extra pair for my husband. They fit very well, and don't hurt my ears with continuous wear. They have great sound quality and the battery life is amazing. I also like that they are small and aren't super obvious when you're wearing them. Great for listening to music, talking on the phone, or just watching videos. I would highly recommend these regardless of if you have an iphone or android. The app is easy to use and these are such a great value compared to other similar ear buds that are available on the market.

I don't know about you but I thought I am done trying the airbuds. Except the iPhone related models which I never bothered trying (I am not a fan of iPhone), I tried too many different airbuds and I returned everyone of them until this one. This is the airbud I was always dreaming about and I really can't emphasize my happiness when I started testing it on everything I ever had plan to use these airbuds for. Even the single use like when you choose the wear only one at the time. The level of comfort, the compatibility to function on my Samsung Note, the sound quality, the volume range, the look .... I am happy to the point that it's rare for me to experience.
