Even the shipment was fast,like I got the item about 15 hours after ordering on Amazon app. I didn't even have to change the parts with smaller or bigger size since the one inside the box was already the best fit for my ears. I really can't ask for anything more. If you are an Android user and specially Samsung phones, consider giving it a try.

I was not sure that I was going to like earbuds that just hung on my ear and I didn't. I have been using Wireless earbuds that have a wire between the two earbuds and that works better for me. I did buy a strap so that I would not I have to have these stuck in my ear all the time and I could hang them over my neck like my earlier pairs .I found these to be clunky. Every time I had to move them in my ear I would do something to either change my phone or something. I did not find them easy to use at all.

I know with Bluetooth you can always expect a degraded sound compared to hard wired headphones, but these were worse than normal.  There's a persistent low-volume hiss, and all highs sound shrill with a hint of distortion.  I ran them for 10 hours, just in case there was any break-in difference, but none was heard.  Features are great, they pair really easy (Galaxy S8 and S20) and the ambient function is excellent and impressive.  But, headphones at this price should sound better.  The fit was OK, but I expected them to be more stable in the ear, as they felt like they were always going to fall out, no matter the tip size.  Returned.

I just received these yesterday.  First of all shipping was amazingly FAST!  I wasn't expecting to receive these until today.  They are very easy to connect and when fitted into ear properly they sound amazing!  The bass is incredible.  When I have them in, no one else can hear what I am listening to either.  They stay put nicely.  I will be able to walk and exercise with these in which is one of the main reasons that i purchased them.  I get up at 4 am to exercise and the rest of my house is still sleeping.  I wasn't able to listen to music while exercising before for fear of waking everyone up.  I am very happy with this purchase all around!

Like the previous almost identical version, these have the little backwards ring in addition to the ear insert in two other sizes - I use the largest. Both versions are the first wireless buds I have owned where they didn't try to fall out especially when eating.This made me forgive the lower quality of sound than the Pixel Wireless Buds I had previously.
Pros:Fit is customizable and good

Sound quality is average and disappointing considering they're made by Samsung. They're overpriced for the quality and definitely not loud enough. I feel like I'm wearing kid's earbuds with a sound governor. The noise cancelation, though it isn't listed as an active feature, does in fact work very well. With 8 kids my house can get extremely noisy. With these in I literally can't hear a damn thing! The only reason I can't give these 5 stars is because the left earbud was wisper quiet right out of the box. No amount of setting changes on either my phone's sound or the Galaxy Wearable app solved the issue. I ended up returning them and buying the new bean shaped Galaxy Buds Live, which are awesome, but definitely a personal preference as to the way they're wornThey don't actually go inside the ear canal and can make the cartilage above sore after a while.

I love most everything about these with the exception of the bass being a bit weak compared to my Phaser Fusion One buds, and it could be a bit louder. However, there is a significant problem with the buds not charging when placed into the case with the tips installed. This is true even for the silicone tips that come with these buds, and don't even think about trying it with memory foam tips. Before anybody brings it up, YES, I am placing the buds in the correct spots n the charging case (left bud in left spot, right bud in right spot). When placing the buds in the case with the tips on, the charging light doesn't come on, and the lid won't close without a little extra nudge...and then won't stay completely closed without holding them shut. Sometimes you can see the charging light come on as the lid is sliding over the top of the buds and pushing them down far enough for the charging points on the buds and charger case to connect, but apparently the don't stay connected once the lid is fully closed. And, since the connection is lost once the lid is closed, you won't know that they haven't charged until you open the lid and the app shows the same charge (or slightly lower) as they did when you put them in...even after several hours. Without the tips installed, the connection and charging works flawlessly. Fortunately, the awesome battery life of these allows me to listen to these all day at work with 30-40% left at the end of the day (9 hour days Mon-Thur and 4 hours on Friday). Again, most everything about these buds are great, which is why I will probably keep them and may even consider buying them again in the future.PS: Has anyone else had this same issue, and if so, have you figured out how to make them charge without uninstalling the tips first?

+ Great battery life. I can go days without charging this.+ One of the few earbuds I can find that can tolerate (and charge off of) the same USB-C power supply I use for laptops and my cell phone. (Trying to convert the entire household's devices to one type of power supply!)

The Galaxy Buds+ exceeded my expectations as an upgrade from the model released last year. There is little change in the appearance of the devices but the battery life improvement alone is worth considering a purchase of the Buds+. Nearly doubling from 6 to 11 hours of life without a noticeable change in the size of the buds is a feat and the somewhat small change to display the battery capacity of the case along with the buds in the app is an important improvement.Call quality is also greatly improved on the Buds+ and I was already happy with the original set.

Ok so I just ordered the Apple air pods pro for my birthday 7/11/20 two days later I was back on the market looking for a new set of Bluetooth earphones my original set was the Samsung icon x 1st gen but I couldn‚Äôt use the Samsung app so I really couldn‚Äôt get all the benefits unless I upgraded which I just did. I must say I was in love as soon as I opened the package. Idk if it‚Äôs the color that got me or the size which is smaller then the 1st gen or the combination. They fit perfect just like my old ones they sound great too. Now I have ambient sound I no longer have to pause or take out my earphones the only thing I miss is hey Siri but then again my pros didn‚Äôt do a good job picking up my voice anyways lol but I can still manually touch to ask For assistance. So the pros and Samsung buds sound clear But I love the option of changing the equalizer on the buds. ambient sound is ok but I‚Äôd have to give that to the Apple pros plus the noise cancellation. So if you‚Äôre a Apple user like me looking for a alternative to the Apple earphones These are great for the buck battery life Is by far more better then 4.5 hrs you get with Apple. They Also don‚Äôt fall out or push out your ear. I definitely feel like I can work out in these

If you're on the fence about buying these...jump. I did research for months trying to decide between the buds and the buds+. I tried the music quality first and the sound was amazing. The app makes it so you can choose your perfect sound.Next the CALL QUALITY is the best I've ever had on wireless earphones. I am always disappointed but with these I could hear my call clearly and I didn't have to yell for the person on the other end to hear me. I could use my regular inside voice and I talk pretty low.

I've had them for a week and I'm thrilled with how they sound! Battery life is excellent, I've only made a few calls but the sound quality is great and the fit and feel in ear is solid.Music wise, vs the only other ear buds I've had which were Amazon recommend 50.00 ones, it's not even comparable. The base is is quite present with out causing any distortion or lack of quality of mid and high ranges.

The Apple-style buds did not stay in my ears, so I wanted something that would, with good sound, and reasonably discreet. The Samsung Galaxy Buds+ met all those criteria. They stay in, even while exercising, sound clear, shut out the outside noises really well, and look pretty good -- it's actually nice to have something different that the "cigarette-in-the-ear" look of the Apple devices. Complaints: The bass is very underwhelming, even with "bass boost" mode turned on (bass boost is really more of a "treble suppress" mode). Also, there's a mode that lets in ambient sounds (to allow easier talking to others, for example); however, that mode amplifies and distorts the outside sounds too much, and is very annoying -- I tried it a couple times, and haven't used it since.Overall, great purchase. (And they only cost a little over half the price of the Apple buds!)

Love them, except for some close-range connectivity issues. Not sure if this problem is specific to me or not or has something to do with nearby Bluetooth and wireless devices (like wireless routers). I regret not getting the insurance on these guys.The fit is great even with my sensitive ears. And with the extra fittings it's easy to get a customized fit. The sound quality is better than I expected and call quality is excellent. We can hear each other perfectly clear. I love the ambient sound mode; I can listen to music at work (kinda loud) and still hear things around me, especially when you activate the labs feature and turn on the extra high ambient sound. Things sound a little tinny but it's no bother, really. I like the app, as you can play around with the settings and even find your earbuds. I will definitely be looking forward to future versions of them

I purchased these ear buds to replace a pair I lost. I have a Samsung phone so thought this would be a great options. The ear buds are very light and the pairing process was very easy. I did feel like they didn't fit to my ear great, but this may have been resolved if I changed the size of the rubber earbuds. The reason I returned the earbuds is that the sound quality was not very good. When I was talking on the phone the sound of the person on the the other line would get softer and louder randomly. This was really frustrating and I felt that for the price of the ear buds this shouldn't be happening. I would not recommend these is you will be using them for phone calls, which is what I was looking to do.

Maybe I was being too optimistic buying these, but the digital artifacts when playing music are EXTREMELY BAD.Little high pitched tinny distortion noises coming through (and that's when streaming at the highest quality setting - I've compared it to my other speakers and wired earbuds which do not have this problem).

Overall the sound quality is good, I give this a solid 4 starts for the tech and sound.  However it gets a 1 star for fit (averaged to 2 stars).  I bought these to wear out at the stable while taking care of our horses.  I have tried all combinations of the rubber earpieces trying to make it so these don't fall out of my ear with no success.  I've already had several cases where one of the buds falls out in the stall with the horse nearly stepping on it.  These will likely work fine as long as you use them in your car, home or office, anything where not a lot of movement is involved, I would expect taking a walk would be OK too.  Actives like yard work or anything involving bending over or a moderate amount of activity may cause you trouble.  I'm not an Apple fan (quite the opposite) but I'm really wishing I had bought the Airpods instead...Update on 22May2020:

I am thoroughly enjoying the purchase of my Samsung Galaxy Buds + wireless ear buds. I have purchased numerous wireless ear buds from different manufacturers and these are by far the most comfortable ones that I have purchased. They are light weight, sound great and most of all I can wear them continuously without bothering my ears or making my ears feel itchy inside.These buds have a lot of different features that I have yet to explore, but out of the box, they were easy to set up on my Samsung Note 8, and all of the features explained in the quick start guide worked just like the instructions said. I also noted that after using them continuously for 6 hours, when I put them back in the case, the battery indicator in the app showed that I had 60% of the battery still available.

To start, I ordered the Jabra 65 elite, beats around ear, and these to compare.  These were the winner for me.  I am a 30 year old male that works an outdoor summer job.  They are sweat proof enough that they worked all summer for me.Battery Life - Amazing, I work for 8 hours and still have charge left at the end of the day.  If they do run out then you can pop them in the case over lunch and will have plenty for the rest of the day.

One thing I've always loved about my OG Galaxy Buds was the sound, so when I read about how these sounded even better, I was super excited.  But when I put them in, and threw a song on, I was left puzzled.  Something didn't sound right, so I made sure the software was up to date, restarted my phone, and tried out the different equalizer settings in the wearable app, but nothing could get rid of the more distorted and tinny sound that these had.  It's exactly like listening to a 256kbps mp3 vs a 128kbps. There's just that little bit more of distortion that good listeners and gear heads are gonna notice. And I think this is how they're getting better battery life out of these--using a lower bitrate DAC.I even ended up buying another pair because I thought maybe I got some duds (not buds), but those sounded the same, as well.  I'm sure many people wouldn't notice and the increased battery life may be more important to them, but I'm returning these and sticking to my clean and clear sounding OG Galaxy Buds.

These are my first set of this type of ear buds. The sound quality is very good, so long as the buds are in correctly and that can take some finagling to get them just right. Everyone's ears are a little different, so it might not be as much of an issue with others as it is for me. I have to really push and twist these around to get a good seal. Once set, they seem to stay put. I wish they had a way to adjust the bass to and individuals preference rather than the presets, but dynamic sounds pretty good to me, especially with Amazon's HQ and Ultra HQ songs. Build quality seems really good and they are reasonably comfortable at least for the short time I have had them. One other thing, Don't Lose the Charging base. I see they cannot be replaced and you will have to buy a whole new set of buds. I bought a zippered fob key case with a snap hook on it to keep mine in. Overall, I am happy with my purchase and would recommend them.

Sooooo extremely dissatisfied that these can only connect with one device at a time. I was actually replacing earbuds that cost less than half this amount. THOSE could connect quickly to multiple devices, but I was looking for a little better battery life. With these Samsung Buds+, while the sound is great, I realized after multiple attempts to connect to phone and laptop, that it just doesn't happen. Apparently they can only connect to a single device. Attempting to connect to a second device will automatically disconnect them from the first. What a FAIL! Unless my husband has a need for them they will need to be returned, as I need a pair that will connect to my laptop or computer while still staying connected to my phone.

The sound quality and voice transmission are as good as it gets for me at least. These buds fit in my ear comfortably all day long. I have no issues ear pain or fatigue from wearing these buds.There was an issue with the the first pair I received. The left earbud was DOA. I've browsed around the interwebs and found that the left earbud stops working often enough to be concerned. I am not sure why this happens to straight out of the box BRAND NEW items like this.
Let's compare these against a pair of earbuds less than one third of the price, the Soundpeats Q30.These Samsung earbuds:

I have tried several brands and all of them have hurt me.  No matter how much I try to "get used" to the others as people have suggested, I couldn't.  These are great.  No pain even after prolonged wear.  They come with 2 different ear tips so if one doesn't work for you the other likely will.  They are very secure with the ear tips on.  Worst case scenario if both ear tips hurt you then you can remove them.  They won't be as secure for running or other activities without the tips but for most things they are just fine without them as they have a good suction in the ear canal.As for sound, great on calls and music.  App is ok for the equalizer.  Would prefer something with more customization instead of presets but the presets aren't bad.
In recent years I have started to become attached to Samsung products, and for the most part I have been very satisfied.  These are no exception.Pros:
I needed a replacement as iphone Apple earpods would fall off and did not want that loss.The Samsung earbuds + have super fit, and sound.

I've tried a ton of different wireless earbuds (Airpod Pros, sony wf-1000xm3, libratone track air, bose, among many others) and every pair has it's pros and cons - it's difficult to find that perfect pair.  Although not perfect, I think the Galaxy Buds+ offer the closest thing to perfection on the market.  They can be worn all day without discomfort, they stay in my ears pretty well during vigorous workouts, sound quality is great, call quality is great, aesthetics and button control on side is great.  My only complaint would be lack of active noise canceling, but because they seal sound out so well, I don't really see the need for it - it blocks ambient sound just as good as the leading ANC earbuds (apple and sony).  Highly recommend these headphones.

I couldn't connect my left bud for the longest time. Left Bud kept showing 'Disconnected'. I tried one of the suggested method here. Unpaired the bud from my phone. Switched off the bluetooth. Took out the right bud from case which was ok. Put the left bud only in the case and kept adjusting it till the middle shows red to allow it to charge. if it turns green adjust again to show red. Once it shows red (without immediately turning to green), i left it charging (case open with just the left bud in the case). Charged it for 1 hr with case open. After an hour, I switched on the Bluetooth on my phone and reconnect the buds and it worked. Bud shows connected, both sides. I was able to update the software too as both are connected now.

I had the previous buds, and replaced them with this after I washed my last pair by accident (dont make fun of me :[ ), and the improvement are huge! The extra woofer and battery life are great. Starting with the sound, these are equal to $150-200 wired earbuds from like 7 years ago in my opinion, the dynamic sound setting in the wearables app is great (these have great software integration btw, they show up like apple airpods on your samsung phone when you open the lid). The sound is extremely accurate on the base setting, and dynamic adds the bass you need for metal and rap. The battery life feels like it lasts 3x longer than my old buds! About 7 hours per bud full volume for my use case, and close to 12 hours with lower volume and ambient sound turned off (another useful feature to hear your surroundings.) Also these wirelessly charge super fast, I've never plugged these in. These are a solid recommend from me, didn't think this would be possible for $150 a couple years ago.

These are okay. I just got them in the mail. I‚Äôm using them now. They‚Äôre not much louder (if any louder) than the $5 headphones that I bought at WalMart. I‚Äôm not trying to hate. I love Samsung. But these are lackluster. Battery life seems ok I guess. I haven‚Äôt used them enough to see but they haven‚Äôt died in 2 hours so I‚Äôll give them a 4 star for that aspect. But overall, these are just okay. I definitely was NOT blown away. I‚Äôm actually disappointed considering how much I paid for these.

These are my first wireless ear buds and I really, really like them. The sound quality is great, but slightly less presence than the wired buds that came with my phone. Not bad by any means. They were very easy to set up. I pretty much opened the pod and my phone and tablet instantly found them. It's really easy to switch which device I want to use them on also which is so convenient. My absolute favorite feature of these is the ability to hear sounds around you if you turn on ambient sounds. There's no perceivable delay, and at the medium setting, I can hear almost as well as my regular hearing. It's nice to pause my music with one tap, and carry on a conversation without taking out a bud. Since these are my first wireless buds, I can't say that they're better than any others, but I do recommend them if you're looking for some.

Maybe its me but my experience with Samsung phones and earbuds has been horrible.  I had an  S7 edge that was replace 3 times because of issues.  But figuring it can't happen again me, I order this the Galaxy Buds+ because I am getting complaints from co-workers  on conference calls.  I get them and the right bud volume is lower than the left.  I tried everything on youtube and internet to no resolution.  Finally called Samsung Support and they asked where did I get them and when I responded Amazon they said return them.  Samsung's quality assurance stinks!

These headphones were extremely uncomfortable and hurt my ears. The headphone didn't fit into my ear properly and so that made the sound quality horrible. These were going to be my first higher end pair of ear buds, but I'm definitely sticking to the cheaper brands that work just as well if not better than these.

I have had Airpod for a few years and the battery life was starting to fade, I could maybe get 15 or 20 minutes on a zoom call before they started beeping. Started just using one at a time to prolong the battery life.  Wanted to give these a try to see if the battery life was as stated.  Wow, they are awesome!  The connectivity is great for transitioning between devices.  Works well with Apple products too.  Sound is awesome as well.  I love the battery life and the app that gives you complete control.  Fit is solid and I can wear them for hours with no worries or discomfort.  These are worth a try.
Left earbud does not connect no matter how many times I:- reboot my phone

I concur with other reviewers that the earphones themselves are outstanding with sound and, while without any electronic form of noise reduction, allows for a sealed/noise-free listening pleasure, controllable by software for outstanding sound.One thing that makes me feel uncomfortable about the earphones is the charging case.

FIRST PHOTO: I haven't had any issued purchasing refurbished items from Amazon before, but this time the box arrived with the earbuds and charging case straight up missing. This might be partially my fault for being too trusting... Seal on the box was broken - someone at the warehouse probably has sticky fingers. I just ordered replacement. I'm sure I'll have terrific feedback for these earbuds once they arrive and I get the chance to test them out.EDIT:

These are great. I've had air pods, which kept falling out of my ears and that got annoying.  I currently have Power Beats Pro, but they disconnect from my Samsung Galaxy and dont have a great deal or bass ironically.  These are excellent.  The software works great, the separate woofer is noticeable and of course it pairs easy and works seamlessly with my S10+. I was on the fence given how much I had paid got the beats, but these are well worth it.

I bought these because they advertised noise cancellation when on calls, and people being able to hear you. This is only partially true. When your voice is active, the background is fairly suppressed, but when you pause to listen it is very loud for the recipient. My around the neck Samsung Level Pro are 100 times better. I was looking for an in-ear solution that would work comparably, The Buds + were NOT the right choice. Additionally, the Buds will not stay in my ear regardless of the tip/ring options available. They fit tight, but work their way out. If you haven't already used the application on your phone to turn off the touch feature, pushing them back in your ear can end your call. With all the above items, they just aren't a workable product unless you are sitting stationary in a quiet environment. Then they may work well. I wish there was a way to return them, as $149 for a product that doesn't meet the advertised features, is not acceptable. They have limited usage, and I'd like to return them for not living up to the advertised features.

I got these specifically because of the good reviews it got for call quality.  I am impressed for the price.  Everyone I ask says my audio quality is very high.Sound quality is awesome when sitting still.

I got these buds a few days ago and so far I'm not a huge fan. I have a hard time with the touch controls, I switched around the ear pieces and still find it a bit uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time, you can NOT shut them off when not in use. You can only put them back in the case so they recharge and then just suck the life out of the case that you must recharge it everyday anyway. Other than that the Ambient sound option is great, I work in a very loud warehouse. I'm able to hear what people are saying to me while my music is playing (on the lower end) but at least I'm not constantly taking them in and out of my ears to hear what's going on around me.

I wanted to love these. I have been using my old Bose Soundsports Wireless (with wire attached to each side) and its rubber case was coming off after years of usage. I wanted to replace them with truly wireless model.After reading nice battery life and sound quality, I decided to give these a try and I was disappointed.

While I absolutely LOVE these earbuds, unfortunately mine became defective after 4 months and one side became considerably quieter than the other. I cleaned the mesh of debris and blew compressed air from a can into the "drum". This was only a temporary fix and a few minutes later would revert back to 1/3 the volume. Keep in mind Samsung's warranty RMA process is confusing,inconvenient, and frustrating - Amazon made well on their behalf.When I went to register my buds with Samsung, they showed under a different color, I was forced to call the 1-800 number (unlike literally every other Samsung device I've registered) and never was able to reach a human support specialist.

I bought the original buds when they came out and I like them and still use them. On a whim I saw the new ones in red so bought myself a new set of the Buds +.First off the red is sick.. It's not just flat red, it's metallic red.. pretty snazzy. Paired easy to both my Note 9 and my iPhone XS Max with no problems..  upon initial set up with my note, there was a software update. Which was simple and straight forward.

Each update they get better and better....sound quality is pretty good, but there's other buds which sound a little better.  Pretty comfortable, worn't fall out of ears while working out.  Control virtually everything via touch.Only complaint is if you have a jaw that clicks, and you have the touch volume controls enabled, it can possibly raise or lower the volume if you're eating.  Bizarre side effect, but worth noting.

They're great at music. If you play around with the settings you can get some great bass out of them. Music is great on both Android and iPhone. On iPhone weirdly, both pieces of the headset show up individually when you try to pair.The call quality is great and people can hear me just fine. On iPhone you must have both headphones set to connect in the blue tooth section for them to work. Apple make everything complicated. Lastly the touch feature is weird to use but after some practice it almost feel natural.
Right earbud doesn't work. Doesn't charge at all. I tried many different ways to try and get them to charge. Nothing!!!

I've had them for a week and have been using them for both my computer and my S20+ without any problems until today.  I put them in my ears and the left one doesn't work.  Looking at the wearable app, the right battery is at 100% and the left is at 0.  I put them both back in the case on a charger for a couple of hours, no change.  The charging light does light up when I place only the left one in the case, so either the case is bad or the left one is bad.Contacted Amazon, they tried troubleshooting steps, then instructed me to contact Samsung.  Contacted Samsung Customer Care, have to send them in to their repair center, 3 - 5 business day turn around.  Nope - returned it to Amazon.

So far, these earbuds fit the best in my ears. I can use these in most exercises without worrying about them falling out.Now when it comes to audio quality and ambient sound amplification, these fall a little short. The audio just doesn't seem as clear and crisp as my Sony WF-1000XM3s. The ambient sound option seems bad as it amplifies all background noise equally, if not more, than speech sounds.
I tested several buds before getting theseLiberty Air 2 SoundCore - great sound (perfect workout buds), mics bad for Zoom/Teams., battery life long but varied

These aren‚Äôt noise canceling ear buds.  I use them when riding my bike and appreciate being able to hear ambient sound.  The outside ambient sound is not intrusive.  So far these are wonderful.  When I first received them as a gift my IPHONE 6S wasn‚Äôt capable of working with all the features.  I was due to upgrade phones, purchased an IPHONE 11 and every feature works now.  These buds come with different sized fittings for your ears, you can receive telephone calls with them, the carrying case serves as a charger, sound is high quality and can be adjusted, and you can change tracks by tapping the buds.  I‚Äôm sure I missed something but I recommend these to anyone looking for great sound and some built in safety.

I got tired of the wires. These sound great (not awesome but still great) and have quite a few nice features. I needed to use the smallest ear pieces. I've found dynamic with a customized equilizer created best overall sound quality. The ambient sound option is a major benefit.One of my buds dropped sound to a very low level after I dropped it. I called Samsung support. They answered quickly. I told them what happened. They created a return ticket for free shipping. I sent them in . . . they sent them back fully repaired. Cost me nothing. This is a home run of support and service. So happy and impressed with Samsung support.

I just got it today so I have to see if I still like them after using them for awhile. But so far they are so comfy, cute, and good sound. I was afraid it wouldn't be loud enough but I put it on Dynamic setting and that was best for me. I paid more for the cloud blue color and glad I did. It's so shiny and looks sweet in my ears. I hope the battery will last a long time, and still charges good after a long time. Thank you for sending it in good condition

ok so I'm a diehard samsung fan and what the hell are these? Really samsung f-you. Ok first they dont fit in your ears at all, I tries all the tips and its inconceivable that they fit anyone. 2.) The sound quality it garbage, it sounds like your watching TV in a tile bathroom. I downloaded 6 different apps for equalizers and 0 improved the crap sound. Then again you can't fix tmwhats not their. 3.) The design is not good the "wing tips" don't grasp or slide under any part of your ear so they kinda just hang out loose and not locked in if you get my meaning.and 4.) Their are alot better choices out there for 145-150 dollars, spend your money on Sony or hell senheiser buds which I hear are amazing.
Definitely can feel the upgrade from the original galaxy buds!The sound quality is way better and the bass is pretty good!
Based on a typical 1 - 10 scale:Music: 8

Paired with a Samsung Galaxy S10 easily but the audio quality was poor. The equalizer that is featured in the Wearable app did not change the equalizer settings regardless of which preset was chosen. The earbuds paired easily with Windows 10 but no controls on the earbuds work nor would the input and output devices work simultaneously. If you want to simply listen to music wirelessly then there are earbuds available that will do a far better job. If you want earbuds to make calls do not use these as it does not come through clear even within a small quiet room. This product is not worth the price being asked for it.

I bought these so I can exercise outside. Most earbuds block sound out completely, and if you like that, more power to you. But when I'm outside, I want to be able to hear what is going on around me, and these do that spectacularly well (via the Galaxy Wear app)(I use an S10+ but I don't know how well the app works on other phones or non-Samsung phones). Also, when I'm on phone calls, I like that I can hear my own voice vs sounding like I'm covering my ears. The mic quality for is also really good, much better than the mic on the phone, in my opinion.I haven't really pushed the battery life since I only use them a couple of hours at a time.

These connected just fine most of the time for a while. But the app is a major pain in the butt. It has to open every time I use these, battery suck. It always needs to update, the most recent one is causing them to disconnect a lot - and I have to find the case to reconnect at all on my phone. Funny, this is not an issue on my computer where the app isn't needed. It disconnects the headphones to update. Which means you have to find the case to have it open to reconnect when updating. If this were very occasional that would be fine, but I have had to update a bunch of time in a few months. Annoying. I cannot find a headphone, it will not connect to my phone to make use of the 'find my headphone feature' because post update they connect and disconnect a lot (so now I am SOL unless I find it myself). Useless feature there. The security of having to sign off access to basically all of my phone accesses for a darn headphone is sketchy as all getout. They stay in my ears while running. Sound-wise they are good, but I bet there is an equivalent headphone with lot less of the headache.

I've been a fan of Bluetooth headphones since 2006 when the only ones available made you look like Princess Leia, and eventually got more discreet like the S9 and S10 from Motorola, but always wanted them to evolve to two buds like the Galaxy Buds.  After almost two years of use of the original buds, I upgraded to the Galaxy Buds plus and I'm loving them.  Better battery life, but I really love the ambient sound feature.  I actually use it and it works  (The original buds ambient sound made everything sound robotic.)  With the original buds I had to take one out to hear outside noise, because in ear headsets are like ear plugs.  Now I get the best of both worlds.I'm aware there is a third generation of galaxy buds live, but those our outer ear buds, and I prefer in ear buds.  I may get a spare of these galaxy buds plus to use a few years from now.  I'm worried they won't make good in ear ear buds like this again.

They are very nice earphones and have a good long lasting battery. Quality of sound is acceptable but not o par with the better ones like Jabra abd Beats. My main problem with them was that I couldn't pair them with my daily driver Oneplus7T. I tried and tried and tired... but no luck even after I unpaired them several times and reinstall Galaxy Wear app. They worked just fine with my other phone Note 10 + though. So I have to return them as I planned to use them with both of my phones and stay with the cheap ones I bought earlier from Amazon. They had no problem pairing with any phones in my household
Cons: - These don't have "great" bass (compared to the Soundcore Liberty Pro 2).- No custom EQ settings

I loved these earbuds for the first 2 months I had them. Then the right earbud stopped working. And by "stopped working," I mean that it still worked, but the volume would only go up to about 1/5 of the left earbud's maximum volume. So I contacted Amazon, who contacted Samsung, who told me to ship both earbuds + the charging case back. So I did... and a week later, I get an email that my repair has "been placed on hold due to an unvailable part." So now I'm out $150, sitting here with no earbuds and no idea when or if I'll get them back. Needless to say I won't be purchasing any Samsung products again.

I was perfectly happy with my original Galaxy Buds. For about a year they were my faithful companions, which is why when Samsung introduced the Galaxy Buds+ I was originally thinking I would pass. I watched a few reviews on YouTube and my ears started to perk up.Last week I decided to buy them and WOW! what a difference they make. Call quality, in even the most challenging environments is significantly improved. This alone is worth the upgrade, in my opinion. Then there is the huge improvement in sound quality and on battery life, 11 hours vs 6 in the regular buds.

They pair easily with my Galaxy S9 and utilize the Wear app. That's the good news. But sound quality: horrible. Sounds like everything is being transmitted from the inside of an aluminium garbage can. Buds are reasonably fine for about an hour. After that, they're increasingly uncomfortable to wear, becoming downright painful  at 1.5 ... so pretty useless. Not recommended at all.

When I first bought these, they worked ok with my Garmin Fenix 6 - certainly better than other brands I've tried. That was once I figured out you have to wear the watch on the right hand to not have the sound skip every few seconds. Then I hooked the buds up to my Samsung phone, and a bunch of updates came down, which provided a couple of nice new features. However, after those updates, I can't listen to music without the sound skipping and chopping up every 10 seconds. It doesn't matter which hand I use the watch, these buds are now horrible to use.

Awesome. I have the first set of earbuds that Samsung released. Those had a problem where I would pull them out at the gym and the battery would be dead. It would just drain from the case. These do not have that problem. They can sit in my bag for weeks and still be ready to go. The software is updated regularly. They stay in. The controls are sensitive enough to know when it is in my ear and when it isn't. They are comfrotable. I Don't have anything bad to say about them. I have not run the battery down while using them working out and haven't had an issue with sweat.

I am absolutely impressed with these earbuds. My favorite things about them are the first factor...I totally forget they are there, even with a winter hat on over them, super light and fit perfectly in my ear. I am also really impressed with the ambient noise feature. Perfect for better having to take these out to interact with anyone I need to. And finally, the battery life is crazy awesome. The sound quality is good, not as much base as I would like (even on the dynamic preset), but I'm using these as my daily commuter/work set and don't really need it.

The sound is the same quality as a cheap pair of earbuds. There's also no noise cancellation which to be fair I wasn't really expecting. People seemed to be reviewing the sound quality high, however, for the price it's completely not worth it but the concept itself is cool.To note to anyone with the same issue: I also have extremely small ears with smaller ear canals. While I read articles saying they would stay I did not feel like trying to run with these litterally hanging out of my ears and looking like a complete fool. For the price and the sound quality it's completely not worth it. I returned these immediately or, at the least, am attempting to considering apparently even Amazon lockers aren't available despite them saying so. I completely regret buying these, however, I was initially very excited.

This vendor ships from Jamaica and is NOT covered by Samsung's warranty, DESPITE what comes in the box. After 1 month of extremely light wear, one of the buds unexpectedly died, the vendor refused to return it since it was after 30 days, and  Samsung wants to charge me $100 to repair it. Total waste of money. Tried to be loyal but I'm switching to airpods.

bought these for wireless listening of a police scanner. after comparing all of the options out there these were the best ones for me... as advertised. I have ios, i can control their features through the app i thought. but in reality, the app is not compatible with my ipad pro. they sound fine, feel and look great, but they are not everything that i purchased. actually they are missing quite a lot of the functionality that i had been under the impression that i was paying for. They ought to be customizeable, I have ios. i am not going to return them, because they feel and look good. but i am unhappy that they are a limited version of what i had intended to own.

I got these for my 17-year-old son for his birthday. He listens to music, youtube stuff etc.  He says the sound is pretty good, the noise cancellation seems very good as I have to yell at him to get his attention when they are on. But the big complaint is that to use the find my buds app, they have to be in the box with the lid open! Huh, who loses their earbuds with the box open, you are more likely to put them down somewhere without the box which is what he has done a couple of times, especially as he usually uses just one. For the price that could have been a bit better.

First of all, shipping was only 2 days for me.  Eta was about 4-5 days, so this is a plus. No pun intended. I was never daring enough to grab a red color and normally reached for a black or white one.  So i got the red earbuds plus and its so clean.  Quality is nice if you know AKG.  Fitment is perfect.  Dont hesitate and just do it !  It came with a wireless charger as well !!

I decided to make a new purchase this year to replace my Bose headphones. I had to decide between these and the Jabra 75t. After receiving these I decided to purchase those.Likes: being able to use each headphones independently

The galaxy buds+ are really great, battery life is pretty good, sound quality is pretty good, wish they had active noise cancellation but they do a pretty good job at drowning out the outside noise. I also wish they were more water resistant, I tried using these at the gym but my sweat was messing around with the controls and pausing my music. Love the app easy to use. But other than those 2 complaints, they are pretty good.

I could not turn out sound coming from quite talking in the next room.No noise reduction on my 1 day old earphones plus.I  heard no base sound unless i held the earbuds hard against my ears.Battery life is very good.Samsung earbuds plus was delivered the same day i ordered them.Amazon said i could return them for refund.

My husband bought these for my 50th birthday since I said I wanted some earbuds to exercise with.  They are really hard to control the pause, change song, the quality of the sounds is not good and I have not enjoyed having to keep them charged constantly since they dont seem to last very long.  I went ahead and bought apple earbuds and they are far superior to these.  Sorry Samsung, but I really wish I had returned these when I had the chance.  They are definitely not the quality that I was expecting.

I've tried the cheaper buds, and they dont work at all for phone calls,  the other person cannot hear you. These buds work great, people say it sounds just like I have the phone up to my ear. I've worn an ear bud 4+ hours and it hasn't bothered my ear. The color is great (I chose red) and the rubber adapters make the fit perfect, there are 3 sizes to choose from. The ambient sound feature makes it safer when walking outdoors. The case holds a charge well, and works seamlessly on my wireless chargers.

The sound quality is good, not magnificent, but for true wireless at this price point, you're not going to blow your ears away. The microphone is also good enough. People say they can hear me on calls just fine. Again, not as good as a dedicated voice headset, but that's not what I was expecting. The one true disappointment is "ambient" mode, where it lets in sound from your environment.  Ambient mode is terrible.  To notice any difference you have to turn the ambient volume all the way up, and even then it's spotty and the pass-through quality is bad. Lots of headphones or even ear protection have ambient pass through. It's old tech that should be easy enough to execute on.  They missed the boat on that feature and it cost them 1 star.  Otherwise I'm completely satisfied with the purchase.  Ambient was not a huge deal for me.

I liked these a lot at first. Then they started cutting in and out sometimes but it wasn't too annoying. They also cut out if the phone was in my pocket. Now that I have had them for a while and amnusing them a lot more because I'm working at home, I wish I hadn't bought them. They cut out constantly even though my phone is right on my desk, they also like to randomly disconnect.  Controls work when they want to and they do not stop playing when you take the bus out. I just ended up swapping them out with the $15 regular wireless headphones I have, because I couldn't take it anymore today.  So disappointed

I really wanted these to work with my iPhone!I have iPods and the battery life is terrible, the reviews for the Galaxy Buds+ was great.  I am returning them as they have two fatal flaws, (1) the buds keep slipping out of my ears, (2) when a barely touch the buds to put them back in, they disconnect the phone call. This happens a lot, even when I am careful to only touch the sides of the buds, calls can disconnect. The last straw, I had to use the speaker on my phone and gently pulled the buds out of my ears, when I placed them on the table, the call disconnected.
I just received my new Galaxy Buds + and mostly love them!One functionality not available via the app's area where you can customize the long press buttons:

I bought these because of the the locator on them. but when my fiance took them off we had the case but no buds. so we tried the locator and they couldn't find them.  If I knew that the locator wouldn't work I wouldn't have spent so much.

My AirPods stopped holding a charge so I was looking to replace with something that was on par with its quality but had a better fit. The only better about the galaxy buds is that they fit better. Sound quality is tinny when I listen to music. When I talk on the phone people say I sound far away. When I put my phone in my pocket the sound quality gets worse...to the point it stops working.  Stay away from these ear buds.  I use the iPhone 11 plus.

We are a Samsung family, TV, and phones, just got the new Note 20 Ultra. These earbuds work very nicely and come on automatically for my phone or computer depending on which I'm using. Have never had a problem with battery life, but I charge the case after every two times I use them. The case is very sleek and small, liked them so much I bought another pair for my partner. She loves them too. UPDATE: I just found out that you can charge them on a charging pad, just happened to set them on one of mine and they started charging, how nice is that!

I bought these hoping they would be usable. The experience is not good. The sound is way off. I have it paired with a g7 and have used all the bells and whistles that the phone has to make the sound better. Nah! I waited to long to return them so maybe I will give them to my mother who is 95 and deaf and she if she likes them! I then bought other manufacturers ear buds and will not connect with the phone and it has to the Samsung app and software since they pair up with my mac fine.  All I see is contact us BS. Last Samsung product I buy!

These Samsung Buds+ are incredibly rich-sounding and deliver superb frequency response. They deliver clean and tight energy at moderate volumes and when really pushed to high levels as well. I prefer to use these in the Dynamic Sound mode for music selections. My Buds+ fit perfectly without changing to a different sized tip, and the passive external noise cancellation is great. You won't just hear the stereo panning, you'll feel like you're inside of the music. I couldn't be happier with these and the well designed companion program that Samsung designed for controlling their features.

I debated whether I should buy these or not for a long time. I checked reviews, looked at reviews on YouTube, and then asked a friend who has a pair. She loves her pair so I purchased them. I have no regrets. Pairing them to my Galaxy S7 took 2 seconds. The sound quality is so clear and crisp. On the phone and speaking on the phone the person I'm speaking to can hear me clearly.The only thing that took me a long time was figuring what size wings and tips so they don't fall out. Size small tips, medium size wing tips. My next difficult decision is what skin do I want to protect the case.

They finally got it. The buds that came out last year fell short. I had to return them, i could not have a conversation with someone without them complaining about me sounding far away. I work long hours in a noisy environment. That problem has been FIXED. I can wear them all day at work, 12 to 14hrs. The buds plus are comfortable enough and the conversation quality is great. I have had no complaints. The soud of music could be better but that is not the purpose of me having them. I am also comparing them to the sanhizer and klipsch that i had. The best part for me is the fact that i can make calls from each bud independently. And the transparency mode is pretty good as well,  definitely an improvementover the buds. I am happy to finally have something that can handle a loud work environment.

These true wireless galaxy buds + sound really good and have amazing battery life. My only knock would be that buds don't power off when removed and it's nearly impossible to reposition or remove one without changing tracks or pausing your song due to the touch sensitive side panels. Not a deal breaker by any means. Also wish it could go just a little louder.  They get loud don't get me wrong,but I always try to go just a little higher and I am already maxed out. I'm being picky only due to the price. They work flawlessly and I've had zero problems. I highly recommend. I am using with a Note 9.

Best bang for your bucks on true wireless headphones. The smooth connection with my Note10+ was a surprise to me. Right out of the box it self connected and even set up seamlessly with my note. It's ability to create ambient sounds insures that I can listen to music on the job and still hear my coworkers without having to take out or put back my headphones like I normally had to. I've only used this for a few days even on a 12mile run but it so far has stood up to the sweat and time I don't need to charge it for.

If you're looking for great noise cancellation...look elsewhere. They block out noise since they are in-the-ear buds, but there is no active noise cancellation. So, when I mow my lawn I have to turn them up a bit higher than I would like to listen to my podcasts. Other than that, they are really nice. I was surprised how well they stayed in my ears...it was easy to forget I had them on. The pass-through feature is also nice when you don't want to block any sound. I was also surprised how well they work for phone calls.  Lastly...LONG battery life (11 hours) + another 11 hours held in charge in the case.

I received these Galaxy Earbuds in blue for my birthday and  have never enjoyed having something in my ears all day, but these are so comfortable and the sound so good I have to remember to take them out.  I love the easy tap functions to call, shuffle thru tracks and long life charge.  the color and polished finish looks really nice and compact rechargeable case can be plugged in or placed on a fast charge surface.I loved so much I purchased a set for my dad who is hard of hearing... we hope the adjustable ambient setting and volume can help him during calls and listening to books, music and more from his phone.

These buds are great. They are comfortable to wear if you get the right size ratio. The battery life is off the charts compared to the other earbuds on the market.During phone calls, the clarity is good on both ends. The 3 microphones really help with call quality.

I ended up buying these and the Jabra 75 elite. After using both for a couple months I could say I prefer the Jabras 99% of the time. Here's why1) The buttons are so sensitive on the Galaxy buds. They are activated by touch and are hard to remove or adjust without hitting the buttons.

battery life is excellent sound is much better than the buds. I have the iconxX the buds and now the buds+ and I have to say these are quite an improvement over the first two models. I got them in red, had to wait a little longer but it was worth it they look great. They connect a lot faster the battery lasts much longer, I use the dynamic sound setting and it sounds good with bass and treble balanced. They also charge faster than previous models including the base. The range from the phone has been improved and phone call Quality is 10 times better.

The sound quality is amazing. The connection quality is terrible. I bought these mainly for running, and even with my phone strapped to my upper arm, the sound is constantly cutting out. I have tried various bluetooth codecs, changing the audio quality priority to connection stability. Every possible trick I found online, to no avail. The features it has with my Galaxy S8 are awesome, but AKG/Samsung should be embarrassed by this product overall.

I have been through a few sets of ear buds and these are my favorites. I didn't think the true wireless were a good choice for chance of losing one. However I was surprised how well they fit and hold in my ear. Been using them for about a month in all kinds of environments and they hold tight but comfortably. The sound is good and better if you have them really tight in your ear. The bass is a little lacking at times but over all these are really high quality. The charging case is a real bonus. I know this isn't new for some people but having the ability to pop them into the case and recharge is very cool. These by far would be my pick over anything else I have look at or tried.

This is definitely a major upgrade from the prior version which was great in my book but needed improvements in ambient sound and call quality. Now Samsung has fix those short falls and you has a truly versatile, quality, great fitting product.The next upgrades I would like to see is increased waterproofing and get rid of the ultra sensitive microphone squeak when buds get too close to each other. Only buds+ users know about that last suggestion.

It snugged comfortable in the ears especially when u have extra ear tips to fit any size ears. touch seems sensitive and responsive Except for the volume up and down. It's a tad bit difficult to perform a volume control task base on the way you have to place your fingers on the buds. My only gripe is the fact that the buds can't switch between devices without connecting them yourself. The ambient sound control is something is amazing, I enjoy controlling my background noise whenever I want. Can't go wrong with these headphones.

I've tried cheaper truly wireless buds, but there were regular signal fallouts, especially at the gym where large metal frames could surround me.  Since I started decided to guy better quality and started using these, I have not had one signal drop anywhere, even at the gym which has a weak Wi-Fi signal.  Sound quality is good to excellent.  They fit comfortably but I wish they had a little better instruction/tutorial on how to fit them to your ear.  I would recommend them to any skeptic.

I received a set of these galaxy buds(NEW); upon arrival, I discovered that the right bud is inoperative. Ordered replacement set, the left bud is inoperative. Attempted to request another replacement but had to talk to an "expert" from Amazon. The expert had me troubleshoot(everything I already tried). The expert connected me to Samsung tech support; confirmed I received faulty earbuds and I could send them in to be repaired. I ordered new earbuds, that would be a refurbished set I asked if there was any way to connect the two working buds and he said only a Samsung service center could do this. If I wanted a refurbished set, I would've chosen refurbished for $30 less... very annoying. I finally convinced Amazon to send another replacement. Hopefully this set works....

Is it really worth 150? Only if you are using a Samsung phone. It gets the job done and is all around for everyday use. Not much to say about it. Portable and good for all situations. The case is glossy so it is prone to scratches.  I have one fat scratch on the case. No big deal though. If you have the original, don't bother to upgrade. There is only a significant difference.

I ordered these last week cause I wanted buds with active noise cancellation.  They felt great right out of the box.  Very comfortable and great battery life is about all that is good about these.  However they sounded awful.  Very tinny and low sound even after the firmware upgrade and messing with the lousy EQ.  No matter how I tried the sound was just bad.  Also when you touch them to adjust them sometimes it cuts out the music.  Please save yourself the disappointment and buy the Jabra 75Ts.

Mine died/became completely non-responsive after less than six months of very light use.  I'm endeavoring to get warranty information and/or assistance from Amazon, but so far no response at all from Amazon.  Samsung's customer service has been non-existent.  I paid $150.00 on 3/22/2020 for these from Amazon (delivered on 3/25/2020), only to need to replace them after less than half a year.  No thank you, these are pure garbage.

First I have to say that I really wanted to like these headphones.  Waited for a while to pull the trigger, and when I finally did, I was disappointed with the design.  Definitely not made for small ears. I could not get a good seal even by changing the tips or the added wingtips. In the end the design sits in your ear and pushes against it in an uncomfortable way if your ear canals are not big enough. Returned these in the meantime. Still searching for the right design for small ears.

The connectivity wasn't great.  If I go 2 feet but separated by a door it breaks.I loved the design and the color (red) but that's about it.  I love Samsung brand as I've had the Samsung phones, tablets so I wanted these.
From what i can say the Samsung Galaxy Buds+ Plus, are just decent... that's really it.I'm not really into it, its way too over priced, $140.99 is too much. It feels and sound like a $50 earbuds.

So far I am really happy that I upgraded to the buds+.  Ive had the buds for a year now, but like many didnt care for the call quality and the ambient sounds was soso.  So with this, the call quality is MILES better and the ambient noise is really REALLY nice this time around.  It sounds way better and louder than before.  To me, the sound quality is about the same as before.  The battery life is nice, but 6hrs was plenty for me.  Id say if you dont care about phone quality, I would say stay with the originals.  If you do make calls, but yes upgrade - its worth it.

I'm a fan of Samsung products, but I found these disappointing. The sound is good and it has nice features, but they just don't stay in the ears well. Add to that the touch (rather than press button) controls, and you're constantly pushing them back in your ears, and that registers as pausing play. I've tried jabras, raycons, and these, and, and these are my least favorite. The raycons don't have as nice of features, but overall fit the best and therefore are my favorites.

Out of the box the fit was perfect. They come with different sizes but I didn't need to change. The battery last all night. Fast charging and a nice small case. Works with Samsung Wearable app which allows control of the buds sound like bass and other types. Shows battery status of buds and case and software updates.These are so much better then Bose Free SoundSport (bad fit and battery life) and Echo Buds (bad fit and battery). I wish I could return both but I waited too long.

I've had these a week now and I'm not really impressed. I've tried messing with the sound settings and different situations but not sure these are for me. My $25 fakebudz sound better and the only thing I like about these is it's small and you can hear phone calls.***UPDATE***

WOW! The sound is so awesome and the price is great. The Ambient sound is amazing - you can listen to music but hear someone talking clearly without pulling them out. The Ambient sound can be on or off. Even though people are saying these don‚Äôt technically have sound cancellation - when Ambient is off you cant hear outside noise especially when music is on because they set comfortably down in your ears. With the silicone band they feel firm in your ears, I don‚Äôt worry about them falling out. Great fit!

For Starters, WOW! 1.Bluetooth range, AWESOME! I waked all the way into my garage and shut the door and the bluetooth connection didn't crack. This is AWESOME! 2. Sound. Another Awesome improvement. The Ambiant Sound feature has also been greatly improved. I highly recommend These. I would get one of the light colors though. Dark colors hold heat. I know this because years ago I was wearing black jeans waiting for a bus. the top of my thighs started to burn. when I got home. they were red and it hurt like heck.
Do not buyMy buds stop working
No volume adjustment other than phone.  Can't use for TV viewing because they are not Low Latency and app allows only phone use. Not a good general pick for more than a phone.

Bought these for hubby for Father's Day. He like to walk early morning and was trying to listen to his financial program while walking, but had trouble competing with surrounding noise. He charged these up and was ready for next day. He is one happy camper. My son, who is an iPhone lover suggested the iPhone ear buds, but these were comparably priced and work great as well as being able to be charged on mophie wireless charger.Will be buying these for myself very soon.

Samsung please refer us to the part in the beautiful marketing pictures/description of all the wonderful features this product has, of the App not able to run on anything earlier then iphone 7? I thought so. You bury it because you know people dont have the time to look. We can put a convertible with a man off into deep space but we cant have hardware/software  that can run stuff past 4 or 5 years? Pfft. We all know why. It‚Äôs exactly why the world is going to the H in a Basket. Greed. Its a screw you im out for myself  mentality.

I had to return and get a new set due to the first set not charging the left bud. Once the replacement came the item worked properly and sound was great. I like that the case is the charger and the design of the item. The buds fit well in the ear and do not fall out. I do worry of sync/charge issues as I continue to see others with charging/sync issues with time. Given I had a charge issue with my first order, I am concerned it will eventually happen with this new pair.

Bought these since I watched tons of reviews. Previously purchased the Jabra Elite Actives and those sound incredible and are super comfortable however they have an issue where the bluetooth cuts out whenever you bend at the waste. Jabra claims this is normal. I will have to live with it. The Buds plus have message annunciation which is so convenient but the sound quality is not incredible, not bad but can't hold a candle to the Jabras.

New galaxy s20+came with the first galaxy buds and I loved them lots but my daughter actually loved them more with her iPhone so I made this my excuse to buy the buds+ and I am so glad I did. After a couple of adjustments they fit perfect and sound so good. The ability to make sounds outside the buds is great if you are like me and use them on downtime at work so I don't need to keep taking them out. Even better note is that they are cheaper than air pods if you are an apple user.

I travel alot and needed a useful alternative to a boom headset for when I go in meetings and such. These worked wonderfully at first, but now the right ear bud has gone out almost completely.  You can barely hear any music even at full volume. I have tried everything but unfortunately I am down to the left only which I rarely use. They are great for 3 or 4 months, but continuous use they are not good for. Honestly save yourself the money and find much cheaper alternatives because even if they go out after 6 months it is cheaper than having to replace these.

I used to use the around the neck headsets and they worked great for audio but also phone calls. I use them a LOT for phone calls when shopping or out of the house. I was going through a lot of the around the neck headsets and wanted to replace them with earbuds instead. I tried a knock off Amazon find and the sound was great but the mic was horrible. So I got these & I am soooo happy with the quality!

A big waste of money. These worked fine for about three months. One ear bud stopped working so we sent it in for repair. We were told there was significant impact damage to the ear bud and it would cost $100 to repair. These were only used with normal wear, no impact ever happened. Not to mention they cost $150.... I'm no longer a Samsung ear bud customer after this experience. Don't waste your money.

If you have a Samsung phone you will get a persistent and nagging request to share all of your contacts as well as your location. They will sell your location and if they are hacked there go your contacts out to the world.Worse still, you will get a persistent and nagging request that you update your earbud software, and the notification cannot be turned off - so you will see it all day every day!

I bought these for my wife because I had a pair and I love them.  I like the ability to choose different degrees of  noise cancellation .  sound quality is superb for earbuds.  they take some getting used to physically as the ear canal can get irritated at first if I wear them too much. but I gradually get used to it.  I havent tried them on a long run yet I'll get back about that.

I work in a loud factory and I had the apple airpods 1st gen that have zero noise cancelation. It was time for a upgrade. I was thinking about getting apple airpods 2 pro but for the price tag of $250? No. I went with these. They don't have active voice cancelation, but the nice seal it has around the ears makes up for that. They are super customizable. Being able to turn ambient noise on and off with the push of a button is amazing. When I use the forklift at work I can turn ambient noise on and hear everything around me with amazing clarity. HiGHLY recommended. A game changer

The headphones are fine , I really like them . looks good , stays in in ear after vigorous head shaking for testing . Mcommevrs easily .. ambient sound is nice .My issue : the right ear piece sounds crackly when watching videos on YouTube /zoom / or any other video user uploaded service  kind of weird and the phone...

I've had these for a few days and, I have to confess, I didn't like them at first.  Due to a lack of documentation which would have provided helpful information on how the "wings" and "tips" work, it took me quite a few tries to find a combination that works for me.  However, after that, I've very pleased.FYI, i had to use the "wings" that are basically flat with a large tip in my right ear and a medium tip in my left.

Skip gen 1, get these.  Dedicated driver delivers fast, deep, accurate bass.  Highs come through with a nice sparkle, never shrill or hot. These are quite neutral in signature with a slight bump in low end and when using samsung scalable codec (samsung only devices) they sound amazing for $150.  $150 for a wired version would be a great deal, but BT 5.0, spotify integration and a bunch of other bells & whistles make them a steal.  Fantastically tuned.  Not bad AKG, not bad Samsung.  Keep at it!

First out of box it started having problem. Left earbuds just won't charge. I looked up some online support to find a way to connect to my PC, and do a firmware update which fixed the problem temporarily.The sound quality is quite disappointing for +$100 but the bluetooth connection worked pretty well so I used it without complain for awhile.

I don't normally write reviews however this was worth it. I was worried that I was spending too much since they offer a cheaper model, but I am telling you, you won't regret it! They are worth every penny. The sound quality, ease of operating, the seamless app that you use with it. If you are questioning the price don't its definitely an investment you won't regret!!!

Beautiful! I choose the red pair and they are simply gorgeous! I have the previous version however, they made minor changes that make the plus version worth purchasing. For example, the extended battery life, the shiny color which looks amazing, and the upgrade in the app shows the charging case battery status.

I have purchased over 50 different wireless earbuds over the last 3 years.  My main concern is comfort and above all else that my wife doesn't complain about having trouble hearing me when talking on the phone using the earbuds.  This is the first pair that I have had no complaints about.  People can hear me fine while in the car driving 80Mph, while in a noisy office, in a hotel room standing near a noisy air conditioner, and walking to the car on a windy day.  My only complaint is that i wish they had a vent to reduce pressure in my ear and allow noise through without hardware/software magic.  Without the vent they are still the most comfortable earbuds I have ever owned.

The only reason I take a star from these is the IPX rating should be at least 5 but other than that damn near perfect. Good sound stage. App works well. Very stable and comfortable to wear, and the battery life.  I have tried and own many true wireless earbuds. Own Powerbeats pro. AirPod pro. I have owned Bose soundsport. Tried vista wireless. Jabra 75t. These are the best of them and at the price point unless you plan on sweating a bunch on them I‚Äôd get them. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

So far so good, these Samsunh galaxy  buds + are amazing. I myself have the Galaxy S10. Some reviews say the buds don't have any bass. But you definitely can control that option on the wearable app. So with that being said, the bass is great. I work as a carrier and listen to music all day while I work. Only use one bud at a time during work, 8 hrs in and my right ear bud still didn't need charging. So battery life is great. Sound quality was on point and clear. Can't really say about noise cancelation yet, but will revise if I experience that.

These are good in most respects.  they fit fine.  battery life is more than what i need. Sound quality is quite good. for noise reduction, the ear buds are more effective than actual ear plugs. The only real drawback is the volume.The low volume may protect your ears from damage, which i can appreciate after 25 years of blasting my ears, thing is though, the music i like to hear really does need to be played loud.  I dig metal of many stripes and volume is an important consideration. it is loud enough, barely but i wish i could get like, 25% louder. that would be about perfect.

First off, these are my first pair of wireless earbuds. I am using them with a Google Pixel 2. They sound great, battery life is amazing, and they're small enough to throw in the case and take anywhere with me. They pair quickly with my Android phone and just work very seamlessly even though I'm on a non-Samsung device. These do not have active noise canceling but they still do a good job of blocking outside noise. I couldn't ask for more out of these at this price point.

These earbuds charge very quickly and have excellent sound quality.  Bought them for my wife and the size if perfect, since they're on the smaller side for wireless earbuds.  Setup was very straightforward and easy.  The finder app functionality is a little weird and if they were truly lost might not be able to find them since the chirping sound is a little weak.  I would highly recommend these earbuds.

Didn't rate to high yet as I'm still reviewing these. I've had others that all claim their quality and was in the end disappointed maybe because of being picky.  So continuing use may change my mind.  Stay tuned.After putting these through their paces I've found out by their self its not so great but then again none of them are. However, I've enhanced them with the Jet Audio EQ from the Play Store and now their Bang On. Just needed a little push.
Pass on these.  Not worth the price.Max volume is generally too low.  Range is terrible - breaks up about 8-10 feet, drops completely at max 15 feet.

I've had these earbuds since the end of May beginning of June. It's now July 25th. They've stop holding there charge. They don't charge evenly. It takes forever to charge them.  I've charge them overnight just to find they're still not fully charged. If I have to readjust the earbuds, because they're falling out of my ears they stop or skip whatever I'm listening to. These are by far the most expensive earbuds I've ever bought and they weren't worth the money I'd never buy them again.

Never been much of an earbud person let alone saw myself spending this kind of money on something that seemed trendy more than anything. The ambient passthrough is what really sold me. I work in manufacturing so it's important that I'm able to hear my surroundings. All I have to say is WOW.Call quality is amazing, battery life is good, and I'm 100% sold on these! No regrets! If you're debating these because of the price, don't. They're worth every penny!

I loved these until I decided to wear them while laying in the sun.  One of them started beeping.  Then the other.  Turns out they were overheating.  Samsung said that while overheating is a known issue it is because of faulty buds. They also said that their buds overheating could be pretty dangerous.  I replaced my buds... next time I wore them in direct sunlight they started overheating.They are fine earbuds unless you intend on going to the beach or relaxing by a pool or just lounging around outside.

Works as expected. I had to use apps that offset the sound delay that is inherent in wireless earbuds without low latency codecs. For videos in android, that means using the youtube app instead of using the browser directly. Battery life is great.Touch controls are all on or all off. I would have preferred being able to disable the single tap controls and hold controls since those are too easy to trigger when wearing or removing the buds from my ears.

Sound quality: not the best I've ever heard, but up to par with typical Samsung quality.Noise Cancellation: i can hear that people are speaking to me, but not distinguish exactly what they're saying. I can hear outside noises enough to know they're there but they don't disrupt what I'm listening to.

These buds are extremely comfortable to wear for long time! I always had problems with tight fit that irritate my ears and these buds fixed this problem...Sound is awesome, could use alittle more base, but clarity is just great. No sync issues and no delays with video play back...

Editted:  Had a software issue, phone was dimming audio because it thought it was casting hulu to the tv still, when it wasnt. So they're great. Lol also learned some tricks to make the volume loud af. Turn that Dolby atmos on!Had them for a few days and the volume drops about 40% after a few seconds of video/music. Tried all the support fixes and still does it. Sending them back.  Had cheap 20$ buds before and didnt have this problem at all.
Crackle, crackle, crackle.  That‚Äôs what these do instead of hitting the bass.  Very disappointing as the fit and design were great.
+ Fit in ears really nice (even not bad to sleep with or ride bike/onewheel)+ great battery life

I work on construction sites all day so I wanted earbuds that would block out a lot of the noise and when I make phone call while around loud machines which is all day. I originally got the AirPods Pro because I have an iPhone but when I talked to people on the phone they could hear everything in the background and barely hear me so I returned them and tried these and I‚Äôve been on the phone around or on very loud machines and the people on the other line couldn‚Äôt even hear anything but me talking which I couldn‚Äôt believe but it‚Äôs just what I wanted.

I bought these ear buds back in march. Over the last two weeks, they have been nothing but trouble. I have contacted samsung several times. I have been on the chat/put on hold to many times. My left ear bud does not work at all at this point. Don't waste your hard earned money or time. Worst customer service I have ever had.

The first pear i order had a defect and Amazon was great in send me a replacement. These ear bud work great is to connect speaking from a galaxy user. The sound quality is excellent and even though they not noise canceling they do a great job at blocking out noise. The battery life is excellent lasting me well into the day. After a couple hours they do stay feeling a bit uncomfortable but that true with most ear buds. Phone calls come through clean and the mic works great.

I've had them for a 2 weeks and I enjoy them being the first time I've had bluetooth headphones in 7 years. They work good sound quality is good but I've noticed when I have one headphone in the audio get real choppy when I'm on the phone. It seems as if the connection is bad but the problem is solved when I out both in....kinda wired but that's the only complaint I have so far. The battery has yet to die on me yet as the case always charges it which is great. Maybe the choppy audio as well is just from a software update because I am using a older Note 8.

I am honestly a little disappointed in these. The microphone appears to pick up EVERYTHING in the room. Everyone else on my calls constantly complains that they are causing interference. I wish the microphone was a little better at picking up just my voice.Otherwise, they fit well, look nice and the sound quality is perfect for what I need the rest of the time.

Nice buds, no question, but they screwed it up with volume adjustments: there is no way to adjust the volume unless you install another app on your phone and give all kinds of permissions on it.There are nice alternatives in the same price range.

These buds best features are the great battery life and good sound.  Test the tips and wings to get good fit. Also test out ambient sound slider for external sounds to suit your taste.
