The companion app let's you fine tune the buds. Works best on a Samsung phone or android phone. Will work on an iPhone too. Call quality was good as well.

Extremely happy with the Buds+. In particular, the battery life is way better than I expected. The noise cancellation is very good (not quite as good as wired Bose I've had, but still very good) and the sound quality is excellent. I run and workout in these, and although they get sweaty and have a little movement, they've never come out. Highly recommend.

This is one of the most disappointing purchases I have made on amazon. Thought I was getting a great deal on earbuds made by Samsung who usually makes excellent products. These have terrible sound quality and not even close to being worth the high price I paid. And I got them on sale.

These earbuds sound great. I returned my first pair because they kept dropping the bluetooth connection. Then the replacement pair began doing the same thing. I then realized that the connection worked fine outside, but dropped inside the house. I finally figured out that interference from my wifi router was swamping the bluetooth connection. When I changed the wifi channel from "Auto - Channel 1" to Channel 11, the connection problem was solved.

I like these. They sound good for earbuds. Recent software updates have really improved the ambient noise filters. Great for windy days when you still want to be able to hear your surroundings and listen to music. Works on all phones and on Windows 10. Works better on Samsung phones as it has some additional features for gaming latency etc.

For what it's worth, it does have amazing battering life. The noise cancellation is not terrible, however, if you want earbuds with THE crispest sound quality, this isn't it. The bass boost sounds very artificial.If you don't really care that much for rich sound quality, these are definitely the best bang for your buck.

The buds are honestly pretty good. Great sound and quality, but I've got one issue.I am hearing a very low buzzing sound coming from my right ear bud, being most noticeable when there is nothing playing on my buds. You have to really listen to hear it though so it's not the biggest annoyance, but I imagine it'll be more so as time goes on.

With the pandemic going on and me working from home, I needed a comfortable option for video conferencing use. These feel very comfortable in my ears. I really like the options with the multiple ear tips. I have them paired most of the day to my MacBook Pro. I also have used them with my Galaxy S20 plus and they work great.

These earbuds have excellent sound quality and battery life, but if you don't like in-ear earphones, these aren't for you. They don't go too deep in your ear canal, but they do create that "underwater" feeling that many of these types of earbuds have. If you have a samsung phone and the included AKG earbuds fit you well, then you'll love these.

I love these. Best sound period. So easy to use. The app really helps set up. The battery life is good, not great.  There were times I "thought" it was charging and it wasn't.  Still no complaints.  The amient noise feature is fantastic during walks.  I can list to my music at full volume and still hear traffic coming. It does drain the battery a little faster using this feature.

I was really excited for my new ear pods but let me tell you, I barely use them. It hurts my ear so much, I don't know if I'm doing something or what but I can barely keep them in for 1/2hour which defeats the whole purpose of me getting them. I've used ear pods before and never experienced this discomfort, I feel like I've wasted my money since it's just sitting around gathering dust.

Love these buds. Great battery life, good sound controls. I like being able to customize the touch controls. While no active cancelation, good isolation, and I like the 2 levels of ambient sound available. Only reason I cannot give them 5 stars - they need a could more steps up when increasing volume. I almost entirely use them to listen to audio books, and I usually just cannot get them quite loud enough.

Very poor sound quality, even when compared to cheaper earbuds. Connectivity is the worst I've ever seen.. can't. Have my phone in gym shorts while working out. They have trouble staying connected laying on the table beside my phone. Major disappointment. Even when paired with my Note 10+. Firmware constantly updates with no help. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FROM A FEWLLOW Samsung-o-phile

I was excited to try these wireless buds due to all the positive reviews but once receiving them myself I was pretty disappointed. For the price the sound quality was mediocre and below average to what I was used to. The touch commands on the buds weren't intuitive. Worst part was that the buds weren't comfortable, especially laying down hurt me ears more than they should've. I love Samsung but they have yet to perfect the wireless earbuds, past generations and models were also disappointing unfortunately

Absolutely worth every penny, sound quality is great and the ambient noise setting is both versatile and useful. It really adds a whole new level of sound that borderline on asmr when your music is turned off. Microphone quality is excellent and the battery and recharge times are amazing. I love how easy it was to pair with my galaxy phone and the controls are easy to use. All in all, I'm incredibly happy!

Let me just start by saying I had an iphone but when my friend introduced me to Samsung I fell in love. I have an Samsung note 9.  I have the Samsung ear bugs plus. I love the quality , sound . Just all around great. I am not tangled up at work and bound by wires. I also love the feature hear far distances. In settings on the app and also the phone.It makes it clear and crisp. Both settings together makes it hear clear.

I'm uncertain as to why at this point, but my early use of this has exposed that my right earbud burns battery much more slowly than the left earbud. I'm trying to figure out if this is a normal thing or this is a defect. Anyone with ideas about this?

Only giving one star bc in order to use the wear app you have to give it access to your location, photos, contacts, and media 100% of the time.No other bluetooth headphones I've ever used requires these invasive permissions. I'm not sure what Samsung is doing with my data, but I don't appreciate the invasiveness and opacity of their terms.

This is my second pair of Samsung Galaxy Buds.  My first pair was a promo with my new Galaxy Note 10+.  Both sets of my Samsung Galaxy earbuds matched up with both my phone and my iPad much easier and fit better than my Bose did.  My Bose earbuds were more difficult to deal with and bigger, and kept slipping out of my ears even with the smallest attachment.  Great job Samsung!!!

These are only ok. They didn‚Äôt fall out of my ears when I worked out but they would hurt my ears after 15-20 minutes. Sound was fine until you have any noise in the background, ie: tv on. I knew I would want to have these when I traveled on planes so this made my decision for returning them easy. I didn‚Äôt want to spend the extra money for the AirPods Pro but I bit the bullet and the sound quality is like night and day. I‚Äôm glad I paid the extra money.

Going to return.  You cannot connect 2 bluetooth devices at the same time like Samsung claims. The distance from the device is poor also. I walk to the bathroom in my house and they break up.  Also, uncomfortable.  Real disappointed.  Have Samsung phone and 2019 Samsung t.v. and cant connect to both at the same time.  When working, sound is very good.

I've had these for a couple months now and I absolutely love them. I was looking for earbuds with an exceptional battery life and these don't disappoint. I travel and wanted earbuds that can last a coast to coast domestic flight without needing a charge. I like the sound quality a lot, and didn't feel the need to adjust it out of the box. Im very happy with my purchase.

I wasn't sold on the whole earbuds thing. I decided to pick these up after some research. Went with these because I have a Samsung Galaxy Note 9. Setup was easy, sound is great and the battery life seems to be really good!

Used to listen to music at work for 8 hours straight at least. Battery good for at least 10 hours, Be sure to utilize Sound Wizard if your phone has the option. I am using a Samsung S20+ 5G. It will make a difference for bass. Also, buds do not need to jammed/pushed into ear canal. I am using the Large Earbud Tips. They just need to sit comfortably in the ear and let the Earbud Tips seal out the sound. Has Ambient Mode for hearing external sounds with 3 levels. Best damn buds ever.

Just like some people have said my right ear bud was dead but all it needed was to be charged. It was a simple fix. Just needed to give it an hour after put it on a charger and everything worked fine. People are way to impatient. You lift it out of the case and put it back in and it will start charging the buds. Other then that minor hiccup they seem to be real nice. I like the quality. I have no complaints at all.
Good earphones however they seem to disconnect a lot  don't kno.w if its a issue for others. The onboard storage is a game changer you literally don't need your phone with these at all

The sound in these headphones is really good but it's not the best to use for company phone calls. If you are buying these headphones because they have 4 mics that are supposed to be better for phone calls then these are not for you but if you are buying these headphones to listen to music then these are great headphones with clear sound and strong bass.

These are absolutely amazing.  I've had them for a week now..and I was never the one to leave ear pieces in myy ear. I thought the idea was stupid and I was afraid that they would fall out. But these are GREAT. Especially the ambient boost.  I can hear everything and tune everything out when I want to. 5 stars from me

Would not recommend. Every few months I have to get a replacement because the volume in one ear drops way below the other and the only way to solve it is to send it back to Samsung for a new pair. This seems like a common issue reported by others online and has happened to me twice. Although they seem good overall at first, this repeated issue means I would recommend trying something else.

I had these for a week before losing sound in the right earbud. I cleaned it, reset it, and restarted the phone and nothing worked. Spent hours on samsungs support to send it back. When I got it back it was working fine but then the problem came back. Save your money, its garbage.

Unless having the latest or just the improved battery. I really do not see the price justified. The original buds are better in my opinion minus the amazing battery life the Buds + give the user. If you don't want the fingerprints all over your case I suggest staying away from the black buds. I cannot speak for the other available colors.

I keep these in my head for hours at a time and never have ear fatigue or pain.  Battery life is insane, lasting all day. My wife can't use them because she has very narrow ears. But I love these things.  I had someone stop in the store to ask about them. Super low profile.

I keep these in my head for hours at a time and never have ear fatigue or pain.  Battery life is insane, lasting all day. My wife can't use them because she has very narrow ears. But I love these things.  I had someone stop in the store to ask about them. Super low profile.
These are amazing and sound 10 times better than my apple pro.

Perfect crisp sound--the best I've experienced. Great features like ambient sound and the touch controls. Extremely fast and smooth connectivity as well, but in a shorter working range than other buds I've tried. Not an issue at all if you always use these with your phone in the same room which I assume most people would.

These are NOT the US version and warranty will be VOIDED if sent to repair in the US. Buds stopped working after 5 months after spending hours and hours on the phone with Samsung I find out these buds are the "international" version and warranty is voided and they want me to pay 108 dollars to repair. If you live in the USA DO NOT BUY THESE there will be NO warranty and they are pieces of crap.

UPDATE: Now both cut out. The new ones came. Lets hope they're not dud buds.ORIGINAL: They sound great....when they work. I've only had them a few days, and the left side bud already cuts out frequently. I can get it to come back if I reset them. I shouldn't have to fuss with them to get one to work. Theyre going back

I'll admit, it took me a while to figure out the correct fit and how to wear these properly, but once I did, I am rarely seen without them. They are comfortable, secure in my ear, and the sound is fantastic. With the right combination of taps on an earbud I can control my music, listen to external conversations, pause, or do so many other things. And the color is so beautiful! The case and earbuds hold their charge for a long time, and recharge very quickly. I'm extremely happy with my purchase!

looking forward with this update version of galaxy earbuds.Samsung made decent update on both sounds and calling quality, extend battery life. Different eq setting, and noise reduction function is great to have.

I think these buds are pretty cool. I'm able to leave one in my ear all day and listen to music/podcast while I'm at work. They get a little uncomfortable for me after a while though. There is a little rubber flange on the buds that help hold them in your ear, after a while it starts to hurt. I also wish that these got louder. I'm not sure if there is an issue or not. I have these paired up with an S10 +.

I use my earbuds for my online college classes.  My classes are zoom style so, my classes are live.  I also have middle school children who have zoom classes. My mornings are pretty busy so my earbuds come in handy so that I can listen to my lectures and participate in the class while I'm in various parts of the house or in the car.

I got the buds+ AKG version and  charged them right away and the earbuds will not connect to my Samsung Galaxy Note 8. then I couldn't get the left ear bud  to  works, couldn't hear anything from it. I tried to use everything, delete the app, unpair it,  the, pair it. Even restarted my phone. Finally I gave in, and I just returned it. I'm really disappointed with Samsung. I recommend you do not spend this much money on the galaxy BUDS+ AKG version, as mater of fack, I wouldn't recommend any of the samsung buds.

I bought them for the improved ambient mode and I was not disappointing. They are the best buds for that and I own  some Buds that cost alot more. the music sound has improved because of the 2 drivers instead of one. I own both gen of Galaxy buds and am very happy with them all. BTW, I also go back to the IconX, so I have been there for all the Gens.

The transparency mode didn't sound near as natural as what you get from the Airpod Pros and the sound quality also missed the mark. I ended up returning these during my search for great true wireless earbuds. I was using them with an iPhone so that may have made a difference in user enjoyment. If you have a Samsung your experience might be better.

They were pretty good ear buds, sound quality was alright, but the touch controls were horrible. Then one day my right earbud starts emitting a loud buzzing sound and now it's way quieter than the left earbud. Disappointed, especially given the price, I would stay away from these.

Just got them and love them so far! I was very displeased with the Bose Earbuds but these are a homerun. Small clean fit in my ear. Look cool. Easy button controls. Phone calls on both ears. Walked all over the house upstairs and downstairs while still connected to my phone. I heard clearly and could be heard clearly. They‚Äôre great. Get them. Ps: Bose earbuds stink.

Buds are good, I bought a warehouse refurbished... thats a joke, least they could do is wipe them down, wax was all over them. And the shipping took a few weeks. Not happy at least they didn't cancel this order.

I used it for a simple BT connection to my Pixel 3 phone only. The sound is not that melo overall! The bass is very weak, the vocal is outstanding but overkill. Maybe the noise cancellation is overly performed. There are 6 preset EQs in the Wearable App, it does not change too much to the sound flavour. I guess it is designed for Samsung wearable devices in general..

Only one ear piece and one size doesn't fit all.  I find myself pushing them in to get better sound.  They don't fall out.  They just get loose.  The galaxy wearable software is okay, but there's no volume control on the bud. There is an ambience mode with 3-4 loudness settings that enable the buds to act like cheap hearing aids, which is nice.I give it 3.5 stars.

Delivery was sooner than expected, which was a happy surprise. These little earbuds have a great sound. They also cancel noise very well. I like the little blue case mine came with, which is how they are recharged, thru the case. They fit snuggly and are very comfortable. For those whose earbuds don't fit right out of the box don't worry. They have sent several different sized fittings. Very happy with my purchase!
Took buds for test walk. Experienced poor quality sound compared to wired Panasonic with Mic, static and fading of music. Too disappointed to try a phone call.

When I first got them the left one didnt work, to fix this simply plug in the case and put the left one in by itself and it will start to charge once its started to charge place the other one in and there ya go issue fixed :) ( please give it at least 10 minutes to start charging)

The call quality of these headphones is amazing, most people had no idea I was wearing wireless ear buds. Unfortunately for me that was about all that was good. The Bluetooth range was not great on these. The sound quality is not bad but the bass is very lacking. They fit pretty well but there was some ear fatigue for me after an hour or so.
Music speed changes when my screen goes on or off (using the Galaxy S10+ no less)Left earbud had connection issues.

I tried these and echo buds and I picked the echo buds over these because of the sound quality and ear fit...  but for ambient sound passthrough galaxy buds+ are the best! Was nice to be able to hear important sounds while still cranking the volume a bit... will miss that feature.

I purchased the original Galaxy Buds quite some time ago and didn't like the mediocre battery life. I'm very glad the Plus version nearly doubles the battery life, allowing me to comfortably wear them throughout most of my day! I highly recommend the Galaxy Buds for people with Samsung smart phones.

I love these earbuds. Having used the last gen Samsung Galaxy Buds, the increased battery capacity is a significant bonus as well as the additional mic's and the better ambient noise sensor/settings. BE CAREFUL WITH THE AMBIENT NOISE SETTING! WHEN ACTIVE, IF YOU REMOVE AN EARBUD IT WILL MAKE A HIGH PITCHED SQUEALING.

Slightly more impressed over the previous version. Battery life is much better. After changing to several of the ear plug sizes, the buds still really don't fit firmly. The constantly activate the google assistant on my Note 9 when I'm just sitting idle. Very irritating.
Finally got my first pair of wireless earbuds !!! I am astonished by the sound and noise cancelation its amazing perfect fit to my s20 ultra

These have very good sound quality.  I have had 3 other brands and every one of them would cut out in the left ear to the point of distraction.  So far these have never cut out and the left one is as good as the right in volume, clarity and reliability. Very pleased with my purchase.

This is my third pair of wireless earbuds. The first two had different issues, poor sound and were not reliable. So i paid for a good product. These earbuds are excellent. They stay in my ears, sound like i am at a live show, and have excellext battery life. Well worth the money.

Battery life is great but expected better from the sound output. Even when on loudest phone setting and earbud setting they are no where near as loud as wired headphones. Bass is also lacking.  They do fit in ear well and work great when jogging.

Eh, they're earbuds...nothing special about them. I wish they came with better silicone/rubber ear pieces that would actually stay in your ears.  The silicone/rubber seems firm and doesn't mold into the shape of my ears. My coworkers have these same earbuds and I see the wing tips on their buds find their way out of their ears as well.

The connectivity problems of these things is becoming unmanageable. If my phone is in my right-front pants pocket and I turn my head slightly to the left, the left ear bud will disconnect. Same problem in the inverse.I've tried all of the online fixes to no avail.

Battery life is awesome and wireless charging is neat. I love the sound quality once I found the right fit with the changeable tips. The app allows so much customization and pairing is super fast and easy. Call quality is superb and I have never had a complaint while using them.

The earbuds feel good in my ear and they sound good! Not tinny like the others I've tried. My voice is clear on calls, which was important to me. I'm sure there are better ones out there, but I didn't have the time to look. For the price, I'm satisfied so far.
Unlike AirPods, these fit my ears perfectly. Unlike AirPods without continually having to push them back into the ear. And they cost less.

I had tried all of the keys expensive earbuds but none of them worked for very long.  The Samsung earbuds work excellent with my Samsung 9.  The quality of sound is awesome.  I am so enjoying the earbuds on a daily basis.  A great buy finally.

This were great but comfort my my issue and had to return them since my ears are sensitive and having ear buds in them for any.length of time ends up causing me pain! I can only use a certain type of ear bud but this had to much plastic sticking out causing pain!

I like the fit and the quality is great. I did have one complaint, but after I did some quick internet searching came up with a solution. The sound was too quiet due to the buds having an internal volume control that you have to access by setting the touchpad to volume control.

I have owned these ear buds for just over 3 months and the left bud is so quite as to be inaudible. I know of other people that have owned these buds and they have the same issues. It appears to be a manufacturing default that has not been rectified. I would stick to cheaper products. If they fail you don't lose much. At over $100 this is extremely disappointing from a company like Samsung. Highly unrecommended.

Overall decent headset.  Touch system is problematic.  This is a decent pair of ear buds.  But, the touch system makes it challenging to rearrange in your ear.  By simply touching the earbud, you hang up the call or stop the music.

These are beautiful and the sound is great. I have never spent so much on wireless earbuds, I feel like it was worth it. It was very easy to connect to my samsung phone and ipad. I wish the purple ones were the same price, I got red and they look great.

solid earbuds.  independent left and right ear pairing.  sound transparency actually works well.  swicted to these after dealing with issues with my Android phone and my 1st gen airpods.  these are far better than airpods in terms of quality, sound, battery life, and compatibility.

Had the earlier edition and used them for 2 years but battery started not holding a charge.  These are much improved.  They charge in the case while not plugged in, last a lot longer.  Very happy with my purchase
Using it with my Pixel 4 and have significant challenges with it staying connected. It just drops for no reason. Same issue when I used it with my son's Note as well. Not a great product.

I really loved my original Galaxy buds but these things take them to a whole new level not only do they look great the sound is fantastic and call quality has greatly improved! Battery life is off the charts great

I have a $50 set of no-name wireless earbuds that connected right out of the box. I had a bunch of issues getting these Samsung earbuds connected and had to troubleshoot why the left earbud wouldn't connect. I shouldn't have to troubleshoot a brand new name brand product.
Ambient sound option is okay but not the best, but I didn't purchase these for their ambience. Long battery life (bout three days, with case included) and they don't fall out of my ears when I run :)
I read such good reviews from many sources so I was disappointed at the sound quality. Replaced them with Tozo 6 earless buds.  Much better sound and less than half the price.

The updated features make these much better than the original. Not going to say sound quality is much better but the original buds sounded great to begin with. The new Galaxy wearable app is great with more info/features for the Bud+.
Have many Samsung products as with my others I am extremely impressed at these earbuds. They have a great fit and do not even feel like you are wearing them, even when working out. Highly recommeded
A bit heavy on your ears, and you get tired of them after an hour. Non discrete. "Adapt Sound" function is annoying.TIP: You can get all the bass you want while using the biggest earplugs.
I like the look. They fit just right. Very comfortable. Sometimes i do get some difficulties trying to end call and it doesnt work when i tap the buds. But everything else works great.

I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  They are extremely comfortable.  When paired with my active 2 I can listen to music while offline.  This allows me to leave my phone at home during runs.  Battery life is incredible.

I operate heavy equipment and when I'm in a call people can't hear all the noise in the background and can hear me perfectly. The passthrough works great too, I can hear my comms clearly while listening to music or on the phone.

Very disappointed in the sound quality. The buds sounded "tinny". I tried a variety of music styles and was not satisfied with the quality at all. I had higher expectations based on the wired AKG headphones that came with my Note 8. I am returning these. Guess I'll wait until the Bose 700 Wireless come to market.
I've tried a lot of various wireless headset and earbuds, these seem to be a better overall quality and sound great.  I've only had them for a bit so if they crap out I'll come back and update.

So far so good, battery drops about 10% per hour on all max settings.  So give or take ten hours of constant use under those circumstances.  Love the color, like a hot rod.  Looking forward to using these regularly.
I bought these as a father's day gift for my husband.  He loves that he can wear these when he is out in the back yard and can listen to his music and take phone calls.  He says the sound is great.

As some other mentioned in a review, for my unit the right earbud drains faster than the left one. The screenshot shows ~30min use and the right bud is at 95% battery while the left one is still 100%. On the bright side they‚Äôre Lightweight and comfortable to wear for a long time. They sound very good and actually  follow the Harman target curve really closely if you have seen reviews from rtings.
Good fit, easy to use.  I was hoping for a little better max volume (Used when cutting the grass).  Otherwise, riding a bike, walking, etc., they provide good overall performance.

Love these Buds. Call sounds quality is amazing. I am using them for work call which is all day from 7:30 to 5pm. Calls are clear on both ends and batteries last all day. Only downfall is they are not waterproof. Otherwise they are perfection.

I love to use them for my audiobooks and music. The touch controls are a bit iffy to use and sometimes skip my audiobook which is annoying and it drops the audio and microphone on discord sometimes. For the basic use of them, they're great. Using them for everything else, not so much.

Their great. Connection with Note 9 perfect. Automatically reconnects when you get in range and they will bring up your last song or playlist. Kinda neat...definitely try the different ear ends to get a good fit for each ear.

These have been fantastic. I have paired them to my iPhone and they work great. The only down fall is that you need the Samsung Galaxy buds app. I am not a fan of the apple AirPod so these are a great alternative.

The earbuds keep cutting in and out, They are very uncomfortable to wear even if I change the rubber part that goes into to ear. They also fallout all of the time. Save your money not a good set to buy.

Bought these 5 weeks ago and one stopped working. The seller states the warranty is 30 days - which is useless since that is also the return period. They also told me to go to a repair shop. Ridiculous service for a product at this price. Do not buy!

Great Sound. Ambiant Sound feature a plus. One con is that they seem to stop working under wet (sweat) conditions. The buds know when their in an ear (witches!) and maybe sweat messes up the connection. Otherwise great buy!

I don't know how I lived without these before. They are perfect for Covid online meetings too! They work so well when watching a movie or music or talking on the phone. I use the noice cancellation all the time, and can still hear outside when I am not listening to anything super loud.

The AKG earbuds that come with the s10's they never stay inside my right ear. So I was worried about if these would stay in my ear but wearing then around they did. They sound great and in the settings I added the bass boost which sounds so beautiful to my metal music. I really love these, yet I haven't tested the phone call yet although I'm sure the buds are still great.

these seem great to me, they are my first set and I really like them. they are not cheat but as soon as I took them out of the box they started working. instantly paired with my Samsung phone and just kept right on going
Great sound . Good base. Pairs easily and guickly with my Samsung Galaxy phone.

First pair stolen from a Amazon employee. Got a second pair sent with no problem. Battery last all day on my 9hr shift. Sound is clear and great. Thanks to the wifey I got the buds I've been wanting. Thanks

WOW these are great. I use them for watching movies on my iPad and iPhone. They sound unreal but I am just a regular person not a music buff. Love them as they are small compared to other I have seen and own.

I was skeptical about buying an expensive pair of ear buds without some sort of wire keeping them together. I did some research and chose the buds+ and really glad I did! They seem to be staying in my ear really nice and comfortably and the sound is amazing. I love the red!

Sound great! Definitely an improvement over the first version. Pairing was simple on all devices (Note10+, two laptops and iPhone 7). The upgraded ambient sound is phenomenal and crazy how well it enhances sound especially if you use the Samsung Labs enhanced option.

Basically just like air pods pro but perfect for the Samsung users. However, I noticed some glitching and degrading sounds when using Bluetooth on the galaxy buds when gaming on my laptop which sucks and should not happen.

Just small enough for a pocket, like the front watch pocket in your jeans. Buds last for hours, charges in minutes and enough recharge capability to last all day and more.  I can recharge by usb c cable or my s 10 qi charging

My only gripe with these is that I wish they were a bit smaller. Even with the smallest attachments they are too big and eventually slip out of my ears. But other than that, the sound quality and convenience of these is great. The battery life is amazing, I can forget to charge them a couple days in a row and they still have enough charge to get me through a day at work!

Sounded okay, what you would expect for the price, really loved the quality of the side tone/ambient mic. But it doesn‚Äôt matter if they don‚Äôt work. Usually Samsung makes decent gear, not so much this time.

These are AMAZING, especially with a Samsung phone. They auto connect to your phone. They know when they are in/out your ear. Great sound quality and exclude ambient noise. They sit in your ear well, no fallout, and are mighty comfortable.

We are another happy customer, at the start of our purchase, but now, just days after the return window has closed, the ear buds have stopped working.  So disappointed with the product because it has high satisfaction ratings overall.  And, the disappointment is increased due to reading that Samsung will not honor a warranty.  Amazon???

Just returned these. The left earbud would disconnect on a regular basis and the right seemed to not be able to hold a charge. The left one would be at 80 percent or better but the right would run out if juice. And yes they were both fully charged at first.
Good buy! I enjoy the noise canceling while taking walks. The sound is enjoyable but sometimes I get tired of the piece in my ear. If you are giving up the over head headphones these are a good bet.
PROSSound quality good

Good sound if you sit still inside your home.  I tried walking with these but lots of wind noise that interfered with the sound.  I tried the medium and large ear attachments but the plugs kept falling as I moved about.

These won't pair with my Pixel 4 or my Lenovo Yoga. They're getting sent back. I love AKG and really looked forward to these but if they don't work they are junk. Thanks to Samsung I was able to get them paired so I'm going to give them a shot.

The product they sent me was not working. I‚Äôve tried charging it, contacting Samsung support, using a wireless charger, and trying it with different devices (phone, laptop, etc.) but I just can‚Äôt get them to work.
I can honestly say I love these. The previous version was good, but these are 100x better. I will never go back to any other wireless Earbuds. I never leave the house without them. Thank you so much.

Had a set before they got lost. Love Samsung Electronics/ products. These newer versions are even better & I love this red! Comfortable for long periods of time easily portable & the ambient sound works wonderfully!

Way to go Samsung, I love the fit, sound is second to none, noise reduction is great and the ability  to allow some sound through is great for work in my case. Fit is great I have small ear canals and these fit perfectly.
the bass is amazing blocks out all noise. download samsung gear app to get access to full features, like the mode so you can hear someone calling you. i was blown away with the sound.
I'm a truck driver and these buds are great for cancelling the noice. I just love them. At the beginning your ears will hurts getting used to them but after that is a pleasure wearing them.

I wanted to love these as I have Bose version.  But they would not hold connection even with my Note 10+, I also kinda wonder if these were a return and they did not exactly match the picture on the site.

Compared to my +3 year old, original AirPods, these are impressively far better in the general sound but more importantly, they fit much more securely in my ears and I like the expanded control I have, including the ambient sound control with the touch and hold feature.I had to get the rubber accessories to make the AirPods fit better and stay in my ear during any mild activities. Now I don‚Äôt need to with these Buds+. So far, so good. I hope they are durable.

Extremely unsatisfied. These completely died within three weeks of purchase. Volume went to about 10% of normal on left earbud. Then the Bluetooth issues kicked in. No matter the device they connect and disconnect repeatedly every 4 or 5 seconds until they simply refuse to connect at all. Way too much money spent for these types of issues.

Nice earbuds, except the bass is just not there. I've tried changing settings, but other headsets just have way better bass.Voice quality is really good, and some of the little settings you can mess with are kinda fun.
Excellent fitting.  But Still lacking in bass, devoid of the richness in sound typical of headphone within the same price range..

I guess I just don't understand what's so great about them that warrants the price tag. I expected something of much better quality than a generic set. If I didn't have to go to Kohl's to return them, I'd return them.

The worked good for a short time.  Now (after 3 months or less) the right bud will not connect at all.  Tried all of the troubleshooting tips and notta.  Guess I got a dud?  Not sure I would recommend these

I thought these might work, but, alas, they hurt my ear too much.  I switched to the Avantree Mini Bluetooth 5.0 for small ears.  Even they were a little big with the built in wing, but I cut off the wing and now they're perfect.

Well they sounded dope while they worked 100%. I bought these day 1 and they were great. A month and a half later when I get a phone call they have a weird tinny sound to them and it's annoying to listen to. While listening to music or videos it sounds great. Phone calls sound like garbage.

My buds plus stopped charging after 5 months.  I called Samsung for help and they told me that they wound email me a shipping label for a return.  A week later, no label was sent.  I called again and they told me what the first agent said was wrong; that I'd have to register my product and go through an online process.  After registering I have been now notified that they'll get back to me in 3 days on what I can do.  Terrible service.

As much as I love my Samsung products, this is the second pair of buds I owned where the left ear stopped working. These were a birthday gift from my daughter and its sad I can't enjoy them. I would like an exchange. This is not right.
I love these headphones. Although the tap volume up and down doesn't work the greatest everything else about these headphones are amazing. Truly wireless with great battery life. üíì

Ordered these earbuds to replace my old AirPods because of their shrinking battery capacity. Very disappointed in the sound quality of the Galaxy Plus buds. Music playback (IPhone 11) has no depth very low volume, no bass. To hear the different sound modes, had to crank the volume near max to hear a difference. Will be returning these.

I love the design and functionality on these wireless are buds.  They fit in snugly and do not fall out when I am running, mountain biking, or snowboarding, just make sure the wing tip is secure inside your ear fold?  Love them! Would get the blue version next time though.
Had the Galaxy buds and bought these when they came out. Much improvement over the previous model in terms of battery live. I getuch more bass through the plus version. No complaints.
My wife did not like headphones because of not being able to hear some of the outside noises. This solved that problem and they fit and sound good.

When they work it‚Äôs actually fine, but they only work for a few times and then start messing up. It connects and disconnects. Ive sent them to get repairs and nothing is wrong with them but it still doesn‚Äôt connect. I got sent new ones and it started happening again. I have an iPhone so maybe that‚Äôs why. The first Samsung‚Äôs buds do work perfectly but these plus ones don‚Äôt.
If you are like me and like long battery life, this is one to get.  Also allow for long usage.Does not automatically switch between devices, but i can live with that.

Love love love! Took like 3 minutes to set up including downloading the app! Super easy! I was worried with my inner ear piercings that the fit would be uncomfortable and to my amazement it's NOT at all! I will say they are heavier than expected but not bad by any means! I %100 recommend these ear buds!

These earpieces work awesome with my Samsung 8+ compared to what I have used in the past.  The only complaint I would have is that supposedly, if you click 3x (earpiece) it would play the previous song (go back) but does not work.  However, clicking 2x to advance to next song works very well.
The sound is terrific. It doesn't do true noise cancellation, but it does have settings to let in ambient sound, which is a real necessity. They pair instantly and effortlessly with my Samsung phone.

Upgraded from gen 1 galaxy buds expecting to use the mutipoint connect feature between my Windows tablet and phone.  This feature is ONLY available on Galaxy phones with SmartThings installed.  This is strictly a software decision and could easily be incorporated to all devices, but Samsung decided to be proprietary and give false advertisement.  Not worth the upgrade.

***Long story short (This section is the whole review in a nutshell): These new Galaxy Buds+ are a SIGNIFICANT improvement over the original 2019 Galaxy Buds that released. I personally felt that the 2019 Galaxy Buds were a total failure for phone calls...and Samsung isn't lying when they say that they have improved call quality on these 2020 Galaxy Buds+! While many other reviews may have said that the ‚Äúslight‚Äù improvements to the new Galaxy Buds+ are worth it, I have to say that the call quality is a GIGANTIC improvement on these new 2020 Galaxy Buds+. The original form-factor from the 2019 Galaxy Buds has remained for the new 2020 Galaxy Buds+ (and that‚Äôs a good thing), the Buds+ case easily fits into your pocket without taking up too much space, the Buds+ go into your ears perfect each time, they fit snug and stay in for many hours without hurting, they weigh nothing, they charge fast and the bigger battery lasts forever, they sound EXCELLENT with plenty of highs and lows which is an improvement over the original 2019 Buds, and most importantly, they are FANTASTIC for phone calls! The new 2020 Galaxy Buds+ microphones DO NOT pick-up tons of background noise while you are on a call like the original 2019 Galaxy Buds did (and this part leaves me ecstatic). I want to point out that the new Galaxy Buds+ are not perfect, and they do pick-up background noise, but it is a completely acceptable level of background noise‚Ä¶and the new 2020 Galaxy Buds+ pick-up nowhere near as much background noise as the original 2019 Galaxy Buds did, and not as much background noise as the many other wireless buds that I‚Äôve tried including Apple Airpods 2nd Gen.***Why am I so happy?:

Customer support:  I couldn't get my buds to pair on Windows.  I used the online chat and was redirected to a support team that was supposedly specifically for the Buds+.  First CS rep was having multiple conversations and pasted an answer to another customer into my chat.  He told me completely useless and unrelated instructions originally, and then send me a link to pairing instructions last iteration of buds (not the Buds+).  After I informed him that I followed the steps, the chat went dead for 5 minutes.  I asked if he was still there and didn't get a response for another few so I just disconnected.  I called in and went through the automated workflow.  It very misleadingly tells you that you can additionally be sent an external repair center location, which actually just disconnects your call (instead of just sending you the location in parallel).  It tries to disconnect you again a second time by asking you to get support through text.  When I finally reached support, I was redirected to another line that is supposedly specifically for the Buds+.  The person on the line was very nice, but told me Windows was not supported (it is in fact supported!  I got it to pair like any normal Bluetooth hardware on both Windows and Mac...I had a hardware issue I wasn't able to diagnose until I got to test pairing on another machine).  I explicitly followed up and asked...so it's not supported on Windows even though it's a Bluetooth device and I was told yes.  Overall, the support was so bad, I had to dock the buds two stars because if anything goes wrong with these buds, you're probably screwed.Battery: It's long.  I tried to drain it to zero to get an estimate of how long it would last, but I simply could not listen to 11 hours of music in one day.  After about 4 hours of listening and a couple of hours of idling outside of the case, I still had about 60% battery left (don't try to extrapolate that, it might not be linear).
Don't fit in ear that good

I've used Bose Soundsports and Soundsport Frees, Jabra 65t Elites, and a slew of cheaper true wireless or semi-wireless (one wire connecting the two earbuds) units from Mpow, JVC, etc. These are, without a doubt, the best combination of comfort, size, battery life, sound quality, noise reduction, and call quality of all of them.The Soundsports sound good but aren't true wireless. The Soundsport Frees had good sound but were bulky and didn't feel secure in my ears while running (specifically, I have trouble with ear buds in my left ear). Battery life was average. The cheaper Mpow and JVC had poor sound quality and battery life and while they weren't as bulky as the Bose, they still stuck out of my ear.

According to my wife, I have an ear bud problem. I own or have owned at least a dozen sets of buds including the class leading Sony WF1000's, both the Jabra 65t and 75t, the original Galaxy Buds, Jaybird Vista's, and many others over the years. As I have tried to explain to my wife, this is necessary because every one of these devices have strengths and weaknesses but none can do it all really well. For example, the Jaybird Vista's are impervious to water and are very secure. Perfect when I run. However, after extended wear they become uncomfortable in my ears. The Sony's have the best sound and noise cancelling I have heard. Again though, somewhat awkward in the ear and no water proofing at all so no good for a workout. The Jabras are the closest but the 65t model is just too big by today's standards and the 75t has a seam that just starts to irritate my ear over time. Enter the Galaxy Buds Plus. You get good to great sound, moderate water resistance, and all day comfort. Oh, and that's a good thing because they get nearly 11 hours on a charge. So here are my pro's and con's to the Galaxy Buds Plus:The good:

Unfortunately, for me, I purchased these from Verizon to use with my Windows 10 PC.  I have bluetooth built into my rig and use windows 10 pro edition.  I bought these because I want to watch Netflix, Amazon Prime and other movies while doing my workouts.  I tried for some time to actually get these to be recognized and paired to my pc and finally did.  That's when all the troubles started to happen.  I won't go into too much detail, but to summarize, the connection was very unstable at best, the sound was not clear at all, and for some bizarre reason, it would actually cause my PC to freeze  and require a reboot.  It just wouldn't work no matter what I tried to do for work arounds and caused some unexplained serious pc problems as well.  PLEASE, if you are ordering these for watching streamed movies from your windows 10 pc, DON'T.  I'm sure it works just fine with your samsung phones, but that's about it.  Also, ordered mine from verizon, they had a great deal for less money than AMAZON, BUT BEWARE, they will charge a re-stocking fee of $50.00.  Youch!

These are terrific for iPhone users!  Apple earbuds were too loose. Samsung Buds fit great but didn‚Äôt pair well.Fit - My ear canal is a bit larger. I typically need to use the bigger spare bud size. Both med and large fit my ears really well but the large seals better so it brings out the base. Also, the Apple ones are loose in my ear. These are tight but not uncomfortable. I can already tell these are going to be great for snowboarding.

I had and loved my first Samsung Galaxy Buds and unfortunately lost one of the buds. Thankfully the Samsung Galaxy Buds + were announced and I picked them up day 1.The first thing you notice is the glossy instead of matte finish, but other than that they look exactly the same.
There's a reason I found it by the Galaxy phones and not in the fitness earphone aisles.Pros:

I bought these through samsung but let me first say I am apple all the way from iPhone iPad to airpods all generation including pros. I'm really invested in earbuds and headphones but lete say I had my doudts on these but had to give them a try. When it came to battery life blew my mind was an hour more then said on med volume. Sound quality is excellent I would say just as good as pros. Comfort is better then my pros the pros often hurt my ear like a suction type hurt these I have slept with them on. Call quality excellent but I feel pros had a bit more clarity on both ends of speakering and hearing. There is no noise cancelation which pros is so amazing I love playing with it but putting these in correctly make a good block of outside noise. The touch sensor I wish wasn't so sensitive but in all I find myself reaching for these more then my pros lately. Just make sure you get the app made a difference once I updated them

Here is the simple truth. AirPods Pro are the best wireless earbuds WITH the ANC feature. Galaxy Buds+ are the best wireless earbuds WITHOUT the ANC feature. The positives:- Great sound...sound better then AirPods

I'm sure that if you can get a good seal in your ears with these that they could sound decent.  I just got these and the largest size tips are barely a medium size in other types of tips.  I was searching for large but the largest these have are still way too small for my ears so I cannot get any type of seal.  I will see if I can find a substitute tip that will work for my ears, BUT, I am concerned about the tiny case these come in and any larger tips may not fit in the case for charging which will be a big problem.  I can't understand why they are designed the way they are...case is too small, tips are too small and because of the small case, this will limit tip substitutes.  I luckily get these using points I had from Samsung otherwise I would immediately send these back.  Even with correct size tips, not sure they will work due to their design...I am amazed of the overall good reviews for these...they all must have tiny ears.UPDATE- I was able to custom fit some SHURE foam tips I have using my Dremel tool to enlarge the hole on the foam tip so they would fit the earbuds.....did make that seal that is needed and did improve the sound a bit.  I also went back to my phone and located an app that allows you to increase the volume significantly.  Even after all that, I would rate these 2.5 stars, maybe 3 for sound quality....but, out of the box, these just don't work at all for fit and sound quality....you really have to do some work to make them sound just OK.

So far I am very pleased with these updated Galaxy Buds. The battery life can't be expressed enough as a virtue of these buds because I can finally use them through an entire workday without needing to recharge. They could have sounded like tin cans as long as the battery life met my expectations.But I'm pleased to report these do not in fact sound like tin cans, but instead very rich and full sound without distortion or lag when streaming video. I am not much of an audiophile but I am a music lover and I do not discriminate too heavily when judging wireless earbuds because the main bonus for having wireless buds is being able to listen as long as possible without fatiguing the ear or running out of power before the listener is done listening as well as not getting wrapped up in a cable when you get up from your desk to file some paperwork or refill your coffee cup.  And I am pleased to say that these check all of the above boxes and more.

I purchased these directly from Samsung as the color I wanted was  and still isout of stock here at Amazon at the time of this writing. I was excited to get these as my pre-existing wireless headphones had a really bad audio latency issue (like 1 second) that is really annoying while doing retro gaming on the S7 (I have emulators for basically every 16 bit system from the 80's and 90's, to include Neo Geo). I got the Buds+ in today, and while initially blown away with the quality of the audio, when I try to game on my S7 there seems to be some kind of conflict with the XBox One Wireless controller that also connects to it via Bluetooth. There is a split-second cut-out every 4-5 seconds and there are various audio defects, such as squeaking etc (if you've ever heard a badly record MP3 file you may know what I'm talking about). This issue wasn't present with the PowerBeats that these replaced. There is no audio latency now, but these are basically unusable for this activity and I'm pretty bummed. I googled the problem but didn't find anything or other complaints with the search query terms: Galaxy Buds, Wireless Controller, Conflict etc.This issue is only present when trying to use both the Buds+ and the Xbox One Wireless Controller (also knows as Microsoft Wireless Controller.

For wireless earbuds they do sound good however not as good as quality wired buds.  Charge quick and last quite well.  They do pair with our Samsung TV but the volume isn't very high and can't figure out how to change that.  TV remote shows earbuds on the screen when changing volume button but volume doesn't change.  If I get this to work ill update the review.  Bought mine directly from Samsung because had a $50 worth of points.Update.  In tha app there's a tab called lab.  In there you can set the buds to adjust the volume by touching the side of each bud.  Doing so allows you to increase the volume when pared to the TV.

These are my first pair of truly wireless earbuds. Coming from using mid-tier priced 'non-true' wireless earphones (strand or cord connecting both earphones or buds in the $50 range), for $150, I was expecting to be a bit more blown away. First things first, the sound quality is probably most important. It is pretty good, but I was expecting the highs to be a bit more cleaner and the bass to be a bit better and hit harder. Next the battery life is pretty good but from what I was hearing about them being the longest lasting true wireless earbuds on the market, I was expecting it to last longer than being wiped out after using intermittently throughout the workday. Microphone quality seems to be pretty good as I have no complaints and people can't tell I'm using earphones/buds. No active noise cancellation for $150 seems crazy but that was something I knew going in, I just expected the other factors to be better if ANC was not offered. Now the one thing that knocked off a whole star off the review is bluetooth multipoint/multidevice connectivity. My cheap $20 mpow bluetooth earphones handle multiple devices better than these galaxy buds! I connect these to my samsung android phone and computer. These earbuds don't automatically switch from one to another based on sound/voice output from the phone or computer like my cheap $20 mpow ones do! You have to manually open up the bluetooth settings on the phone or computer and hit 'connect' to switch. Next, my computer often goes to sleep throughout the workday. Everytime it turns on when I hit the mouse or keyboard, the buds switch over to the computer while I'm listening to music on my phone. Very annoying. My cheap $20 mpow bluetooth earphones don't do this. I'm quite flabbergasted Samsung hasn't figured this out for what these cost.

I put off buying wireless ear buds the past couple years but have been wanting a pair for the past year since the technology has been improving. I was going to get the original Galaxy Buds but I waited and boy am I glad I did!! I regularly wear hearing aids so I wanted some buds that would be clear and loud. So I found these after comparing them to all the higher priced and some lower prices competitors. So I went with the Buds Plus and Active Noise Cancelling aside, these are the best ear buds I've ever had. After finding the right combo of rubber tips that were sent with my new Buds Plus, I gave them a go. At first I was impressed with the clarity of the Buds Plus. I was listening to songs I'd heard many times before and I was hearing lyrics that I used to not be able to hear clearly. On the loudest setting with the right combo of tips and getting the ear buds snuggly into my ear, the volume level is sufficient and I listen to a lot of Sirius-XM Octane. I have a Galaxy S9 and I fugured out that if I find a song I like on Octane I can download it on Spotify and it gives me a volume level boost on Dynamic mode. The Ambient noise feature was also impressive and I really enjoy the Extreme setting in the Labs tab of the Galaxy Wearable app. If felt like I had hearing aids and earbuds in at the same time! With the added luxury of an 11-hour continuous charge, I haven't been able to run the battery down on these bad boys and I just finished a flight from Las Vegas to Omaha, Nebraska and then drove back. As far as the tap control goes, it is really cool and easy to use after getting used to the touch points and number of taps forneach function. If you want clean quality sounds with great technology at $100 less than comparable ear buds on the market, then these are an awesome deal. Phone calls, Zoom, and Video Conferences are all extremely clear and there is no lag while watching tv shows or videos. I give these babies a 9.3 out of 10.

The design is faulty. With the slightest wind, the wind noise gets amplified to the point that anyone speaking to you cannot hear you and you cannot hear music well. This means if you run. Faster than a 9 min/mile, the wind will interfere with sound quality and it worsens incrementally. So disappointing

These are great. I wanted the convenience of long battery life in a TRUE wireless bud, and these deliver. They are VERY comfortable, at least for my ears. They're also held securely in place with a slim silhouette, and no protruding stems. They recharge FAST.As far as sound quality, they're not Sennheiser 600s, but for this design and price point, they might be as good as it gets. I just don't have a way to benchmark them against competitors. But the convenience and ease of use make these a great product for all day use any time you like.

I've been using these buds on a daily basis for a few months, primarily for phone calls. I purchased these for comfort,  ease of use, and long battery life, and am very pleased with the results. As others have pointed out, the battery life is superb. Audio for music is good, and the settings allow customization of how much external audio to let in. iOS connectivity works just fine.For phone calls, there is a critical design flaw: there is no way to disable the dropping of calls that result from accidental touches or manipulation of the earbuds while on a call. Samsung has confirmed that it is not possible to disable or circumvent this behavior. Expect dropped calls, as, in my experience, it is almost impossible not to touch these earbuds in the wrong way.

I bought these to use with my Galaxy S9 phone. Whenever the phone is lower than my chest the connectivity takes a dump and calls become terrible. I tried calling Samsung but they weren't available. For $100 I don't expect to have to deal with any of this - I'm taking them back.For this price they should at least work when your phone is in your pocket.

I normally run wired earbuds with a DAP or Tidal hirez on my phone. I've heard a lot of ear buds in the $100- 300 range. These are surprisingly good. I originally got these to listen to podcasts at work where I would need some ambient sounds coming in. Now they're my daily drivers for music. One important thing: you need the correct tips. I have a whole bunch on hand to try (spinfit, comply, spiral dots). The foam ones while being the least comfortable, unfortunately give the best bass. The foam also grips better and the buds don't slip out even while sweating.

Lost my creative outlier wireless earbuds, which were great, and decided to try something different. Samsung earbuds sound great, are comfortable, and have features like the ambient feature which is very useful. Samsung also keeps updating software to add features over time.  I can wear them comfortably for hours without any problems. Features like being able to use google assistant, turn up, and down volumes from the buds themselves are all useful features.

The buds are good quality sound and have decent battery life. The problem is if you lose one of the buds, then Samsung charges almost the same cost to replace one bud as it is to buy a new set. On top of that, the Galaxy wearables app constantly reminds me to update the buds firmware, but it's unable to update without having both buds connected, so I'll just have to tolerate the pop ups forever. I also feel Samsung not making a replacement bud affordable causes unnecessary electronic waste which is bad for the environment.
